story:
LaPorte, Indiana is a dying town afflicted with a severe heroin problem and violent crime. Now a Seattleite, I grew up in LaPorte. I was lucky, and that's the only reason I made it out of there. Many of my friends never lived to be 21.

My friend, who is studying public relations and linguistics, sees the great opportunities in Seattle and will move here. Nothing will stop her from leaving LaPorte, but this campaign will certainly help make the transition more doable. 

She arrives September 24.


Here's a break-down of the monies needed:

$40 to mail a sousaphone to Seattle from LaPorte

$60 to mail additional stuff (instead of using a moving service since there isn't much stuff)

$200 towards a one-way plane ticket

$90 for a Washington id

$100 towards some basic furniture


More info:

My friend doesn't know I'm doing this yet.

Update: She knows about this now and is super excited to do some sousaphone marching!

story:
Twenty Percent of Our $50,000 Annual Budget Pays Rent

Being able to buy the house we now rent, and add on to it, would allow for us to add another living space for an on-site Program Coordinator.  Our next graduate will take that position and leave her room open for another mother and child.

  • Ashes to Beauty is a nonprofit that has been operating for 3 years with an all volunteer staff
  • We will be able to add another woman and child and start paying back debts by saving the cost of the rent of our 4 bedroom/3 bath house.
  • Buying the house will reduce our costs by 20%.

Please help us take the next steps to expansion and financial security.

We Need $250,000 to Buy House, Add On, and Make Repairs

We now pay $725/mo which is $8700/yr. If the owner adds on to the building, we will pay at least $900/mo.

  • To buy the house as it is will cost $200,000.  To build the addition will be $35,000,  To put a new roof on the house and repair some of the siding will cost another $15,000.
  • If we do not reach our goal we will use the money to offset the cost of rent for as long as the money lasts.
  • We are currently helping four women and two children and have a waiting list.

The Impact

Ashes to Beauty is transforming the lives of women and women with children with histories of drug addiction, physical abuse, and domestic violence.

  • These women almost all came from addicted parents and experienced sexual abuse as children. Children of addicts often become addicts because that is all they know. Ashes to Beauty breaks the generational cycle of abuse and addiction.
  • When you change one mom's life, you change the future of her children. There will be fewer children in foster homes, fewer women in jail, fewer crimes being committed.
  • Each of the women that leave the program leave with a GED, a career track, a network of healthy friends, and a bright future. Each woman has expressed a passion for helping others like themselves.  When we help one woman, the ripple effect is great.

Risks & Challenges

Our nonprofit organization has decided not to solicit grants because we don't want to be pressured into watering down the message of the gospel. The relationship that each woman develops with Jesus is the only reason this program works.

  • Even without a donor base we have been successful in meeting all of our basic needs.
We currently have several part-time volunteers who work 2-4 hours/week and only one full-time volunteer, the Executive Director.  This has limited our ability to do outreach.

  •  We plan on providing a living space for our next graduate free of charge in exchange for her help as a program coordinator.  One of her main duties will be to promote Ashes to Beauty to donors, coordinate fundraisers, and be a supervising eye when the Executive Director is not available.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please pray for us and let your friends know about the amazing work we are doing.

  • We operate a small food  business to help raise money to support the recovery program and to provide work experience for the women.  If you live in the Eugene/Springfield area, consider ordering meals from us.  Just go to our website to learn more about Vintner's Basket and Ashes to Beauty.
  • Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
Thank you and God bless you!

story:
My Story 

I was raised in an Italian kitchen and haven't been able to drop my wooden spoon. My Grandpa Notty taught me how to make the perfect meatball, and for years I have had a dream of starting my own meatball food truck. However, I wanted to dip my toe in the restaurant business first to make sure that I really could balance my job of being a kindergarten teacher with making hundreds of quality meatballs at a time. That's when I started my pop-up, StickBall, in which I popped up in different kitchens around the city selling my meatballs. Originally my theme was to have meatballs on sticks, like a kebab (hence the name StickBall). Sadly, my meatballs are just made with a little too much love and were too tender to stay on the sticks. I ended up sticking with the name but dropping the sticks. 

After a very successful year of doing different pop-ups and catering events, I decided that I wanted to take the next step to making my dreams come true and work toward getting a food truck. As many of you know, teachers don't quite make the big bucks, so my IGG campaign is to help me raise the start-up costs for my food truck and its set up. The average food truck start-up is anywhere from $50,000 - $100,000, but we have found one for $5,000. The extra money we are asking for will pay for the cost to drive the truck from New Jersey to New Orleans, repainting the truck, and initial set-up fees. Thanks for taking the time to read my story and look forward to serving you delicious meatballs from my food truck one day! 

Risks and challenges

As with anything that is starting from the ground up, I know there will be challenges along the way. One thing I am sure will cause some bumps in the road are permits. When it comes to vending food permits, it can get a little tricky, but we've done our research and feel very prepared for what's ahead. If for some reason food trucks become illegal or we are unable to get our food truck license, we plan to use all the money to launch and maintain our pop-up for the upcoming years. We would be able to buy better equipment and really step up our company.

I ended up sticking with the name but dropping the sticks. 
After a very successful year of doing different pop-ups and catering events, I decided that I wanted to take the next step to making my dreams come true and work toward getting a food truck. As many of you know, teachers don't quite make the big bucks, so my IGG campaign is to help me raise the start-up costs for my food truck and its set up. The average food truck start-up is anywhere from $50,000 - $100,000, but we have found one for $5,000. The extra money we are asking for will pay for the cost to drive the truck from New Jersey to New Orleans, repainting the truck, and initial set-up fees. Thanks for taking the time to read my story and look forward to serving you delicious meatballs from my food truck one day! 
Risks and challengesAs with anything that is starting from the ground up, I know there will be challenges along the way. One thing I am sure will cause some bumps in the road are permits. When it comes to vending food permits, it can get a little tricky, but we've done our research and feel very prepared for what's ahead. If for some reason food trucks become illegal or we are unable to get our food truck license, we plan to use all the money to launch and maintain our pop-up for the upcoming years. We would be able to buy better equipment and really step up our company.

story:
Think Before You Move

Chess & Community Conference, Inc. (CCC)  is a 501(c)(3) non-profit youth empowerment organization committed to developing leadership and promoting the success of at-risk youth in Athens, Georgia, and the surrounding areas. Our motto,Think Before You Move, encourages youth to evaluate their circumstances and plan steps to overcome them. CCC uses chess as a therapeutic model and an instrument for encouraging academic achievement, community engagement, and the utilization of critical thinking skills.  

Classic City Knights

The goal of this campaign is to take the Classic City Knights,  CCC's resident chess team and mentor group, to compete in the annual Bum Rush the Board chess tournament in Washington, D.C. (http://www.wblinc.org/brb-tournament/). Many of the students have never journeyed outside of their towns or the state of Georgia. This annual trip to Washington, D.C. will be a life-changing, eye opening, and educational experience for them.  Not only will they compete in the chess tournament, but they will also get an opportunity to tour the Nation’s Capital and Howard University. Many will learn that the world is bigger than their neighborhoods, and will get the opportunity to meet other youth from around the country to share in solutions for empowerment. 

On December 5-8, 2014, we will take 12 middle and high school students from Athens, Georgia, to Washington, D.C. for an annual chess tournament and touring of the Nation’s Capital.  The students will be chaperoned by three adolescent development mentors. We are seeking $5,000 to contribute to the following:

•  Round-trip transportation rental for students and chaperones  

•  Fuel costs (approximately 1,250 miles) and insurance

•  Experienced driver

•  Tournament fees

•  Hotel and food costs

•  Team t-shirts

•  Washington, D.C. tour guide 

In the event that we are unable to reach our maximum goal, we will reduce the number of students that we can take on this trip and limit other spending costs. The  success of the trip will ultimately be determined by what we are able to raise.  We have already begun local campaigning in hopes of covering expenses not mentioned.    

The Impact

We are extremely proud of our students. They have and continue to overcome many obstacles placed before them.  Despite the hands they were dealt, many of them maintain a positive outlook and attitude on life.  For some, chess has become the model for planning their lives, and for others, playing chess helps them escape the various cycles they are attempting to break. They continue to stay focused on their personal goals by engaging in community projects and events like this annual trip to Washington, D.C. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you prefer to become an in-kind sponsor by providing transportation, t-shirts, lodging, etc., please contact Lemuel LaRoche at chessandcommunity@gmail.com. 

Thank you for your support.


Founder and Director Lemuel LaRoche, MSW, earned his degree from the University of Georgia. LaRoche has over 15 years of experience in child and community development. He serves as a mentor, chess instructor and life coach for many teens in communities across Northeast Georgia.

story:
Hello,

   I am Adam Baker,I am a computer science art minor College student at Fayetteville State University. Recently, My book bag was stolen from me, and in that book bag was my Mac book pro, an LG G2 cell phone, and a JBL blue tooth speaker. As a college student I do not have the money to reclaim these items, and there is no way to recover what was stolen from me. I aspire to be come a computer programmer focusing on robotics, and/or be come a game designer. But because of recent events the tolls needed to build my future and hone my craft has been taken. 

Here's where you can help. Your donation can help me get back on my feet. Though my goal is high I will take what ever you can give. Please help, you generosity will be most appreciated. 

-Thank you so much

           Adam Spencer Baker

story:
Sometimes in life you meet people who have such big hearts that their kindness spills out wherever they live, work and play. Barbara is one of those special people. Selfless, always striving to make the world around her a better place for everyone in it. She is a joy to know.

After years of supporting her family after struggles and medical bills relating to her partner's stroke, Barb herself had a tragic accident. Falling eight feet into a well, she completely snapped her ankle. Because the foot had no pulse, the emergency response team feared she’d lose her foot, so they requested MedStar to fly her to the emergency room in Spokane.

By the way, she did fix the well with a broken foot while she was down at the bottom of the well waiting for help (of course, that’s Barb!). Even with decent medical coverage the medical bills are piling up. The MedStar helicopter transportation is around $16,000 alone. Please help Barb with any amount you can spare. If many of us share the weight of this burden it will become lighter, just as Barb and Jerri raise our spirits every day. Thank you!

story:
The Batwa are a pygmy ethnicity in Burundi, the world's third poorest nation, who traditionally were hunters and gatherers. This lifestyle is no longer viable. Yet without land, the Batwa cannot grow their own food.  By providing them with basic inputs and training in beekeeping, the Batwa will be able to enhance their caloric intake and earn money for their future. 


What We Need 

Participants in the program will receive a starter kit with a hive and use of group gloves, beekeeping suit, smoker and tools for extracting and storing honey. In addition, they will receive training and support on beekeeping, as well as help with production and marketing. Tevel staff and volunteers will be in the area working with the Batwa community on an ongoing basis throughout the year to support and supervise the project. 

We hope to support 20 of the neediest families through this project. If we surpass our fundraising goal, we will be able to include more families, and if we fall short, we will still run the project for a smaller number of participants.  

The Impact

As the result of this project, the Batwa will earn income from their honey and will have honey as an important caloric supplement to their meager diet. 

In parallel, Tevel staff and volunteers will be working with the community in a variety of projects in education, youth leadership, public health and women's empowerment based on the successful model we have used to transform communities in Nepal and Haiti. Read more about past success stories here.

    Spread the word

    Help us spread the word about this campaign and volunteer opportunities in Tevel  with your friends and family.

story:
Who we are...

Y.E.S. (Youth Empowerment Synergy) San Diego is an initiative created to connect LGBTQ youth, their allies and their parents to resources to build the best possible future. Founded by Hector Martinez and Ian Morton, the goal of this program is to break down the barriers between these individuals and their personal, professional and spiritual goals.

The 2014 Y.E.S. Conference:

Our signature event is a free, one-day conference for all of San Diego's LGBTQ youth to attend at San diego State University (SDSU). During this conference, we introduce young people to LGBTQ political, business and community leaders and offer a series of workshops geared toward finding success in their goals. We address cultural, professional, religious and collegiate environments as well as personal growth and healthy behaviors. 

The cost of the conference is $8,000, which covers the the space needed to hold approximately 250 attendees, as well as food & drinks for the day. While about 75% of our funding is procured through businesses and foundations, we also rely on community support to keep this conference free for youth and parents alike!

Our Impact:

Even in 2014, LGBTQ youth are more likely to engage in self-harming behavior, are at higher risk for suicide and HIV/STD infections, experience higher rates of homelessness and often fall out of scholastic pursuits. Y.E.S. San Diego creates access to safety net services, scholarship opportunities, internships and other tools to engage these youth in reaching their maximum potential as healthy and fulfilled adults!

    We continue to grow...

    Sometimes we feel like "the little engine that could". Y.E.S. San Diego began in 2012 as a small conference at Missiongathering church for about 80 youth. In 2013, we were invited to SDSU and had 165 registrations. This year, our goal is to reach 250 youth, which we are doing through a generous grant from the San Diego Human Dignity Foundation, which allowed us to hire a part time outreach worker for this all-volunteer event!

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Everyone's contribution is appreciated, whether through donations or volunteering. Folks can help by distributing posters and fliers, volunteering the day of the event or connecting us to other sources of funding. Does your business sponsor conferences or purchase ads in resource guides? Do you have an internship program you can promote at the conference? Contact Ian Morton at IanYES@sdhdf.org to discuss how you can help!

story:
Hello, I'm Jaeson Lane. Owner and Operator of the Headlight Restoration Specialists. I've been an auto detailer for the past 18 years. Specializing in paint correction and exterior polishing.  I could really use some help!

I am seeking funding for my small business. So that I may offer a headlight cleaning and restoration service. This business is important to society's safety, because my service restores brightness to dulled automobile headlight's. This business is important to me, because I have been focused on perfecting the art of polishing over the last 18 years and I am very excited to offer my skills to create a high quality business and to help create a much safer driving environment. As a preventive maintenance the restoration service that I offer, also includes an acrylic sealant application, to prevent any future build up of oxidation. 

The plan for these contributions is to allow me to offer this service in multiple locations through out San Diego County and surrounding areas, as well as build a mobile unit for home/ business service. It will also help to build a company that offers an exceptional service at an affordable price. A service that most everyone, can at some point see the need for. A service that I am more than excited to perform for anyone that has a need.  

    My company needs $10,000.00. This funding will be used specifically for 2 months of Marketing, employee training and payroll, equipment and tools for 2 locations, and location rent and/or gas to get to our mobile customers locations. 
    For your contributions, myself and my company will be forever grateful. We will honor our gratitude by placing your name on our website thanking you for your help, offer discounts on our services, or even offer unlimited free service! With the contribution, this business will be profitable within the first 2 months of operation. Any amount of contribution that is provided is greatly appreciated and any amount of funds collected will absolutely help in projecting this business towards success.
    I believe this business will help maintain safe driving conditions for vehicles during rainy, foggy, and night time driving.  I believe this can only impact our communities positively!  The impact that this service has on our communities is greatly needed, and also at an affordable price. 
    When an automobiles headlights have been brought back to life, it is not only safer for the driver and other drivers around, it also adds value to the aesthetic and price of a late model vehicle when being sold to a private party. 

    In the past I have worked for auto detail shops, mobile detailers, and car wash detail departments. Through out my 18 year experience, I have polished headlights on every model of vehicle from Accords to X-types. My knowledge in polishing both hard clear coat and soft acrylic allows me to consistently offer a precision service at an affordable price. Also, this knowledge will allow me to train many others to perform the level of quality that I have built a consistency for. 
      This is a simple business idea, offering a simple service. There is little competition for this service at an affordable price and there are many of "us" that would find this service very necessary. My plan is to offer this service to anyone looking to brighten up the look of their late model vehicle or any one that just cannot seem to get the clarity during their night time travels. 


      Finally, I completely understand if you want to contribute but just don't have the funds available. I truly appreciate the thought. Also if there is any way that we can help each other out, please feel free to contact me. If you want to help but cannot come up with any funding, please just help me to get the word out that I am offering this service. I am a mobile service. Please use the share tools that indiegogo has provided to help make some noise about this new company, The Headlight Restoration Specialists.

      Thank YOU!!!
story_txt:
Hello, I'm Jaeson Lane. Owner and Operator of the Headlight Restoration Specialists. I've been an auto detailer for the past 18 years. Specializing in paint correction and exterior polishing.  I could really use some help!



I am seeking funding for my small business. So that I may offer a headlight cleaning and restoration service. This business is important to society's safety, because my service restores brightness to dulled automobile headlight's. This business is important to me, because I have been focused on perfecting the art of polishing over the last 18 years and I am very excited to offer my skills to create a high quality business and to help create a much safer driving environment. As a preventive maintenance the restoration service that I offer, also includes an acrylic sealant application, to prevent any future build up of oxidation. 


The plan for these contributions is to allow me to offer this service in multiple locations through out San Diego County and surrounding areas, as well as build a mobile unit for home/ business service. It will also help to build a company that offers an exceptional service at an affordable price. A service that most everyone, can at some point see the need for. A service that I am more than excited to perform for anyone that has a need.  


My company needs $10,000.00. This funding will be used specifically for 2 months of Marketing, employee training and payroll, equipment and tools for 2 locations, and location rent and/or gas to get to our mobile customers locations. 
For your contributions, myself and my company will be forever grateful. We will honor our gratitude by placing your name on our website thanking you for your help, offer discounts on our services, or even offer unlimited free service! With the contribution, this business will be profitable within the first 2 months of operation. Any amount of contribution that is provided is greatly appreciated and any amount of funds collected will absolutely help in projecting this business towards success.
I believe this business will help maintain safe driving conditions for vehicles during rainy, foggy, and night time driving.  I believe this can only impact our communities positively!  The impact that this service has on our communities is greatly needed, and also at an affordable price. 


When an automobiles headlights have been brought back to life, it is not only safer for the driver and other drivers around, it also adds value to the aesthetic and price of a late model vehicle when being sold to a private party. 



In the past I have worked for auto detail shops, mobile detailers, and car wash detail departments. Through out my 18 year experience, I have polished headlights on every model of vehicle from Accords to X-types. My knowledge in polishing both hard clear coat and soft acrylic allows me to consistently offer a precision service at an affordable price. Also, this knowledge will allow me to train many others to perform the level of quality that I have built a consistency for. 

This is a simple business idea, offering a simple service. There is little competition for this service at an affordable price and there are many of "us" that would find this service very necessary. My plan is to offer this service to anyone looking to brighten up the look of their late model vehicle or any one that just cannot seem to get the clarity during their night time travels. 




Finally, I completely understand if you want to contribute but just don't have the funds available. I truly appreciate the thought. Also if there is any way that we can help each other out, please feel free to contact me. If you want to help but cannot come up with any funding, please just help me to get the word out that I am offering this service. I am a mobile service. Please use the share tools that indiegogo has provided to help make some noise about this new company, The Headlight Restoration Specialists.

  
Thank YOU!!!

story:
We have met our goal! I'm going to Haiti!

I just wanted to post an extra special thank you to EVERYONE that has contributed, both online and in person. You are an inspiration to ME as I am about to travel away from my sweet little family for the first time ever. I will take thoughts of you with me to Haiti and shower your love on the people I meet there.

Though I am saddened that my daughter will not be able to join us, I know that God will make a way for her to experience such a trip one day too.

***********************

My Story

I was 5 or 6 years old, sitting in the auditorium of our little school listening to them talk. A couple and their children were missionaries visiting our school to tell us their stories about the work that God was doing through them. They showed us photo after photo of hungry mothers with their babies, children in ragged clothing. My heart was clenched. In that moment I decided that would be me someday -- an international missionary. As I grew older though, I lost that vision. I got caught up in the distractions of life and moved on to other worthy goals. College. Graduate school. Marriage. Motherhood.

 But now, the time has come!

My name is Tori Prophet, follower of Christ, wife, and mother. I am asking for your help sending me to Cap Haitien, Haiti from April 22-28, 2012. With YOUR generosity, I will have the opportunity to travel to Haiti with my church, Church Project, and make that childhood dream come true. More importantly though, this is a chance to make a real and lasting impact in the lives of Haiti's vulnerable children. I am so excited about the chance to experience this culture and reach out to these sweet, sweet people.

 

The Impact

Embrace.

Partnering with New Life Haiti, our mission is to minister to the people of Cap Haitien both physically and spiritually. We will be the hands and feet of Christ, embracing the people and working to feed, clothe, build new schools and churches, fix broken water pipes, begin health initiatives, develop Vacation Bible Schools where children will have fun learning about the God who loves them, and support the educational efforts of those within the community who are trying to give back to their people.

 Equip.

By helping with the construction of schools and churches, we will give the people of Cap Haitien what they need to continue reaching out to their own communities. One well-constructed building becomes the center of life for a village. It becomes the place to get your basic needs met, the place to worship, the place where children learn, the place of safety from storms. A garden well-tended becomes their nutrition, their commerce, and their livelihood. We are also sending clothing and supplies to use for our projects. While we are there, other needs will surely present themselves and we will do all we can in response.

 

Empower.

We are traveling to a part of Haiti where help has been needed for so long, but has never been received. This mission trip will not only provide answers to immediate needs, it will empower the people of Cap Haitien to be able to meet their own needs long after our week is over. This is not a field trip, nor is it a vacation. This is a mission to pour ourselves into the lives of others to help them grow and thrive. And this is only the first of several trips. We will continue to travel to this village, bringing our help and resources for as long as God wills it.

 

Not only do I want to make an impact in the life of this village, I also want my children to learn from my example and be inspired. I want my children to cultivate a passion for being the hands and feet of Christ and for spreading God's love to all nations.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The goal I've set for this fundraiser is just to cover my travel. It is our bold prayer that you would give generously and sacrificially so that my 13 year old daughter can also travel with me and our church. It has long been my vision for each of my children to go on a mission trip and learn first hand the responsibility we have by being so blessed. Can you imagine the impact of such an experience on her entire life? Alexandra is a sweet girl with a heart for Christ, basketball, and filmmaking. She is as excited to visit Haiti as I am and plans to take her video camera with her to capture her journey.

 The cost for each person is $1300 which covers the cost of airfare, lodging, transportation, and meals. So, we would need $2600 for both of us to be able to go. This amount does not cover personal expenses such as passport, clothing, supplies, or gifts. We are holding a series of bake and craft sales to raise those additional funds. If I do not meet my goal, I will continue to fundraise, and the money raised here will be saved and used to send a member of my family on the 2nd trip to Haiti later this year. If we only raise enough for me to travel to Haiti, we will count it a tremendous blessing! Throughout this process, I will make updates to let you know how our efforts are progressing.

 

ALL DONORS will enjoy a Thank You e-card from us along with a link to a slideshow of the photos we will take while on our trip. Please see the perks to the right to learn of other fun ways we want to show you our gratitude for specific donations -- CDs and books, photo cards and posters.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  1. Eat! If you live in my local area, you can help by participating in one of my bake sales! See updates for details.
  2. Pray! Pray for the needed funds to be raised for all who wish to travel to Haiti. Pray for our safety and productivity, for the hearts of others to be broken for Haiti, for my husband and children who will miss me, and for me, that I will leave Haiti a better place than I found it.
  3. Love! Share your love, not just to the friends and family around you, but go out of your way to seek the lost, lonely, and suffering. Share my journey with everyone you know, encouraging them to donate what they can. Even $1 helps!

 

Special thanks to Ecclesia Houston for donating some of my perks!

 

Getting the Money

I have chosen to collect payments via PayPal so that I will receive the money immediately. It is IndieGoGo.com's policy to collect 4% if I meet my goal or 9% if I do not. PayPal will also collect fees. Please help me exceed my goal!

Special thanks to Ecclesia Houston for donating some of my perks!
 
Getting the Money

story:
I was recently let go from my full-time job and it couldn't have been a better blessing in disguise. Working harder than ever on my art has never felt so good, and I see now what I'm meant to be doing.

My name is Kèra and I specialize in lifestyle photography. The way I describe lifestyle photography is the ability to capture moments and the inner workings of one's self in a photograph. I worked on this specialty for many years, and I pride myself on being able to show people certain parts of themselves they maybe never knew they had.


After many years of training in photojournalism, portrait & event photography, I've decided it's time to go off on my own and kick start my own photography business. Though I wish starting a business could happen over night, I know it takes the right tools, heart & motivation to be successful.

By donating to my campaign you will be able to help me achieve my lifetime goal of pursuing professional photography full-time. Every contribution puts forth the ability for me to create better photographs & a better experience for all my current and future clients.

Through my research, I have decided to upgrade my camera to better my work and final product. All the money I raise here will go directly towards:

  • new camera body - Nikon D300-Nikon D800 (depending on how much I can raise here & save on my own)

  • new memory cards

  • updating my website

I'm not a big fan of asking for money, but by donating to my campaign you will also be able to get something in return! You will be able to pick any photograph off of my Facebook Fan Page & receive the print of your choice to keep by clicking one of the perks to the right.


I thank you from the bottom of my heart for taking the time to make my dreams come true. Whether it be spreading the word or donating a few dollars, it means the world to me.

 

* I apologize, but I will not be able to ship internationally.

story:
changeclothing

An apparel company using T-shirts to change the world for the better. 

ABOUT THIS PROJECT

changeclothing is an apparel company, and so much more. Our passion is creating positive change worldwide... starting with T-shirts as the foundation for this mission, and you as the “warrior of change.” Why T-shirts? Why you? Because we know that the real YOU is strongly reflected in the CLOTHES you wear. So by creating distinctive T-shirts that tell the world you support a deserving charitable organization, we can continue perpetuating significant positive change.

Right now, we're creating a network of forward-thinking artists and working with them to create art for the weekly campaign t-shirts.

What's a campaign?

We work hard to serve four distinct categories of need: Animal, Human, Earth and Outreach. Once a week, we partner with a charity in one category for a campaign, define a need for the charity, then design a shirt specifically for their charitable cause. The shirt then goes on sale for one week only. When you buy and wear one of these high quality, artistic T-shirts, a generous proceed of your purchase price will go to support that week's charitable cause. Change has never been easier! (Depending on the product sold and quantities sold, donations can run 20%, up to 40% of purchase prices)

So what’s the money for you may ask?

We're raising money to launch the site and for our first five campaigns. Here's how the funding will help:

  • The largest portion of funding will go towards funding production and development costs of the website itself, which are hefty!
  • To pay the t-shirt production costs. We’re not using Hanes Beefy T’s, only the good stuff!
  • To pay the t-shirt artists for their work. Not all artists are broke.
  • To fund the creation and execution of our marketing and promotional initiatives 


In short, we're raising money to help feed the human passion of creating change.

Our featured artist, Dave Short has designed a “limited edition” T-Shirt specifically for this Indiegogo campaign titled “Feed The Lion.”  Our theme title is not by accident, it has a message. "Feed The Lion" is a mantra that means "follow your passion, dreams and goals with tenacity. Feed them, and never give up." The Lion is your heart, focus and drive, FEED him.  So if you have the same hunger for positive change, and want to feed your passion, then hop aboard and "Feed The Lion."

changeclothing will send our limited edition T-shirts, stickers, and posters to those who pledge.

Let's Feed The Lion and change the world.

Thank you!


Justin Snyder
Founder, changeclothing, inc.

*For more photos relating to changeclothing, please click the tab labeled "Gallery" near the top.*


***Please specify size & color in the "comments box" section during checkout so we know which shirt to send***

story:
What Is The Outlet?

  • We are a collection of core volunteers who value the Tallahassee community, working to respond to a perceived lack of affordable mental health care.
  • We want to provide a variety of services including group and peer counseling, arts-based activities, a library of mental health literature for self-empowerment, and referrals to professional counseling. We hope to make mental health care more accessible for all.
  • Ultimately, we would like to financially assist individuals seeking professional counseling who can't afford it.
  • YOU will help us obtain a space to have confidential peer to peer counseling, informative workshops, referral services, and house materials for arts based activities.
  • The Outlet will also function as a safe space. A safe space is a positive, supportive, and accepting environment.  A safe space actively cultivates and maintains an atmosphere free from homophobia, racism, ableism, body negativity, sexism, classism, transphobia, oppressive behavior, and general hatefullness. 
  • This will be a place to learn and grow as a community; a place to have your neighbors help you out and help them when they need it.
  • We will hold daily office hours for individuals to be able to stop in and use the library, chat, play some music, make some art, or just rest their feet and drink some tea. Additionally, we will hold monthly group peer to peer counseling sessions related to specific topics picked by the community (eg. anxiety, relationship issues, depression, etc.)

More Specifically, What We Need Is...

  • $3600 for rent and utilities at The Oasis Center for one year!
  • $3000 for office supplies, including a computer!
  • $2500 for merchandise, including t-shirts, CDs, and a community projector for film screenings and presentations!
  • $2000 for music and art supplies to work on alternative approaches to mental health!
  • $1000 for food and drinks at our various community events!
  • $500 for furniture so our office can be comfortable to those looking for someone to talk to!
  • $400 for supplies necessary to print and distribute zines to empower our community!
  • $400 for liability insurance!
  • $100 for gas to use when we go on sober outing trips!

*All of this totals out to $13,500 BUT IndieGoGo takes a certain percentage of the money raised depending on whether or not we meet our goal. This is why the goal amount has been rounded up to $15,000!*

Why Are We Doing This?

According to Statehealthfacts.org, in 2010, Florida ranked 49th in the country for mental health funding with only $39.55 per capita. According to the CHSP Needs Assessment and Process Evaluation Final Report conducted in March 2010, in Leon County, "Availability of mental health services was viewed as a serious problem by mental health advocates. The number of adults receiving mental health treatment decreased from 4,544 in 2004-2005 to 2,714 in 2008-2009.

Tallahassee is a vibrant city with rich diversity. We want to pool our collective life experiences and use them as a resource to empower one another via mental health improvement. There is so much to learn and so much to teach, we want to help make that happen.

We want to help Florida!

Donors Receive...

$1 - We will stare wistfully out the window and whisper your name lovingly as we send positive vibes into the universe

$5 - You will receive 2 buttons with The Outlet logo designed by JLP!
(See pitcures of the buttons in the "Updates" Section)  

$10 - You will receive an unbleached, canvas patch with our logo printed in blue ink 
(See a pitcure of the patch in the "Updates" Section) 

$25 - You will receive a compilation CD comprised of song related to mental heath written and performed by local, Tallahassee musicians. The CD includes a booklet made by Rosie Richeson that contains lyrics, photos, and a short description of each song written by the songwriters

$50 - You will receive love, a button, a patch, a compilation CD, PLUS a 100 page zine called Let It Out! put together by Michelle Macchio and comprised of mental health related comics, poems, articles and art.
(See a pitcure of the cover in the "Updates" Section) 

$100 - You will receive a compilation CD PLUS A limited edition Outlet T-shirt designed by Mick Tangelo and printed on Next Level, 100% cotton shirts!
(See a pitcure of the design in the "Updates" Section) 

$250 - *Bundle!* You will receive all of the items mentioned above!: love, a button, a patch, a compilation CD, a copy of Let It Out! and an Outlet T-shirt!

$500 - ~*Super Bundle!!*~ You will receive love, a button, a patch, a compilation CD, a copy of Let It Out!, an Outlet T-shirt PLUS your name painted on a giant mural which will be hung in our office forever!

$1000 - *~*SUPER DUPER BUNDLE!!!*~* You will receive love, a button, a patch, a compilation CD, a copy of Let It Out!, a T-shirt, your name painted on our mural, PLUS a customized print handmad, framed, and designed with love by JLP

 

Other Ways You Can Help

TELL YOUR FRIENDS! TELL YOUR FAMILY!

Share this on Facebook, Twitter, tumblr, and other social networking sites!

If you're interested in sharing your knowledge via an informative workshop, offering your services, or if you want to get involved we would be happy to have you!

Contact us at theoutlettallahassee@gmail.com
Like us on Facebook!
Follow us on Tumblr!

$2000 for music and art supplies to work on alternative approaches to mental health!
$1000 for food and drinks at our various community events!
$500 for furniture so our office can be comfortable to those looking for someone to talk to!
$400 for supplies necessary to print and distribute zines to empower our community!
$400 for liability insurance!
$100 for gas to use when we go on sober outing trips!

*All of this totals out to $13,500 BUT IndieGoGo takes a certain percentage of the money raised depending on whether or not we meet our goal. This is why the goal amount has been rounded up to $15,000!*
Why Are We Doing This?
According to Statehealthfacts.org, in 2010, Florida ranked 49th in the country for mental health funding with only $39.55 per capita. According to the CHSP Needs Assessment and Process Evaluation Final Report conducted in March 2010, in Leon County, "Availability of mental health services was viewed as a serious problem by mental health advocates. The number of adults receiving mental health treatment decreased from 4,544 in 2004-2005 to 2,714 in 2008-2009.
Tallahassee is a vibrant city with rich diversity. We want to pool our collective life experiences and use them as a resource to empower one another via mental health improvement. There is so much to learn and so much to teach, we want to help make that happen.
We want to help Florida!
Donors Receive...


$1 - We will stare wistfully out the window and whisper your name lovingly as we send positive vibes into the universe
$5 - You will receive 2 buttons with The Outlet logo designed by JLP!(See pitcures of the buttons in the "Updates" Section)  
$10 - You will receive an unbleached, canvas patch with our logo printed in blue ink (See a pitcure of the patch in the "Updates" Section) 
$25 - You will receive a compilation CD comprised of song related to mental heath written and performed by local, Tallahassee musicians. The CD includes a booklet made by Rosie Richeson that contains lyrics, photos, and a short description of each song written by the songwriters
$50 - You will receive love, a button, a patch, a compilation CD, PLUS a 100 page zine called Let It Out! put together by Michelle Macchio and comprised of mental health related comics, poems, articles and art.(See a pitcure of the cover in the "Updates" Section) 
$100 - You will receive a compilation CD PLUS A limited edition Outlet T-shirt designed by Mick Tangelo and printed on Next Level, 100% cotton shirts!(See a pitcure of the design in the "Updates" Section) $250 - *Bundle!* You will receive all of the items mentioned above!: love, a button, a patch, a compilation CD, a copy of Let It Out! and an Outlet T-shirt!
$500 - ~*Super Bundle!!*~ You will receive love, a button, a patch, a compilation CD, a copy of Let It Out!, an Outlet T-shirt PLUS your name painted on a giant mural which will be hung in our office forever!
$1000 - *~*SUPER DUPER BUNDLE!!!*~* You will receive love, a button, a patch, a compilation CD, a copy of Let It Out!, a T-shirt, your name painted on our mural, PLUS a customized print handmad, framed, and designed with love by JLP
 
Other Ways You Can Help


TELL YOUR FRIENDS! TELL YOUR FAMILY!
Share this on Facebook, Twitter, tumblr, and other social networking sites!
If you're interested in sharing your knowledge via an informative workshop, offering your services, or if you want to get involved we would be happy to have you!
Contact us at theoutlettallahassee@gmail.comLike us on Facebook!Follow us on Tumblr!

story:
Soulance... Who are we?

We are a brand new, husband and wife, start-up company called Soulance.  A personal care and wellness product company, Soulance, is all about bringing your body and soul into a state of balance - hence the name - Soulance... balancing your soul.  

What do we do?

We have spent the last year developing, formulating and tweaking a line of three different and very specific Aromatherapy Oils which can be used in a relaxing bath or applied directly to your skin.  By using specifically formulated blends of essential oils and aromatherapy, we have created bath & body oils aimed at treating three typical areas in which most people seem to experience common imbalance: Muscle Recuperation, Cold & Sinus Relief & a Stress Release/Night Time Relaxer.

What is our philosophy?

Our philosophy, as a company, is that you can use our products to combat the negative impact of the outside "noise" created by our environment, by helping you to take a moment for yourself, hit your internal reset button and engage your five senses.  We believe that by engaging your senses in a positive manner, they have the power to help you find your OWN unique equilibrium.

So, why do we need your help? 

Not that long ago we did a soft launch of our Muscle Recuperation Bath & Body Oil to a group of about fifty family members and friends.

 

This is our first design

And here it is... just the label

 

The images above, were our original packaging concept and what we distributed to our test group. 

We got excellent feedback on the product itself, but we knew we had to work out the kinks with regard to the design.  What we had on paper didn't fully translate to the actual execution of the packaging in our hand.  In order to launch our product, we had to explore different options to resolve our issues.  In the process, we realized that while we really liked our original design...

...we just felt it could be better!  

 

Back to the drawing board!

We went back to one of our original inspirations.

...which was this...

... and this.

 

We did some legwork and found out that the designer for the brand above, in fact, lived and worked out of NYC, just like us!  We began a campaign to see if he would actually work with a small start-up company, and if so, would we be able to afford him.  After much persuasion and a lot of persistence, he agreed to meet with us. 

Meet our new designer....Alexander Esguerra!

Alexander Esguerra - www.loveandpaint.com

 

He is not only a great brand and product designer, but an extremely talented and acclaimed artist as well.  We feel very lucky to be working with him!

This is why we need your help!

In order to take advantage of this somewhat serendipitous opportunity, and elevate Soulance’s packaging and design to a much higher and sophisticated level, we need to increase our budget.  Before we can go into production for our Aromatherapy Bath & Body Oils, we know now, that we need to absolutely nail the brand and packaging design.

P.S.

On a side note, Alexander is designing the packaging not only for our bath & body oils, but also for our future products.  We will definitely let you know when we launch those as well.

How You Can Help and Reward Yourself...

Every donation counts– no matter the amount - so in andvance, THANK YOU VERY, VERY MUCH for whatever you can give!  But take a look at the incentive gifts at the different donation levels.  Find your inner balance and induldge yourself and those you love in an all natural, relaxing treat with an intoxicating aroma that leaves your skin feeling smooth and moisturized.  Thank you for helping us to achieve our goal and as a bonus, you will give yourself a much-deserved gift!

Thank you!

Be Soulance.  Be Proactive.

story:
-Information in English below!- 

På förekommen anledning känner jag att behöver specificera detta: Färdtjänst är inte en gratis tjänst! Jag betalar 790kr/mån, lika mycket som ett SL-kort hos kollektivtrafiken, trots att jag betalat detta får jag inga fler resor. 

 

Hjälp Christine att delta i samhället!

Hej!
Jag heter Christine Bylund, arbetar som scenkonstnär, klubbarrangör och funktionshinderaktivist bland annat. Jag studerar också genusvetenskap vid Stockholms Universitet. Jag är fysiskt funktionsnedsatt och använder mig av färdtjänst eftersom jag inte kan åka tunnelbana.
På grund av en ökad arbetsbörda (något som bara är kul som frilansare) och studietakt hade jag den 6.e maj förbukat mina 119 enkelresor som tilldelats mig av landstinget. De anser alltså att detta bör räcka för perioden 1 jan -30 jun och nu får jag vänta till den 1 juli för att få yttligare 42 resor tills den 30 september. I snitt 3 enkelresor i veckan.

Jag ansökte då om extra tilldelning och bad om resor under perioden 7.e maj till 30 juni för att kunna:

  1. Delta i planering och utförande av arbete
  2. Nyttja samhällsfunktioner såsom banker och bibliotek
  3. Och ta del av kultur-och fritidsaktiviteter  

Den 14.e maj avslog tillståndsgivningen mitt beslut med motivering att dessa resor inte kunde anses som väsentliga. Något som är mycket förbryllande. Jag ska självklart överklaga beslutet men under tiden behöver jag din hjälp.

Just nu måste jag åka vanlig taxi för att kunna ta mig till jobbupddrag, studier och fritidsaktiviteter, fika med vänner, handla och så vidare. Kort sagt allt som andra personer åker buss och tunnelbana till.
Det blir ju förstås väldigt dyrt, i snitt kostar en enkel resa 175 kronor - som student har jag inte hellre en så stor inkomst till att börja med.

Det skulle betyda otroligt mycket för mig om Du vill skänka något så att jag kan delta i samhällslivet på lika villkor i väntan på nya resor och beslut om överklagande. Mycket eller lite spelar ingen roll, alla bäckar små! 

Pengarna kommer jag enkomt att använda till resor och den som skänker kommer att få kontinuerliga uppdateringar om vad jag gör och hur överklagande och annan kamp fortskrider.

Om du skänker kommer jag att vara evigt tacksam över att du hjälpt mig att orka fortsätta kampen för alla människor lika värde.

Om du inte kan skänka något, vilket jag verkligen förstår, kan du engara dig genom att sprida ordet. Att veta att andra tänker på mig och sprider kunskap om situationen betyder också mycket.

 

Help Christine take part in society!

Hello!
My name is Christine Bylund, I work as a  performance-artist, club organizer and disability rights activist, amongst other things. I also study Gender Studies at Stockholm University. I am physically dis/abled and use a taxi-service provided by the Stockholm County because I can not ride the subway.
Due to an increased workload (something that is just fun as a freelancer) and study tempo, I found out on the 6.th of May that I had used the 119 one-way trips assigned to me by the County Council. They consider this to be sufficient for the period 1 of January -30 of June and now I have to wait until 1 July to get 42 additional travels until September 30th. On average, three one-way trips per week!

I then applied for  additional travels during the period May 7 to June 30 in order to:

  1. Participate in the planning and execution of work
  2. Use social functions such as banks and libraries
  3. And take part in cultural and leisure activities

On the 14th of May the County rejected my application on the grounds that these trips could not be regarded as essential. Something that is very puzzling. I will of course appeal the decision but in the meantime, I need your help.

Right now I have to use regular taxis to take me to work, studies and leisure activities, coffee with friends, shopping and so on. In short, everything that other people travel by bus and subway to do.
It obviously becomes very expensive, costing on average 18 Euros or 26 USD - as a student I do not have such a large income to begin with.

It would mean an awful lot to me if you would consider donating something so that I can participate in society on an equal basis while waiting for new travels and decisions on appeal my. The amount does not matter, everything counts!

The money raised will exclusivly be used for my travels and anyone contributing will recieve regular updates on what I am doing and how the situation is progressing.

If you donate, I will be eternally grateful for your help in my struggle for equality for everyone!

If you can not donate anything, which I really understand, you can take part by spreading the word. Knowing that others are thinking of me and spreading information about the situation means a lot

story:
Overview

We are the SouperVan. A healthy gourmet food truck normally operating at Rutgers University that is dedicated to alleviating hunger by donating a meal to the local soup kitchen for every meal that is purchased. In the aftermath of hurricane sandy, we made it our mission to try and soothe the weary bodies and souls of the victims and emergency responders of this horrible tragedy the only way we know how - by giving them free hot food. With your help, we can continue.

What We Need

We are looking for sponsorships to pay for food and fuel  to go out and serve both victims and emergency responders in the Tri-state areas that were most affected. 

  • A hot meal costs about $5 
  • We are hoping to beat our goal and raise $5,000 to distribute over 1,000 meals in the next couple of days.
  • All the money will go towards food and fuel for food trucks to sponsor outreach (minus the administrative costs of indiegogo)

What You Get

Depending on the amount you contribute you can get all kinds of stuff, from SouperVan pins, to social media shout-outs to being the recognized sponsor of the day. 

The Impact

Many communities around the Tri-state area have been devastated by Hurricane Sandy. A hot meal is a small way to help those who have lost power and possibly even their home have a moment of comfort and to also refuel and show appreciation to the emergency responders that are giving it their all in the freezing cold to help them.

Check out our Daily Updates

http://www.indiegogo.com/SouperVanSandy?c=activity&a=1720230 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, it doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please get the word out about our campaign.
  • Retweet fundraising and support posts on twitter @soupervan
  • Check out our twitter page: www.twitter.com/soupervan 
  • Like our facebook page: www.facebook.com/soupervan 

Thank you for supporting the work we are doing.

story:
Dating app, meet your night out

Hotdot is an app that helps you make more meaningful connections in the moment.

Online dating has been touted as an easy and fast way to connect with people. That becomes harder to believe when you spend hours and hours swiping followed by days and weeks in dead-end chats. Hotdot grew out of these frustrations that everyone seems to be having but no one is fixing. Co-founders, Miro and Eric, actually met after investing a lot of time on another app only to find that they weren't a good match. Basically what they realized was was that...

Other dating apps = a lot of effort for little in return

Like any other technology there are always areas for improvement and common hangups experienced by the users. We decided to focus on some of the top ones to find a better way. 

With many of the current apps out there problems arise when...

  • Users must "game" the apps in order to generate any value
Gaming Hotdot only reduces its usefulness
Creatively gaming other apps

  • Bots or phishing becomes prevalent

Hotdot's fundamental design makes it more difficult to create and maintain fraudulent accounts

  • Or you simply invest too much time on an app to meet a person that ends up clearly not being a good match 

Hotdot gets you off the couch swiping and messaging and out in the real world meeting people in real situations so you can know right away if there is real chemistry.

Source: imgur.com

With Hotdot we eliminate these common problems by truly bridging the gap between online dating and meeting people in the real world. We take all the great things these technologies provide us and blend them seamlessly with what it means to be human and meet face-to-face. 


Using Hotdot

Just by having fun and using Hotdot's sorting interface, a user creates a custom real-time map that consists of anonymous dots representing other users that they are interested in.


This map will guide users to areas of the city where their "type" is going out. Hotdotters will discover new places to go and can see when to go there based on what their map shows them. 


The Hotdot Map

Every Hotdotter's map is different and is based on the profiles they have indicated they are interested in. 

  1. Someone you like is a yellow dot
  2. Someone who likes you too is an orange dot
  3. When a mutual match is nearby they become a Hotdot and its time to connect


Find the hotspots that are right for you...


A neighborhood with a cluster of yellow dots means that could be a hotspot for your type. You could head there and see who you meet (they might only be yellow because they haven't seen your profile yet!)

A neighborhood with a cluster of orange dots means that is a hotspot for your type AND when you get there those orange dots will be Hotdots and you can connect and see where it goes. 


Hotdot enhances your night out


You are going to to go out anyway. With Hotdot you aren't limited to just meeting the people in the same establishment. You can now connect with people in the place next door, across the street or around the corner. With these mutual matches the ice is already broken, the introduction is made. Instead of sitting on an app and endlessly chatting, ask your match to meet up and grab a drink, a bite of food or just say hi. 

Hotdot is all about taking the advantages of the meeting people online and using them to enhance your night out. We want users to get face-to-face faster because no one is a better judge of if you are a match than you are.


Timeline

July - August

  • Indiegogo Campaign

August - October

  • App development
  •  Beta Tester involvement and contribution

October

  • App Launch
  • New York City promotion

Q3-Q4 2017

  • Begin introducing enhanced premium features
  • Further market promotions


New York City & Hotdot...a love story. 


While the app will be available across the US for download, at launch we will be focusing our efforts on getting the word out and building a community in New York City. We need to do this in order to make sure we hit a critical mass of users that will create a great experience for everyone in the city. That said, Beta Testers and other contributors to development can be located anywhere.

Once we have a strong community established in New York we will begin promoting Hotdot in other markets across the country. Which cities we go to next will depend on where there is opportunity and where YOU want us. 

Despite our plans of promoting Hotdot in various cities to build communities there is nothing keeping communities of users from sprouting up organically.  That's where you can help by spreading the word and helping to build communities in your city. 


Why we need your backing

Reason One:

Your contributions will go to two things. Development and Marketing.

We need some help to get our vision developed at a quality that you'll love for both iOS and Android. 

Contributions will also help us promote Hotdot and create a strong user base so everyone can have a great user experience. 

Reason Two:

Even more important than the actual pledges, we want to find people who are as excited as we are about Hotdot to be Beta Testers. We want to learn from you and use that to make Hotdot even better.

If you can't back us but you still want to help then tell your friends and followers about us. Let your single friends know about a great app that is coming. Every bit helps and every bit brings us closer to bringing our dream to the reality of so many people. 


Thank you!
-The Hotdot Team



Perks


$1 - Stay up-to-date:

Get emails to stay up-to-date on everything Hotdot.


$5 - Personal shout-out:

Get a big THANK YOU from the Hotdot team on social media.


$25 - Hotdot Swag:

Show you were an original backer of Hotdot with a piece of limited edition Hotdot branded swag. 


$35 - Premium Features for 1-Year:

Hotdot will be free to use but we will soon be introducing enhanced premium features. With this perk you will get all of them for free for 1 year. 


$50 - Early Adopter Lifetime Pass (500 Limit):

Hotdot will be free to use but we will soon be introducing enhanced premium features. With this perk you will get all of them for free for life. 


$75 - Lifetime Pass:

Hotdot will be free to use but we will soon be introducing enhanced premium features. With this perk you will get all of them for free for life.  


$100 - Official Hotdot Beta Tester:

Become an Official Beta Tester of Hotdot. We will be delivering to you early samples of the app for your evaluation and feedback. You will help us make Hotdot the best it can be. Oh, you also get a limited edition Indiegogo backer t-shirt and a LIFETIME pass for all premium features to come. That means that as we add premium features you'll never have to pay.


$200 - Elite Beta Tester:

As an Elite Beta Tester you get everything that Official Hotdot Beta Testers get but now you'll get access to even more. You will be closely involved with the Hotdot team and our developers. You will get special early access and your feedback will be given top priority. Your name will also go on our thank you page of our website.


$500 - Elite Beta Tester and VIP:

As an Elite Beta Tester and VIP you'll get access to everything that the Elite Beta Tester gets. As a VIP you will have a special place at our NYC launch party. Your name will also have a spot at the top section of our website's thank you page.


$1,000 - Lead Beta Tester:

You'll receive and get access to everything the Elite Beta Tester and VIP does but we are also adding you to our short list to join the Hotdot team as we grow. We want the most passionate, talented people who believe in our vision. We hope that is you.



FAQs

How will other users be able to see where I am?

When your map is turned on your general location will be represented by an anonymous dot to only those who have indicated they like you. There is a certain margin of error that will be programmed into your dot so that the general area is represented and not your exact location. No user can see your dot and your profile at the same time. This means there is no way for a user to know which dot represents what person. They only know that they like that person.


How do I use the map?

You use the map as you would Google Maps or other map apps. The main difference is it will be populated with anonymous dots representing users you have indicated you like. When you are zoomed out and looking at a large area you can look for areas that have a lot of people that you like (or a lot of mutual matches). Plan on going there! You’ll be more likely to meet someone that is your type. Once you’re in the area you can zoom in and connect with any mutual matches in the area and see where it goes.


When can I connect with matches?

You can only connect with mutual matches who are also within the same general area (a few hundred feet). Hotdot is all about complementing your everyday life in the real-world and not spending hours on your couch hoping to get a connection or a date.


What do you mean by “anonymous dots”?

We take your security very seriously. No user can tell what dot belongs to what person. You can never see someone’s profile AND dot at the same time. Maps of new users will not be populated until a sufficient number of profiles are liked making it impossible to tell which is which. When users connect they can see each other’s profile again and their dot immediately disappears off of the others map.


When I connect with a match, what happens to their dot

As soon as you connect with someone the dot representing their general location disappears off of your map. Your dot also disappears off of their map. Users cannot see your profile and your dot at the same time.


Why is Hotdot focusing on New York City first?

While the app will be available across the US for download, at launch we will be focusing our efforts on getting the word out and building a community in New York City. We need to do this in order to make sure we hit a critical mass of users that will create a great experience for everyone in the city. That said, Beta Testers and other contributors to development can be located anywhere.

Once we have a strong community established in New York we will begin promoting Hotdot in other markets across the country. Which cities we go to next will depend on where there is opportunity and where YOU want us.

Despite our plans of promoting Hotdot in various cities to build communities there is nothing keeping communities of users from sprouting up organically. That’s where you can help by spreading the word and helping to build communities in your city.


When will Hotdot come to my city?

The only thing stopping Hotdot from coming to any city is people knowing it's out there. We will be building awareness in more cities in the future. If you want us to prioritize your city let us know! In the meantime help spread the word and build a community near you.


How will Beta Testers help Hotdot?

We will be sending various types of early material to Beta Testers. They will have access to, and influence in shaping everything from user interfaces, additional features, premium features, profile formats, etc. Beta Tester’s will get a special place of thanks on our website as well as free lifetime access to any premium features introduced in the future. We look forward to working with you.


I’m not a Beta Tester but I still want to contribute to Hotdot. How can I help?

Not a Beta Tester? No problem. We plan on creating a forum for everyone to engage in conversation, get updates, weigh in and be a part of creating something awesome. More to come on this so stay tuned…


What premium features are planned for the future?

Right now we plan to provide the core experience of Hotdot for free. BUT there will soon be a number of premium enhancements that will provide you with an even better experience. While we haven’t finalized what those will be yet there will likely be a number of ways to “level-up” your profile giving you greater access to the city and better ways to connect.


When will premium features come to Hotdot?

We plan on introducing enhanced premium features to Hotdot once we feel we have gathered enough information from Hotdot’s Beta Testers and the community in general. We plan to keep the core Hotdot experience free and offer enhancements that add value to our users.
story_txt:
Dating app, meet your night outHotdot is an app that helps you make more meaningful connections in the moment.Online dating has been touted as an easy and fast way to connect with people. That becomes harder to believe when you spend hours and hours swiping followed by days and weeks in dead-end chats. Hotdot grew out of these frustrations that everyone seems to be having but no one is fixing. Co-founders, Miro and Eric, actually met after investing a lot of time on another app only to find that they weren't a good match. Basically what they realized was was that...Other dating apps = a lot of effort for little in return
Like any other technology there are always areas for improvement and common hangups experienced by the users. We decided to focus on some of the top ones to find a better way. With many of the current apps out there problems arise when...Users must "game" the apps in order to generate any valueGaming Hotdot only reduces its usefulnessCreatively gaming other apps
Bots or phishing becomes prevalent
Hotdot's fundamental design makes it more difficult to create and maintain fraudulent accounts
Or you simply invest too much time on an app to meet a person that ends up clearly not being a good match 
Hotdot gets you off the couch swiping and messaging and out in the real world meeting people in real situations so you can know right away if there is real chemistry.

Source: imgur.com
With Hotdot we eliminate these common problems by truly bridging the gap between online dating and meeting people in the real world. We take all the great things these technologies provide us and blend them seamlessly with what it means to be human and meet face-to-face. 

Using Hotdot

Just by having fun and using Hotdot's sorting interface, a user creates a custom real-time map that consists of anonymous dots representing other users that they are interested in.



This map will guide users to areas of the city where their "type" is going out. Hotdotters will discover new places to go and can see when to go there based on what their map shows them. 

The Hotdot Map
Every Hotdotter's map is different and is based on the profiles they have indicated they are interested in. 

Someone you like is a yellow dot
Someone who likes you too is an orange dot
When a mutual match is nearby they become a Hotdot and its time to connect



Find the hotspots that are right for you...

A neighborhood with a cluster of yellow dots means that could be a hotspot for your type. You could head there and see who you meet (they might only be yellow because they haven't seen your profile yet!)
A neighborhood with a cluster of orange dots means that is a hotspot for your type AND when you get there those orange dots will be Hotdots and you can connect and see where it goes. 

Hotdot enhances your night out

You are going to to go out anyway. With Hotdot you aren't limited to just meeting the people in the same establishment. You can now connect with people in the place next door, across the street or around the corner. With these mutual matches the ice is already broken, the introduction is made. Instead of sitting on an app and endlessly chatting, ask your match to meet up and grab a drink, a bite of food or just say hi. 
Hotdot is all about taking the advantages of the meeting people online and using them to enhance your night out. We want users to get face-to-face faster because no one is a better judge of if you are a match than you are.


Timeline
July - August
Indiegogo Campaign
August - October

App development
 Beta Tester involvement and contribution

October

App Launch
New York City promotion

Q3-Q4 2017

Begin introducing enhanced premium features
Further market promotions



New York City & Hotdot...a love story. 

While the app will be available across the US for download, at launch we will be focusing our efforts on getting the word out and building a community in New York City. We need to do this in order to make sure we hit a critical mass of users that will create a great experience for everyone in the city. That said, Beta Testers and other contributors to development can be located anywhere.


Once we have a strong community established in New York we will begin promoting Hotdot in other markets across the country. Which cities we go to next will depend on where there is opportunity and where YOU want us. 

Despite our plans of promoting Hotdot in various cities to build communities there is nothing keeping communities of users from sprouting up organically.  That's where you can help by spreading the word and helping to build communities in your city. 


Why we need your backing
Reason One:
Your contributions will go to two things. Development and Marketing.
We need some help to get our vision developed at a quality that you'll love for both iOS and Android. 
Contributions will also help us promote Hotdot and create a strong user base so everyone can have a great user experience. 
Reason Two:
Even more important than the actual pledges, we want to find people who are as excited as we are about Hotdot to be Beta Testers. We want to learn from you and use that to make Hotdot even better.
If you can't back us but you still want to help then tell your friends and followers about us. Let your single friends know about a great app that is coming. Every bit helps and every bit brings us closer to bringing our dream to the reality of so many people. 




Thank you!-The Hotdot Team



Perks

$1 - Stay up-to-date:
Get emails to stay up-to-date on everything Hotdot.

$5 - Personal shout-out:
Get a big THANK YOU from the Hotdot team on social media.

$25 - Hotdot Swag:
Show you were an original backer of Hotdot with a piece of limited edition Hotdot branded swag. 

$35 - Premium Features for 1-Year:
Hotdot will be free to use but we will soon be introducing enhanced premium features. With this perk you will get all of them for free for 1 year. 

$50 - Early Adopter Lifetime Pass (500 Limit):
Hotdot will be free to use but we will soon be introducing enhanced premium features. With this perk you will get all of them for free for life. 

$75 - Lifetime Pass:
Hotdot will be free to use but we will soon be introducing enhanced premium features. With this perk you will get all of them for free for life.  

$100 - Official Hotdot Beta Tester:
Become an Official Beta Tester of Hotdot. We will be delivering to you early samples of the app for your evaluation and feedback. You will help us make Hotdot the best it can be. Oh, you also get a limited edition Indiegogo backer t-shirt and a LIFETIME pass for all premium features to come. That means that as we add premium features you'll never have to pay.


$200 - Elite Beta Tester:As an Elite Beta Tester you get everything that Official Hotdot Beta Testers get but now you'll get access to even more. You will be closely involved with the Hotdot team and our developers. You will get special early access and your feedback will be given top priority. Your name will also go on our thank you page of our website.
$500 - Elite Beta Tester and VIP:
As an Elite Beta Tester and VIP you'll get access to everything that the Elite Beta Tester gets. As a VIP you will have a special place at our NYC launch party. Your name will also have a spot at the top section of our website's thank you page.

story:
Summary

Hello there, let us introduce ourselves.
We are a group of artists who go around and tries our best to cheer up others who are feeling the weather. Now, we have a plan to take it a step further by actually raising funds to be used in charitable purposes, i.e. donating them to Red Cross Canada, Doctors Without Borders, etc., plus using the funds to directly help the depressed by sending them a care package. We also hope that this will kickstart our journey to becoming a charity ourselves.

What'll You Get

Now, we already have some funds on hand, but we're still quite a ways short. We need your help to make this a reality and bring Minty plushies to BronyCAN!

Any amount above $20 (not including shipping, if applicable) will net you a finished plushie, available to be picked up at the convention or shipped to your doorstep with additional shipping fees using regular postal service, which we'll try to keep to a minimum for your benefit. 

You will be helping to helping the idea of "helping others doesn't really has to have defined limits" take off. When we first started Gift Pony, we had a destination in mind. To make it into an organisation that tries to help the sad, the unhappy, or simply those who are really in need of help. 

On the Subject of Trust

We'd be lying if we said that this campaign is going to be easy. We know that we are asking a lot and doesn't seem all that credible, given the start-up nature this campaign. Yeah, we know. We're not #horsefamous.

However, what we can do is to keep you updated on our production progress. We will also release some teasers on Patreon every now and then from now on. Visit patreon.com/thegiftpony for our work-in-progress drawings that we'll be premiering at BronyCAN this year.

Other Ways You Can Help

We also know that some of you really want to help, just not financially. Well, the next best thing you could do is to spread the word! Share it as much as you can and we'll give you a shoutout wherever possible! Just remember to tag us (@TheGiftPony) on Twitter so that we can find you easily.
