story:
The Idea

My partner, Malulani, and I, Jono, have what we think is an amazing idea. We want to do it to benefit the young people in our community.

We want to open a Coffee Lounge. 
We want our community's young people to run it, manage it, learn from it. 
We want to bring them in when they have nowhere to go, and no skills to succeed.

For New Zealand's population of 4.5million, suicide and domestic abuse rate are high. 
500 people a year take their own lives.
2700 are hospitalized from self harm.
Almost a fifth of these are 16-24 year olds.
New Zealand Police investigate over 100,000 family abuse cases every year.

We believe if we get the community's backing on this, we can make a difference. 
Malulani has many years experience in Hospitality, working as a head barista and in  front of house teams for cafes, restaurants, bars and hotels in New Zealand, Australia and and UK.
Jono has hospitality experience, serving in supervisory barista and front of house roles, as well as his current experience from his role working in project management, health and safety, and customer relations. 
We want to be the backing behind a team of young people, offering a unique lounge experience where anyone can come to relax, sit down and talk, have a snack or meal, laugh and be together. We'll teach them everything they need to know to succeed in the industry, front of house, bartending and barista, kitchen, and management.

Of course, this will be a safe place for them, and Jono and Malu will always be available to talk. We're not social workers and won't be trying to replace the important roles social workers and their teams have. But we are people, who have had our own experience and battles. Jono battled cancer at 13, lots of time off school and health issues to this day. He's a key member of the South Canterbury Child Cancer Foundation. Malu was displaced from home at a young age and knows how tough it can be to fend for yourself and mould yourself into the person you aim to be.

What do you say world? Can we make this happen? Can we start in a small corner of the world and expand to help young people everywhere? The world's our oyster.

What We Need & What You Get

We want to improve the lives of young people in our community. Having been knocked about a bit ourselves, this is our opportunity to give back for all the support we've received. Whilst we are running a business our main hiring line will be at risk youth, we will get to mentor them to excel in the hospitality industry and in turn they'll give back to the community by providing a unique dining experience. Something the whole community can be proud of!

The Impact

By supporting us you'll not only open up job opportunities for the at risk youth in South Canterbury, you'll give them the opportunity to learn new skills for their future. You'll give them a safe place with expert guidance and direction.

Other Ways You Can Help

Go out and make some noise for us! Tell your customers, your friends and workmates what we're doing and why you love it! Share our campaign and tell us why you think we would make a difference. Facebook, twitter, the corner shop, WE NEED YOU!


Donation notes

All funds received are given to The Lounge Project Limited with the express direction that they are used in this project only. 
Funding on Indiegogo is only received in limited currencies, we're a NZ company however we couldn't choose NZD

Authenticity: 
https://www.facebook.com/projectlounge 
http://i.stuff.co.nz/timaru-herald/news/7141672...

story:
CrossFit DC is Going to Regionals!

We're proud that six athletes in the CrossFit DC community have qualified for the CrossFit Games Mid-Atlantic Regionals! 

CrossFit DC will be well-represented by: 

  • Coach Ben B. 
  • Coach Jon C.
  • Coach Kate D. 
  • Devon D.
  • Julia L.
  • Dan S.
If you're reading this, you probably already know how insanely competitive the CrossFit Open is, and that even qualifying for Regionals is a major achievement. Now, these athletes need our help getting there.

Why They Need Help

Qualifying for Regionals requires full-time dedication, but for these athletes CrossFit is not their full-time job. 

They have work, school, families and other obligations. They aren't paid, and they aren't sponsored. 

Competing at this level requires plenty of sacrifice. Some of us in the CrossFit DC community created this campaign to help shoulder a small bit of that, so that our friends can focus on this important achievement. 

The Impact

All funds raised will cover direct costs of the team going to Regionals, including transportation to and housing in Atlanta, Georgia. 

It's not a lot, but it will go a long way in helping our team compete at CrossFit Regionals.

At CrossFit DC we always say: "Strength through community." This is an easy way to put those values into practice. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Keep an eye out on CrossFitDC.com social media (links below) for happy hour fundraisers at the box, with some cool prizes we've lined up.
  • Please SHARE this campaign with your friends on Facebook and Twitter!

story:
In 2015 over 570.000 refugees entered Europe via Lesvos. The local community and many volunteers stepped up to provide practical help. Since the EU - Turkey deal of March 2016 the number of new arrivals has diminished immensely. Currently around 7.000 refugees are waiting for their asylum procedure on Lesvos. Help for refugees and for the few new arrivals is properly organised on the island. Therefore I have decided, for now, to stop accepting donations and to focus on other ways of supporting refugees. Should the migrant influx change and if it is necessary that I recommence fundraising to help refugees I will let you know. 

Also on behalf of the refugees and the local community I wish to express my sincere gratitude for your heartwarming support since June 2015. Do you know a refugee living in your neighborhood? Please show him a warm smile next time you see him - he can probably use it! 

Wishing you the very best,
with my kind regards,

 

 

 

Hélène van Oudheusden 

 

How your donations were spent
From June '15 until May '16: € 10.013 was spent on sleeping bags, food and water, diapers/hygiene towels, breakfast for refugees via Breakfast Club Moria, clothes and shoes, diesel/engine repair for a local rescue boat, emergency blankets for refugees arriving with hypothermia, insect-repellent for refugees in camps on the mainland. A donation was made to Lighthouse Relief for their operations in Skala Sikamineas on Lesvos. To Starfish Foundation in Molyvos, Lesvos, an amount of € 11.000 was transferred.

How much did the campaign cost?
Indiegogo: platform fee 5%. For details on fees credit card/PayPal: Indiegogo 
Fundraiser: expenses 5%

 


 

(c) Photo Refugee children by Shaan R. Ali Photography
story_txt:
In 2015 over 570.000 refugees entered Europe via Lesvos. The local community and many volunteers stepped up to provide practical help. Since the EU - Turkey deal of March 2016 the number of new arrivals has diminished immensely. Currently around 7.000 refugees are waiting for their asylum procedure on Lesvos. Help for refugees and for the few new arrivals is properly organised on the island. Therefore I have decided, for now, to stop accepting donations and to focus on other ways of supporting refugees. Should the migrant influx change and if it is necessary that I recommence fundraising to help refugees I will let you know. Also on behalf of the refugees and the local community I wish to express my sincere gratitude for your heartwarming support since June 2015. Do you know a refugee living in your neighborhood? Please show him a warm smile next time you see him - he can probably use it!  Wishing you the very best,with my kind regards,    Hélène van Oudheusden  
How your donations were spentFrom June '15 until May '16: € 10.013 was spent on sleeping bags, food and water, diapers/hygiene towels, breakfast for refugees via Breakfast Club Moria, clothes and shoes, diesel/engine repair for a local rescue boat, emergency blankets for refugees arriving with hypothermia, insect-repellent for refugees in camps on the mainland. A donation was made to Lighthouse Relief for their operations in Skala Sikamineas on Lesvos. To Starfish Foundation in Molyvos, Lesvos, an amount of € 11.000 was transferred.

How much did the campaign cost?Indiegogo: platform fee 5%. For details on fees credit card/PayPal: Indiegogo Fundraiser: expenses 5%
  (c) Photo Refugee children by Shaan R. Ali Photography

story:
Trade Reviews. Leave A Review. Get A Review.

My name is Steve Young and for the last 2 years of the 15 we have been in business my internet marketing company has primarily helped businesses build their reputation online. There are 100's of local directory sites with their own system of star ratings and rules. What I have noticed is that it is not easy and many of the directories make it very difficult and sometimes downright impossible for a business to build their reputation because the sites choose which reviews they show also known as "filtering reviews".

That's right, the reviews left on the review site are technically their property and they can show whichever reviews they want. Many of the sites do not tell you why they filter reviews or their exact formula for filtering. Some sites have a history of manipulating the reviews they show while trying to extract advertising dollars from the business.
 
I believe businesses are being unfairly manipulated by some review sites and want to level the playing field. I have seen business after business all over the United States hurt by unfair review site practices and it is time that it stopped!

Your contributions to this campaign will help support a platform and system where business owners can easily, ethically and rightfully level the playing field and represent their true reputation on the major review directories. 

The Problem: Federal court OK with Yelp manipulating reviews...




Yelp has been manipulating reviews and now other review sites are starting to do the same.. where does it end? People are fed up with the unethical practices of Yelp, and  there are already people standing against Yelp to expose these injustices. A new documentary called "Billion Dollar Bully", set to come out in 2016, brings to light many of the unethical practices that Yelp practices on small business owners.

The Solution: Business Owners Unite - How It Works

This service is going to make it easier for businesses to build their 5 star reputation on the major directories without the worry of the review sites filtering their reviews.

What We Need & What You Get
Our total campaign goal is $60,000.  We plan on taking this money and developing a B2B private online membership where a business can join and learn how to responsibly give and receive real reviews both good and bad. Good reviews are posted online to the most important sites and will override the filters, while bad go directly to the member reviewed. 

Below is the list of perk packages for various contribution levels for your donation.

$5 - Thank You & 5 Star Reputation Checklist

$15 - Rep. Checklist & Website Mention

$25 - 1 Month Bronze Membership 

$50 - 2 Month Bronze Membership

$100 - 3 Month Bronze Membership

$200 - 2 Month Silver Membership

$300 - 3 Month Silver Membership

$400 - 4 Month Silver Membership

$500 - 3 Month Gold Membership

$750 - 4 Month Gold Membership

$1,000 - 5 Month Gold Membership

$3,000 - 6 Month Platinum Membership

$5,000 - 12 Month Platinum Membership

$10,000 - 24 Month Platinum Membership

We reserve the right to refund contributions for any reason.

The Impact

Reputation is everything these days! People don't choose a dentist, go to a movie or do anything these days without reading reviews. To give you a better idea of the impact that Yelp reviews have on the success and business flow of many small companies, please view the video below from the Washington Post, that investigates the accusations made about Yelp's filtration system.


Timeline


Risks & Challenges

All reviews sites have different rules and regulations. Some don't even adhere to their own rules and regulations and loosely enforce what suits them best. The user of our service will need to determine what directory they wish to use our service for and assume any potential risk. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate please share our campaign with friends, family and other business owners that might benefit from our service. Don't forget to use the tools right here on this page to share socially.

story: I'm raising 500 dollar to help my uncle Osman and his family to escape from Aleppo, Syria, to cross the border to Turkey. There they will have more security, and can start looking for ways to support themselves.

story:
Weple is a dynamic, fun, and game- changing social media network that outshines anything else out there on the market. It is built around streaming thumbnail videos that show you what is going on in the world, and connects users in cool, dynamic and fun ways. On Weple you  can share your social media experiences LIVE, stay connected and share moments as they happen in real-time. We are the only streaming platform on the market that provides users privacy functionality based around your life and your friends' natural navigational moments. On Weple, you can connect easily in groups or with the world. We make streaming live video fun, easy, private  and most important safe.

 Weple just launched on Apple and coming soon to Android & Windows


Weple needs your help to Grow and Help the World!

We have been working nonstop around the clock building users this amazing and game- changing  social media streaming network and now we need your help.  Pleased download Weple today and get seven friends on to Win cool signed Swag, like a signed Blake Shelton guitar, a signed Superbowl Championship Russell Wilson football, a signed Superbowl Championship Richard Sherman helmet and more.... We are giving away lots of free cash and prizes for simply downloading with Seven friends. You can even win straight cash for simply streaming random acts of  kindness videos to #wepleworld or #upgradeyourworld. 

We are working hard to expand Weple and finish our Android, Windows and Web versions of Weple. You can help by simply telling your friends, spreading the word,  by downloading Weple today or by donating to the production of the final touches to Android and Windows. With your help we can grow Weple into the most successful social media platform ever.


                                       You may ask: Why do we need Weple? 

We have Twitter, Facebook, Snapchat, Periscope and You tube, Weple outshines all of the above. We are Social Streaming.  This is an innovative, unique and founder patented platform that is poised to lead the future of social media-  private group video streaming and public broadcasting. We provide both private and public access in an integrative way, and we give back to causes that help you and the World!! Does anyone else do that?

We have big plans for the world and with your help We can bring them to fruition. We recognize Earth is at a tipping point and we know that if we all come together there isn't anything we can't do to help the World. So Weple is doing something about it, enabling all of us to do something about it by simply having fun and sharing our lives.

We recognize that many governments aren't going to come together to help,  but that doesn't have to stop the people. Weple, stands for "we the people" and is built to bring us together for fun and to help us use the normal functionality of our lives to give back and help our World. We believe all corporations should do good and give back and Weple will be at the forefront of this, showing people where our 10% of profits  are going and how our users are making a difference. On Weple, we will allow users a way to get involved and help out, providing great call- to- actions,  and cool experiences to stream and share together.  At Weple, we recognize  that we are all in this together and that together we can make a huge change.


Now a little more about Weple's Social Media Streaming Platform!

Weple is the most dynamic and naturally intuitive social media network yet. Allowing our users a free way to communicate, connect and share their lives in ways that they haven't been able to before. Designed for relevance, we integrate natural social organization and interactions with the user's content. This distinction allows people to share with the world, or limit sharing to only relevant content with specific social groups, like friends, family, besties, and more...... because Weple recognizes "not all friends are created equal" and certain things should be kept private.

Not every user wants to stream every aspect of their lives with everybody else. So we are made for World streaming, as well as, private social streaming. On Weple, users have the ability to easily chose who, where and when they want to stream.

Our stream capabilities include, live, shared, uploaded and curated.

Finally, we deliver cutting edge cool navigation, hashtags, low bandwidth thumbnails (saves batteries and data), trending categories within groups, streams pinned to categories on profile pages (think video Pinterest for both your videos and public videos), and extended search capabilities. 

So yes, on Weple, you can hashtag your favorite topic, friend or group and see only relevant videos to your Search and store cool videos and your favorite moments easily on your profile page. 

Weple is the social media network you've always wanted, with really cool streaming videos. 

We're easy to use and fun to watch. 

Now More on Weple's Social Sustainability Mission 

We recognize climate change is the greatest threat facing EARTH, the animals and the next generation. We recognize we are at EARTH'S tipping point and we must act now.  We are determined to do our part in building the best social media network out, that actually helps our users and the World by giving back. We're dedicating 10% of our profits to sustaining and replanting Earth's rainforests and other socially responsible issues that help brighten and create a kinder, better, healthier World. As we grow, we will up this to 20%. Giving back is one of our companies core value. Imagine if Facebook, Twitter, or Snapchat gave 10% of their profits to replanting the rainforests. Well we are!! We plan to be the next major social media platform in the world, Weple's founder owns the U.S. utility patent for "mobile device media streaming" we feel sure that the success of Weple is in our future, and that with your help we can make great impacts benefiting Earth and our planet for many generations to come.


Weple is changing the game in social media. Weple has been built to bring people together and help save the planet. We recognize innately that this is a big job and the most important one of our time.
A special message from Mya 

Here is a special message from Weple's CME (Child Marketing Executive), Mya Cunningham, who takes great pride in helping Weple protect the rainforests and Earth. Please help her mission and insure her chance for a better healthier Earth in her future by donating  to Weple's launch today. 

She is also modeling our cool hats!

Why start with the Rainforests?
We are already in the 6th mass extinction of planet Earth according to scientists at Stanford, and it's getting hotter and hotter by the day. The bottom line is we need Earth's lungs to cool us down, keep our air clean, and purify and make our drinking  water. According to livescience: 

  • About half of the world's tropical forests have been cleared (FAO) in the last 35 years. Earth has gotten progressively hotter throughout this time.
  • Rainforests help keep the world's weather in check- they regulate both  temperature and weather patterns.
  • Rainforests are one of the world's primary carbon sinks, which reduce toxic levels of carbon dioxide from the atmosphere.
  • A fifth of our fresh water is found in tropical rainforests, the Amazon basin to be exact.
  • Rainforests help to maintain our supply of drinking water and fresh water, (via rain all over the world) and are critical in Earth's sustainability.
  • Forests currently cover about 30 percent of the world’s land mass (National Geographic)
  • Forest loss can contribute as much greenhouse gas emissions (12-25%) as all the world's trains planes and automobiles.(13%) 
  • About 36 football fields worth of trees are lost every minute. (World Wildlife Fund (WWF))
  • 1 in 4 ingredients in our medicines are found in Rainforests.
  • Within 4 square miles  of tropical rainforest, you will find 1500 flowering plant species, 750 types of trees,  many of these plants being crucial to combatting cancer.
  • Over 70% or more of the plants that are used to combat cancer are found only in the tropical rainforests of the planet.
  • Less than 1% of the species of plants in the tropical rainforests have actually been analyzed to determine there value in the world of medicine.
  • Scientists believe that there are millions of plant, insect and animal species in the rainforests that have yet to discovered.
  • Rainforests are threatened every day, especially by agriculture, ranching, logging and mining.
  • The majority of the oxygen supply that we have throughout the world is supplied by the tropical rainforests , even though they are miles and miles away.

Great Facts:


For more information and to Download Weple on Apple go to our Website http://www.weple.com/  follow us on twitter https://twitter.com/WepleWorld & Facebook https://www.facebook.com/pages/Weple/848420395204518?ref=hl

story:
2015: A year to mobilize

Communities living in the Arctic and Sápmi have a history of fighting injustices on indigenous lands. A growing example is climate change. This year the global climate movement is stepping up to protect a world we love and are dependent on. By joining forces, this is an injustice we can, want and must overturn together.

This is a crucial year to mobilize: The climate talks in Paris in December (COP21) is a big moment for us all to seize. We want to create a platform for Sámi, an indigenous people living in Sápmi (Northern Norway, Sweden, Finland & Russia), to mobilize for the climate and against injustice. 

And to do this, we need your help!

Photo: Carl-Johan Utsi

We will provide Sámi activists, organizers, campaigners and artists with a space to gather in Jokkmokk on August 28-30. A space to share skills, build relationships and develop collective plans for challenging injustice. This weekend will strengthen our community and help build mobilisation plans ahead of the climate talks in Paris. Do you think this plan should be made a reality?

Make this weekend possible by chipping into our Sápmi mobilization crowdfund.

WHO WE ARE

We are Jenni Laiti & Max Mackhé, two grassroots organisers in Sápmi. Jenni lives in Jokkmokk, Sweden, and is full-time artivist, Max lives in Skånland, Norway, and is a culture worker and artist.

We already have support from the climate justice organisation 350.org, the artivist group Suohpanterror and the film festival Sápmi Indigenous Film & Arts Festival Dellie Maa but now we need your help too to make this weekend the best possible.

We see the need to mobilise Sámi grassroots on environmental issues and for COP21 in Paris!


WHERE THE MONEY WILL GO

This weekend, some of the most successful activists in this region of the Arctic will travel to Jokkmokk. We want people to meet and learn from each other - experienced and beginners, young and old, from all across Sápmi (which stretches across the north of Norway, Sweden, Finland and Russia)

The money from this crowdfund will mean that participants' and activists' travel costs can be paid for - ensuring that this weekend is accessible to all our allies.

You can read more about the weekend on this website: act.350.org/signup/saami_skillshare/

HOW CLIMATE CHANGE IS IMPACTING OUR PEOPLE

“If climate change continues at this rate, we won't have any reindeer left because reindeer won´t survive and adapt. And it goes too fast, they won't be able to adapt. I have been working with reindeer only 14 years now, but this  last ten years we haven't had a normal winter. Last ten years, the climate and temperature change from day to day and that makes snow compact and sometimes with ice layers and if the snow is too compact, the reindeer can´t smell food. If they doesn´t find food it is very simple, and then it starv to death. If this climate change keeps going on at this rate, I´m pretty sure that the reindeer won´t survive it, it goes too fast right now. And without the reindeer, the Sámi culture will also disappear and world will be a indigenous people poorer.” Niila Inga, Reindeer herder, Kiruna, Sweden. 

Niila is also planning to attend our skillshare weekend. 


SHOW YOUR SUPPORT

Any support, from 10 USD to 1000 USD, is hugely appreciated.

Please share this widely using the sharing tools below. Tell your friends and family about this event, and if you care deeply about these issues and live in Sápmi.

PROGRAM FOR THE WEEKEND

Here you can find the program: 

http://act.350.org/signup/saami_skillshare/

   HOW CLIMATE CHANGE IS IMPACTING OUR PEOPLE  
“If climate change continues at this rate, we won't have any reindeer left because reindeer won´t survive and adapt. And it goes too fast, they won't be able to adapt. I have been working with reindeer only 14 years now, but this  last ten years we haven't had a normal winter. Last ten years, the climate and temperature change from day to day and that makes snow compact and sometimes with ice layers and if the snow is too compact, the reindeer can´t smell food. If they doesn´t find food it is very simple, and then it starv to death. If this climate change keeps going on at this rate, I´m pretty sure that the reindeer won´t survive it, it goes too fast right now. And without the reindeer, the Sámi culture will also disappear and world will be a indigenous people poorer.” Niila Inga, Reindeer herder, Kiruna, Sweden. 
Niila is also planning to attend our skillshare weekend. 



SHOW YOUR SUPPORT
 Any support, from 10 USD to 1000 USD, is hugely appreciated.
Please share this widely using the sharing tools below. Tell your friends and family about this event, and if you care deeply about these issues and live in Sápmi.

PROGRAM FOR THE WEEKEND
Here you can find the program: 
http://act.350.org/signup/saami_skillshare/

story:
Welcome to Calacas Y Maracas!  (Skeletons with Maracas )

  Skinz N Bonez and Soul Sweepers yearly stroll through the French Quarter welcoming the fall season.

  We began a tradition last year to raise awareness for animal rescue in the New Orleans area, and this year we specifically chose to honor the Pet Asylum in the French Quarter.   

  We also chose the month of October because of "Dia De Los Muertos"  or Day of the Dead.   The holiday focuses on gatherings of family and friends to pray for and remember friends and family members who have died.  Each October families put together Altars or "Ofrendas"  honoring the deceased using sugar skulls, marigolds, and the favorite foods and beverages of the departed, and visiting graves with these as gifts.  Dia De Los Muertos is a month long celebration of Altars and gifts leading up to November 2nd:  "ALL SOULS DAY".   We will recreate a moving Altar crawl, with YOU as a key player.

  As a participant, you will get to dress up in traditional (or outlandish!) skeleton garb, then march with Skinz N Bonez and The Soul Sweepers on our annual Pub and Altar Crawl.   You will be raising awareness of  the Day of the Dead, and local Animal Rescue efforts.  We urge you to bring drums, incense, pictures of those who have passed, offerings for those who have gone before you, and your personal 'Joie de Vivre" as we drum and dance sing and chant our way to the designated stops.

  Each stop will have a happy hour special for those who participate.  We will also have a donation station on our Altar Float for those who wish to give more.

  Partial Proceeds of this campaign will go to help the Pet Asylum located at 513 Dumaine in the Historic French Quarter.  Although they aren't officially a Pet Rescue Group, they often find themselves out there helping the community, searching for lost pets and returning them, helping injured animals, and finding homes for the abandoned.  They have been a touchstone for animal lovers in New Orleans and an ambassador to the world: as the closest pet resource to the hotel district for visitors who bring the WHOLE family  We'd like to extend a hand to them for all the good they do for their community. 

These stops will be for face painting along the route.   We will stagger our painters as we stroll downriver.

just added... 4pm facepainting at Big Mamas Lounge 229 Decatur Street

The Kerry 331 Decatur St  -  six pm

Molly's on Toulouse 732 Toulouse  St

The Stops ON THE ALTAR CRAWL are

we will begin at the Kerry!

The Kerry 331 Decatur St    six pm

Erin Rose  811 Conti     7:00 pm

Fahy's Irish Pub 540 Burgundy    8:00 pm

Lafittes in Exile 901 Bourbon S   9:30 pm

then a jaunt down to and past Lafittes Blacksmith Shop 941 Bourbon St at 10pm

ending at Spitfire 627 St Peter by 11pm midnight  where we will enjoy the rest of the evening.

times are tentative according to how we roll.   we will be on facebook and twitter with updates as the crawl moves.


  We URGE you to dress for Day Of The Dead or as a Skeleton.  If you need your face painted?  We will accommodate in the perks section.  Our artists are skilled and do a beautiful job of recreating sugar skulls.  Please, take a look in the 'pictures' section you will see some of the beauty from last year, and maybe draw some inspiration for your own unique skeleton costume.

  Our Altar Crawl will be led by "El Brujo", who will guide us through the French Quarter as we present an altar to each of the watering holes we will stop at.  El Brujo is non other than the infamous Jose Torres-Tama,  Latino Performance Artist. Our Soul Sweepers will brush aside all previous Grisgris and open the door for the new season's stroll.  Each altar will be created by one of the members of Skinz N Bonez to honor that specific location.  

  This is a fabulous romp through the Historic French Quarter on many streets named by the Spanish and the French who came before us.  In the most reverent way possible, we will call out for those to walk with us.  Dogs are a major element within the veiled world and lead the way for those passed to those living.  Therefore we will honor all pets who protect and serve the living.  Dia De Los Muertos is a month long celebration leading up to Nov 2nd: ALL SOULS DAY. 

  Come Join us for this wonderful stroll through the Historic Quarter with New Orleans only female bone gang....    Listen to the drums, hear the whispers of those who came before us, and celebrate the beginning of the fall season.

SKINZ N BONEZ AND SOUL SWEEPERS

CLICKITY CLACK WE GOT YOUR BACK

find us on facebook, and twitter  #bonegangnola

story:
So it's here again, Love Fellowship's 3rd Annual Holiday Dinner! I am very excited for what this year has to bring! Looking forward to helping everyone have a better holiday and you can help too. To make things happen, it takes money. The money will go towards getting the kids gifts for the holidays, getting clothes and blankets for people in need of them, food to feed the hungry, ect. Now, I know this is a tough time if year to donate, but whatever you can give is greatly appreciated.  Thanks for your donations and may God bless you during this holiday season!!!

Event Date: December 20, 2014 @3pm
Place: 2322 S 7th Street
              Camden NJ 08103

story:
...and the patients' right of Self-Determination

In Norway, the public health system is supposed to take care of all illnesses. However, in case of vector-borne infections, that is not the case.

While the Norwegian health system looks the other way when people do not get well in accordance with the system’s standard, MD Rolf Luneng helped sick people all over Scandinavia. The Norwegian Appeal Board for Health Personnel rewards him by withdrawing his authorization to practice medicine.

Today patients not getting treatment, or not getting well, in the public health system have no other options than to seek medical help outside Norway.

In a lot of other countries a patient can go to a private clinic and get proper and sufficient tests and treatment, in Norway that option has effectively been closed by the authorities.

The mission of public health is to ensure conditions in which people can be healthy, but in this case:

  • public providers do not impart full, accurate and unbiased information, and are hindering these patients in making informed decisions about their own health care.
  • the patients are left abandoned by the public health system – that is not referring them to another provider willing and ready to take over their care.

Rolf Luneng's Proceedings against the Norwegian Appeal Board for Health Personnel

Now this brave doctor has taken legal proceedings against the health authorities to get his authorization back and to force the authorities to PROVE that the guidelines and the public treatment is ADEQUATE and SUFFICIENT, and that the treatment he gave his patients is WRONG!

The Support Group

Rolf Luneng is in need of fund-raising to finance the legal work necessary prior to taking this lawsuit to court, as well as the costs involved in carrying through this lawsuit in the Norwegian legal system. Secondarily, we will act as mediators between contributors/former patients/relatives - who wish to contribute with their own stories and other relevant information - and the attorneys.

Thank you for supporting Rolf Luneng’s Proceedings against The Norwegian Appeal Board for Health Personnel – perhaps the most important lawsuit in 2015…

story:
Raising the High Tunnel

When Ray and I started the greenhouses and farm operation ten years ago at Windcrest, "heirloom", "local", and "foodie" were not terms you heard much when folks talked about food. Even "organic" was hard to find in our area - no Trader Joe's, no Eathfare, no Whole Foods, no organic section at supermarket. The restaurant scene was mostly chain or "Mom and Pop" and few food entrepreneurs were sourcing from small local farmers . But upon the eve of the Great Recession, we took a leap of faith and put all of our resources and energy into creating Windcrest Farm, one of the first USDA Certified Organic farms in our region.

Over the last few years we have seen a vibrant and healthy food culture rise from the awareness that food needs to be local, clean and fresh to keep our families and our community healthy. We've seen our products in the hands of talented, creative and inspired chefs. We seen more interest in gardening and home-cooked meals. Area farmers markets are thriving. And each year we have expanded our production area and gained experience in producing the best quality, nutritionally dense, certified organic local produce possible. In an age of uncertain and extreme weather patterns, and the fact that much of the produce in this country is grown in a now drought-stricken California, Ray and I feel we are in the right place and at the right time to increase our contribution to our local food system. By using high tunnels to extend the growing seasons and protect crops from weather and pest pressures, we having been growing more produce, more efficiently and more reliably.

Unfortunately, we have lost one-third of our production area during our recent record-breaking snowfall that collapsed of our 30' x 90' high tunnel. At a time when we are positioned to make the dream of the last ten year's work hard work come true and offer more of our unique, certified organic produce to the local community, we, like many small farmers, are faced with a loss that may make the difference between success and struggle.

There are no subsidies or disaster relief funds, and despite what we were led to believe, no insurance payments, to help us recover this loss. Despite Ray's best efforts it appears the damage is beyond repair. Not only have we lost this valuable structure, but stand to lose the yields of the upcoming growing season. With the support of several dear Windcrest Farm friends, we have been encouraged to reach out to the community of people that value what we do and ask for a donation to replace the collapsed high tunnel.

What We Need

Here's what we need to be back in production this spring:

  • High Tunnel frame and plastic to replace the destroyed tunnel: $17,500
  • Any funds we receive will go towards construction of season extension structures at Windcrest Farm.

What You Get

Our life's work is to provide nutritional dense, organic and sustainable products for our community. So it makes sense we want to give you the opportunity to experience the fruits of our labor. From produce to plants, education to experience, fruits to spices, we want you to share in Windcrest Farm.

The Impact

By replacing the lost high tunnel, we can move forward with our 2014 spring planting season and carry out our crop rotation plan which includes planting this year's ginger and turmeric crop.

  • Your contribution helps keep one of the few USDA Certified Organic farms in the Charlotte-metro sustainable.
  • In our tenth year, we will maximize the full potential of this structure to provide food all year.
  • We've learned so much from this experience and will share it with beginning and experienced farmers.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't make a financial contribution? You can still help! Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign:

  • Use Indiegogo share tools
  • Use your social media circles
  • Let me know if you would like me to share our experience with your community group.

story:
Youth Creating Change, 2014

Homies Organizing on a Mission to Empower Youth (HOMEY) 

WHAT WE DO: At HOMEY, we provide at-risk/in-risk youth with support groups, 21st Century Skill development, and college preparation.  The mission of HOMEY is to transform the lives of high-risk youth (ages 13 to 24) by improving their educational outcomes and ability to be self-sufficient. We inspire youth to strive toward physical, mental and emotional health through the youth development practices of relationship and skill building and community engagement activities. For over a decade, HOMEY has been a recognized leader within the youth leadership development field. 


THE NEED WE ADDRESS:  Did you know, that despite San Francisco’s central role in the technology industry, Latino and African-American youth continue to do poorly in our city? In 2012, 44% of Latino and 66% of African American youth dropped out of high school. At HOMEY, we believe that high dropout rates are also correlated to youth incarceration and homicides. A recent report stated that of all homicide victims in San Francisco, 38% were youth and young adults between the ages of 14 to 25, and of those victims 94% were high school dropouts. 

HOW YOU CAN HELP: We have received a challenge grant up to $12,000! The matching funds we raise will go directly to our Part Time Youth Group Facilitator and help with program costs. 

More about our programs...

Through dedicated and creative leadership, HOMEY has developed a safe place for street-identified and high risk Latino youth to find respite, guidance, encouragement and alternatives so they can pursue their potential academically, creatively and socially.  Using an in-depth cultural framework, HOMEY provides youth with innovative strategies to build motivation, knowledge and insight. Community involvement is emphasized to build compassion, networking and civic engagement.  HOMEY turns lives around! Check out the HOMEY Video.

  • 80% of HOMEY’s high-risk participants show an improvement in school attendance and letter grades.
  • 3500+ hours of service with youth annually
  • 92% of participants reported enhanced enjoyment and engagement in learning as a result of the program
  • 90% success rate in participant’s increase in self esteem
  • 300% increase in program participation since 2011
  • 6 San Francisco high schools on waiting list for HOMEY programming
  • In an independent evaluation, participants scored HOMEY a 4.5 out of 5 in support, engagement, interaction, intentional skill building, and increased linkages with school day.

HOMEY/YCC Volunteers

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't provide financial support, you can support HOMEY in other ways:

  • Share the word about our campaign with friends
  • For your silk-screen needs (t-shirts, bags, etc.) Use our Social Enterprise, Native Graphix! Profits support our programming! 
  • http://www.nativegraphixsf.com/
  • Sign up to volunteer with HOMEY!

Thank you for supporting San Francisco youth!

story:
Michael Alzamora is an artist, volunteer and marathon runner – he also lives with schizophrenia. First diagnosed in 1988, Michael hasn’t let mental illness stop him. His art has been shown in galleries across Ontario; he is a dedicated volunteer at the Schizophrenia Society of Ontario (SSO) and has already completed seven full marathons. But he still has one important goal to reach…

Michael wants to achieve his dream of running one of the largest Marathons in the world, the 2014 New York City Marathon. On Sunday, November 2, Michael will run the 42.2 km competing with over 50,000 runners –  but he needs your help to get there.

Role model for strength, empowerment and hope

Michael is committed to his running. He trains 6 days a week, maintains a special diet to stay in shape and runs with various groups. Once a week he volunteers at SSO and is determined to bring hope and empowerment to others living with a mental illness.

Make Michael’s dream reality

Thanks to the generosity of Achilles Canada, Michael’s entry fee to the marathon has already been paid for. Michael still needs $3,000.00 to cover additional expenses such as flights and accommodations for both him and his running guide. We are asking for your financial support to make this happen!

Let’s work together and help Michael get to New York!

Michael’s hope is to raise $3,000. However, anything raised over this goal will be donated to SSO to help families and individuals living with schizophrenia through counselling, education, support, research and advocacy.

Donate and spread the word!

This  is only possible with your support. Tell others about Michael and donate to his cause! Please share this page with all your friends and family through social media! Let’s cheer Michael on and get him to New York, Go Michael Go!

Let’s work together…
take action spread the word
DONATE today!
#gomichaelgo

Our Campaign Team

Host: Schizophrenia Society of Ontario (SSO)
Partner Organization: Achilles Canada
Committee: Pierina Cincinnato, Philip James de Vries, Alexander Ross

You can find out more about Michael's running, painting, and experiences with schizophrenia by visiting his website: www3.sympatico.ca/michael.alzamora/

story:
Update - October 3rd: Funded in two days! Thanks everyone! You're a great community.

This secures the core of the project (steps 1 and 3). I'll start working on the DEP this week-end.

There's a stretch goal at €6000 for improving the architecture of Django templates (step 2). Let's see if we can reach it! :-)

The project

The Django Template Language has a long history of receiving criticism for its design and its performance. During the last few years, the idea of replacing it with Jinja2 has come up regularly.

While the two languages have superficially similar syntax, they're quite different. Forcing a transition upon the entire Django ecosystem isn't realistic.

I'm proposing to solve this problem in Django 1.8 by:

  • supporting some alternate template engines such as Jinja2 out of the box
  • keeping the Django Template Language as the default template engine
  • defining a stable API for integrating third-party template engines
  • supporting multiple template engines within the same Django project

This will provide a standardized way to use Jinja2 templates in Django projects and to ship Jinja2 templates with pluggable apps.

Furthermore this will pave the path to template-based form rendering.

I'm planning to split the project in three parts. Steps 1 and 3 are the core of the project. Step 2 isn't strictly required but it would allow for a more consistent implementation of step 3.

Each step should require about forty hours of work if everything goes well — which isn't the most likely outcome, but I'm prepared to take the time this project will require :-)

Step 1: write a Django Enhancement Proposal (DEP)

I'll start by researching the subject and designing the implementation. I've already performed preliminary analysis and sketched APIs in order to validate my ideas before starting this campaign. But I still have many decisions to make, details to check, and blanks to fill.

The output of this step will be a DEP that:

  • expands the rationale summarized above
  • arguments design decisions
  • outlines an implementation plan
  • provides guidelines for third-party template engines
  • answers frequently asked questions
  • analyzes the features of Django templates
  • surveys other Python template engines

I will discuss and improve the DEP until consensus is reached.

Step 2: refactor Django templates as a library (stretch goal)

Unlike other Python template engines, Django templates are configured with global settings. That makes them hard to test or use as a library outside a Django project. This issue is discussed in ticket #17093 and in a mailing-list thread. Unfortunately, Christopher Medrela's patch wasn't merged and it doesn't apply any more.

My project is a good opportunity to complete this refactoring. It will bring Django templates up to par with other engines, make future maintenance easier, and is expected to provide a more robust base for implementing the DEP.

I will tackle this step if the campaign raises at least €6000.

Step 3: implement the DEP

You know the drill: code, tests, docs ;-)

That's nothing fancy but good software takes time, especially under strong backward-compatibility requirements.

Communication

Throughout the project, I will post weekly or fortnightly updates on the django-developers mailing-list and on the project's website. In each message, I will:

  • describe what I've been doing
  • explain what problems I encountered, if any, and what solutions I chose
  • announce what I'm planning to do next
  • talk about open questions and ask for feedback

About me

I've been a Django core developer since 2011.

With more than 50 commits touching `django.template` or `django.templatetags`, I know Django's template engine very well.

I have contributed several large features to Django:

  • timezone-aware handling of datetimes (1.4)
  • support for Python 3 (1.5) with the help of other committers
  • overhaul of transaction management (1.6)
  • app-loading refactor (1.7)

I haven't started working on a feature for Django 1.8 yet. If this campaign succeeds, it will be Jinja2!

Why Indiegogo?

An interesting question — after all I've been doing a lot of work for free during the last four years.

For each of the features listed above, I had a strong motivation. I worked on timezones to prove I could join the core team. I worked on Python 3 because I couldn't stand Python 2 any more. I worked on transactions and app-loading because my professional projects had hit Django's limitations in these areas.

Django templates are a different case. I'm happy with them for simple projects. They work quite well considering how they're designed and implemented. If I need something else, I know what my options are.

I'd like to improve Django in this area because I'm hearing demand from the community. However I'm not ready to dedicate so much of my free time without compensation for my family. Your gifts will allow me to give this project the attention it deserves and motivate me to produce the very best work I can manage.

If the campaign raises more than €8000 (which both the Migrations and PostgreSQL campaigns did) I will give back 20% of the proceeds above this limit to the Django Software Foundation and 5% to the Ada Initiative.

This campaign is my own. It isn't an official Django one. However, both the Django Software Foundation and the Django core team have given their approval.

Risks

Even the most carefully planned software project carries some risks. Unexpected edge cases can appear. Seemingly good design can be hard to implement cleanly.

However, considering my past experience with projects of similar size, I'm confident that I can resolve or sidestep such issues. Here are two examples:

  • When I started working on transactions, I didn't realize that my plan would add savepoints around every ORM operation, throwing off `assertNumQueries` in tests. After a long debate, I solved the problem by adding a keyword argument to the `atomic` context manager.
  • Near the end of my implementation of time zone support, I discovered two problems in the admin, one with date hierarchies, the other and datetime widgets. Since I wasn't able to fix them, I documented them as known limitations in Django 1.4. Eventually they were fixed in Django 1.6.

There's also a small risk that the Django core team or technical board will object to my design or my implementation. However, I have already obtained positive feedback on the general design from several core developers and most members of the technical board. I have also committed more backwards-incompatible and more complicated changes to Django before.

How to help

If you like this project, even if you can't contribute directly, there are many ways you can help!

  • Subscribe to the django-developers mailing list and participate in design discussions
  • Try the new features, once they make it into Django's developement version
  • Write a backend for your favorite template engine and validate the APIs
  • Right now, talk about the project! I'm not very good at this whole social media thing :-)

Thank you!

story:
Our Story

MomsWithMS.com was created after realizing the need. Women, diagnosed with multiple sclerosis 3-2x as often as men, typically get diagnosed with multiple sclerosis between ages 20-40 (more info). This is also the “fertile years” of a woman's life when we are either having babies, trying to have babies or actively trying NOT to have babies. This raises questions about if they want babies, and even more about the prescriptions and if it is ok to take them while pregnant/nursing etc. Up until this site was created there was not place for moms to discuss sensitive issues typically not discussed in mixed company to share their experiences and get support from each other.

Since the launch over 700 moms diagnosed with multiple sclerosis have joined the site from all over the world. We have been mentioned 2 times in national publications and also 2 times in local publications (Press page here). Since launch I have been getting testimonials like the following on a regular basis:


"Having MS was confusing and frustrating.  When I was rushed to the hospital for the second time, after my myriad of questions, my doctor said, "This is the weirdest disease."  Therefore, the fact that Kristin created Moms with MS is astounding.  Having children to me is the most important adventure I have undertaken.  To have something such as MS hold me back is disheartening.  However, to be able to go to a site where others are confronted with the same obstacles is a blessing and I have Kristin to thank for it.
Sincerely and Wholeheartedly,
A.C." (mom with ms)


Soon after launching the site I found that not just moms but the husbands, kids, siblings and parents of some of the moms were attempting to join the site. To maintain the privacy of members, these kind hearted people were turned away. At one point a 'sister' site that was called something like "She has MS" to let these people connect but it was not as successful, I dropped that project and focused on supporting the site for moms.

Eventually the solution to this issue was found, an affiliated public site with a blog of stories and news written by moms with MS, fundraiser information, press, links to resources, and more was created MomsWithMS.org. We are also a national team for the NMSS Walk and Bike events, raising in excess of $20,000 in our first year (2010) and almost $25,000 this year, and so having a site to refer donors to became even more important.

So here we are now, and we have a thriving online community at MomsWithMS.com with over 700 moms, connected in this journey of raising our kids while dealing with this unpredictable diagnosis. This part of this whole effort is almost completely hidden from public view.

We also have the public site, which most of the moms aren't really a part of that talks about achievements and how great the site and community are but isn't actually connected to THE community that started it all.

What we need is to integrate the two sites into one.

This campaign is to make this possible.


The Impact YOU Will Make!!


  • Moms with MS looking for connection and anyone looking to understand or support them can come to the same site for information.  

    • No more moms signing up at the public site thinking it's private or family members applying to the private site and getting a rejection for not being a mom with MS, one single place to sign on that gets them whatever access and information appropriate to them.

  • More easily accessible posting methods to contribute to the public part of the site.

    • No more requiring moms who want to contribute to learn/remember multiple posting methods or logins to share a story publicly vs privately.

  • More time to spend promoting the site and spreading awareness so that other moms with ms who are going through these challenges alone can find the site and get support.

    • Less time rejecting non-moms and explaining that it is just for moms but they can go to this other site, and less time confusing moms who are looking for this thriving community but end up just signing up to be able to post comments or get information. 

  • More time to be able to look into the benefits of becoming at some point more than a site, but an actual non-profit or mission based B-corporation that provides more than community for members.

  • Improved SEO

    • The two sites will no longer be competing when someone does a search for "moms with ms" and the high rankings will go even higher. 

  • Kristin (I) will be able to finish up with writing a retrospective covering the why and how of creating and promoting the community in the first place to educate people who find a similar niche in need of representation have the information they need to make it happen (will be available in both digital and paper formats).

  • Once CiviCRM releases the wordpress version of their application better communication with members, donors, readers, and more will be possible.



What You Get

In addition to the perks listed on the side you will also get the satisfaction of knowing that you improved the lives of hundreds, hopefully soon thousands of people who are looking for the peer support they need in their journey of life as a mom with multiple sclerosis.



Other Ways You Can Help


You can help us by spreading the word that we exist I find that most people know someone affected by this disease even if they don't talk about it.

  • Spreading word about this campaign 

  • RT our updates as you see them on Twitter  @momswithms

  • If there are events in your area to fight this disease, you can participate in the events, you can even do it by registering your team under our national "Moms With MS" team to help raise awareness.

I welcome business mentors who can provide informed recommendations for how to better promote/establish the project into a non-profit or mission based/B corporation to enable even bigger projects to support the needs of the moms who need it.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Peter Emerson, the child of an Irish Protestant father and English Catholic mother.  I have lived in Belfast since 1975.

The Northern Ireland problem was exacerbated by majority rule.  Similarly, to quote Oslobodjenje, Sarajevo's famous newspaper, "all the wars in the former Yugoslavia started with a referendum."   And again, in the Caucasus and now Ukraine, problems were/are rarely solved by two-option votes.

    Scotland, thank God, is at peace.  It would therefore be an ideal scenario to show how multi-option preference voting could work.  I demonstrated this procedure at a public meeting in Edinburgh in 1997; I wrote about it in the journal Scottish Affairs; and I made numerous representations to both the UK and Scottish parliaments, alas, to no avail.

    Hence the need, now, for a multi-option survey, based on six options, five of which are distilled from the policies of the main Scottish political parties, and one is the status quo.

    What We Need & What You Get

    The cost of the survey, scheduled to be undertaken by a professional company, TNS - http://www.tnsglobal.com/uk - is £5,360.  The data will be analysed both by them and by the de Borda Institute - www.deborda.org

      The Impact

      In 1991, at a cross-community conference in Belfast where we used multi-option voting, one of the guests was a native of Sarajevo.  Thus we warned of the dangers of holding a two-option referendum in Bosnia, where there was no majority anyway: 40% were Bosniaks, 30% Bosnian Serbs and 20% Bosnian Croats.  Alas, our warning went unheeded and, six months later, the two-option ballot was held.  It started the war.

      Earlier, in 1985 in Belfast, when hundreds of thousands were saying "No" to the Belfast Agreement, six of us stood outside Belfast City Hall with a slogan: "we have got to say 'yes' to something." 

      In the light of so many instances in which the two-option vote has been inadequate - another incident relates to South Sudan - it is so important to demonstrate how multi-option preference voting might help people, in many countries, to come to an agreement. 

        Risks & Challenges

        In a modern plural democracy, many problems should not be reduced to just two options.  This is obviously the case in Scotland, where the debate started with three options: (A) independence, (B) devo-max (maximum devolution) and (C) status quo.  It was then decided to have just a two-option vote: A v C, independence yes-or no?  

        The debate has moved on.  The 'no' option, C, no longer represents the status quo, but an unspecified form of B; and some argue, the same can be said of the 'yes' option.  This is just one defect of reducing a complex question to a dichotomy.  Sadly, however, no-one is talking about preference voting.

        As a result of campaigning on this topic over the last 40 years, in a largely unpaid capacity, I have nevertheless gained the necessary understanding of voting procedures in particular, and decision-making in general.  Furthermore, I have been published in a number of works on the subject.  Hopefully, then, the findings of a multi-option survey, to be issued in press releases and fuller reports, will be covered by the media… and, as a result, multi-option preference voting will be adopted by politicians of all parties, and not only in Scotland.  

        Interestingly enough, on our prompting, such a voting procedure was used recently by Dublin City Council.  It worked.  (And to the best of our knowledge, it was a world first!)

          Other Ways You Can Help

          The more people campaign for multi-option voting, even if only to persuade the media and academia to discuss the Modified Borda Count, MBC - to give the voting procedure its technical name - the sooner it will become the norm.

story:
Short Summary

We'll keep this quick. We just launched this campaign, and it is getting quite a bit of traffic, if every person who visits the campaign pledges $3, we will reach our goal.  The video is funny, however, we are serious about creating a true, alternative, digital social currency that rewards everyone for their social influence.  Thank you in advance for supporting this mission!


Chitter is a mobile technology that launched in November 2013 with one mission and passion; To incentivize the world for their social media.  Humbly, we've been able to fulfill that passion, and now we want to take it to another level with the creation of Chit: The World's First, Tangible Social Currency.

Chit is meant to be a true alternative currency that rewards everyone for their social influence.  You don't have to be Kim Kardashian or P. Diddy to have influence on social media, and we realize that.  As a result, we're on a new mission to create a perfect social media influence model that rewards every single person for sharing their moments on social media.  

What We Need & What You Get

In more detail, here is why we want you to be a part of our mission:

  • $24,000 will go to the development of our social influence algorithm and integrated into a free Chit Shop App.  This will be a free app that can be downloaded in the iOS App Store, Google Play Store, Amazon Store.  It will be integrated into Chitter, our free mobile app that is currently available so all Chit earned via Chitter will automatically be available to you in the Chit Shop.

  • Marketing/Promotion Costs $6,000.  We have a very effective team at running "lean" with our marketing and promotion.  As a result, we need only a minimal marketing budget to get the maximum result.  This will include high quality content distribution, YouTube pre-roll videos, LinkedIn sponsored posts, and an effective social engagement strategy.

  • $10,000 Chit Shop Product Overhead. To get the Chit Shop started, we need to be able to offer all kinds of great products from all of your favorite brands on Chitter. 

  • $10,000 Underwriting of Chit.  This amount is equivalent to the product overhead because we need to underwrite the currency.  From there, the currency will be underwritten with our own revenue streams as we've created a self sustainable model.

  • $17,000 Taxes, Fees, and Miscellaneous Expenses.  As with all crowdfunding campaigns, there are 30% tax rates and also fees attached to all funds raised.  We want to account for this ahead of time in our campaign, to ensure we're doing our diligence to deliver on time for our amazing investors and partners! 

  • What You Get.

  • $1 for making you laugh.  If we made you laugh, or if you enjoyed our video, we'd appreciate your support.  We'll be sure to give you a shout out on Twitter for being so amazing!
  • $5 Gogo it Forward. We will give you a shout out on Twitter and send you a hand written thank you card.  We will also pledge 10% of all funds raised at this level to other amazing campaigns on Indiegogo.
  • $33 Get Your Chit Together T-Shirt.  Choose from one of four exclusive t-shirt designs made just for this campaign.  T-Shirts will be printed on American Apparel Vintage Cotton for a classic, fitted look. A hand written thank you note will accompany your t-shirt. And don't think we won't give you a Twitter shout out also!

  • $107 You've Got Chit. Receive 25,000 Chit ($50 USD), your choice of one of our 4 exclusive t-shirt designs for this campaign, a certificate acknowledging you as one of the first owner's of the world's first social currency, along with a hand written thank you note, and of course some love on Twitter!

  • $259 Private Development Access.  Receive exclusive and private access to our development newsletter and to our private Facebook page.  This gives you all the dirty details and updates on our development, and more importantly, gives you the opportunity to play an integral role in the development of the world's first social currency by providing feedback and beta testing. Also receive 50,000 Chit ($100 USD), your choice of one of four exclusive t-shirt designs, certificate of ownership of world's first social currency, topped off with a hand written thank you note, and a whole lotta love on Twitter.

  • $993 Live in Infamy. Your caricature will go on our website for all time's sake, giving you the credit you so deserve for playing such an integral role in the creation of the world's first social currency. You will receive exclusive and private access to our development newsletter and private Facebook page along with beta testing.  You will receive 125,000 Chit ($250 USD), a certificate acknowledging you as one of the first holder's of the world's first social currency, your choice of one of four exclusive t-shirt designs, and a hand written thank you card.

    (Your Name Here), Founding Chitizen
  • If we do not reach our goal, we will press on.  We are an experienced company and will do all we can to deliver on our deadlines for all of those who supported us.

The Impact

We want this to go beyond the Chit Shop:

  • We all use social media.  We all have varying levels of social influence.  Brands capitalize off our social influence, we should capitalize off their capitalization.
  • As we develop the algorithm, and perfect it, we want to take this concept beyond Chitter and the Chit Shop to create a true alternative currency.  This is how you get to help us make history!
  • Chitter is an established company and has proven our initial concept already, we now simply want to take it to another level.
  • We've been featured in major publications like

Risks & Challenges

We understand this a novel concept, however, this is how all game changing concepts start out.  Initial acceptance can vary at times.

  • Our CEO doesn't take meetings, phone calls, heck, he barely answers his e-mails.  He's so busy making sure Chitter is the best and most innovative product.
  • We personally pledge to outwork all competition and to be open to innovation so fluidly that our concepts will evolve with changing trends, paradigm shifts, and demographics.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to get behind our mission and can't contribute, here is how you can help.

  • Follow and like us on social media
  • Share this campaign and other content from us on your social media.
  • Spread the good word and stay in touch with us!

Thank you in advance for your contributions!

story:
Backwaterflorida.com

Backwater | Florida


Two years ago we hatched a plan to one day move back to Florida and open a restaurant.  We want to cook simple breakfast and lunches with southern staples in mind.  Our goal is to keep all ingredients sourced from within 500 miles.  Ideally all within the state of Florida.  The emphasis on our local economy and sustainability will be paramount.  

We have just secured our lease at 1904 Municipal Lane in Historic Downtown Melbourne.  Steps from City hall and the popular East New Haven Ave.  It is a free standing building built in 1957.  It had formerly been a burger and seafood place.  We have a lot of rehab and refab to do but excited to get started.  Watch the video if you want to get a sense of the blank slate we are starting from.  Our goal is to recreate a historic southern restaurant dining space.  Warm, comforting, and inviting.  

Our plan is to also feature 8 griddle tables at which you can cook your own pancakes much like Elise and I's favorite place in Florida, the Old Sugar Mill at DeLeon Springs.  With each table fabrication coming in at around $1000 its going to get expensive quick.  

What We Need & What You Get

Opening a restaurant takes a lot of money.  We know this.  We are not here to ask for all of it or even a fraction of it.  But anything you can help with will greatly assist us.  Our goal is to raise $2500.  If that puts it in perspective, $2500 will buy us one grill.  Your generosity means a lot to us.  

Here is the blank slate of what we are looking at...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NwVwx3aOyAE

Hate crowdfunding projects that give you nothing in return? This isn't one of them...

  • Tired of donating $50-100 and getting a coozie?  No more of that.  
  • FOR EVERY $1 YOU DONATE YOU WILL RECEIVE A $2 FOOD CREDIT ONCE WE OPEN.  DONATE $100, GET $200 CREDIT.
  • It goes without saying, if you are willing to donate you will be forever in our thoughts and that will always reflect in your checks when you dine with us even after your food credit runs out.  

The Impact

At the very minimum you will be helping with job creation in a town that is constantly feeling the flux of employment solely based on the space program and government funding.  Secondary support to farmers, ranchers and fisherman in the state of Florida as we plan on working in direct contact with the meat and dairy we source.  Lastly you will help us, your friends, which means the world to us. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute financially?  Want to help some other ways?  Of course!!!  We need help in a myriad of areas.  If you can help us with any of the following please get in touch!

  • Marketing
  • Website work - help me make something look good that I'm not good at!!! 
  • Carpentry - Want to help do general labor?  We are more than willing to pay half cash and half food credits at a great rate if you know how to swing a hammer
  • Electrical work - same deal as carpenters
  • Painting/cleaning/general volunteer labor.  Pizza/beer/food credit every day.
  • Salvage scrounging (we are looking for cool old antiques and salvage to make decor with)

Thank you!

We obviously couldn't do this without you.  Your giving or your support.  From the bottom of our hearts, thank you.

story:
"Professor" Alfred Avril was a master of Haitian machete fencing, an esoteric martial art with deep roots in Haitian history. Over the course of a ten-year collaboration with the Haitian Machete Fencing Project, he trained with students from all over the world, and allowed his practice to be documented in the film Papa Machete, an official selection at both TIFF 2014 and Sundance 2015.

On December 1st, Professor Avril succumbed to a fever and died, leaving behind his wife Eunice and dependent grandson Makinley (whose mother, Professor Avril's daughter, was killed in the 2010 earthquake). Apart from teaching fencing to foreigners through our project, which brought him a very modest side income, Professor Avril was a subsistence farmer. Without his contributions, his widow and grandson are now in a precarious situation. We hope to build upon the critical success of Papa Machete with this fund to assist Professor Avril's family in meeting their basic needs in the coming years.

All funds raised will be dispersed to Madame Eunice Avril in quarterly installments of $500 until the fund is depleted.

story:
STORY
I believe that people who are suffering from cancer or the stress of a loved one having cancer is one of the hardest experiences to go through in a lifetime.  I know that because I watched my father suffer and die from pancreatic cancer within less than a years time.  What I was missing during that experience was support and not just counseling.  I needed something to remind me that I wasn't alone.  I needed to be reminded that the rest of the world was still spinning and experiencing things even though my world had come to a dead stop.  I ran out of time but there are still millions of people suffering from this emotional burden everyday.  That is why I believe Patchwork truly has a home on the web for people to communicate to one another.  

PURPOSE
My purpose is to create a social network on the internet that will connect people with similar situations, if not the same.  They will have the ability to connect with other people from all over the country and share their stories, make recommendations regarding anything from cancer centers to drug trials to natural remedies, or simply submit a question and get an honest answer from someone who is right in the thick of it with you.  People are suffering every day.  They deserve a place to go when they feel so completely alone.  I believe Patchwork is just that place. 

GOAL
I am raising $10,500 so that I can hire a web developer to create a social networking website that will connect people who are suffering from cancer or from the stress of a loved one having cancer.

story:
Creatures Creating strives to ensure any creative individual can get the recognition and exposure they need in order to reach new heights. From our nomadic beginnings exhibiting in book stores, yoga studios to even abandoned warehouses, we too struggled to get that exposure to finally having claimed a beautiful space here at the emerging area of Dundas West.

We are more than a gallery. We are a creative space. What ever your creative passion be, we will ensure you have a home for it. Fashion, music, visual, sculpture or performance...we want to help support your endeavours to evolve to bigger better places.


We have built this from scratch, but now we are seeking help from individuals that share our vision and appreciate our mission. In order to fully become the creative hub we've been striving to be, we have a few obstacles to over come. We are trying to raise $6500 for the new year. These funds will go to expand our team, finance some very much needed renovations and ensure the space remains over the slower winter season.


We believe in our space, and the need for it. We have built a strong foundation that will soon enough be able to support itself, and in turn, support all emerging artists, but in our humble beginnings we need the help of your assistance to ensure we get to that point. Our survival depends on your support, and we want to show our appreciation with unique gifts for your donations.
