story:
The Ceilidh

What happens when four women from Lancaster County, Pennsylvania spend a combined 22+ years in the book (and cafe!) industry and their store closes? After many happy years working with Borders, we now find it's time for us to go out on our own and do it the way we know it should be done.
 
Our hope is to become your third place. Home. Work. Ceilidh. One day, we'd like to have a store front that embodies the Gaelic concept of a ceilidh (Káylee). Though the meaning of ceilidh has changed over the years, one aspect always remains intact: a ceilidh is a community gathering, a celebration. This is the most basic facet of our business. We aim to bring people together, one book, one latte, one surprising conversation at a time.

Before we can get to the point of having a physical location where you can sit and talk with friends and strangers, discussing books, sipping hot chocolate, encompassed by the music of a live band and local artwork lining the walls, we must begin elsewhere. We must begin selling books via our website. Although our future customers are scattered across the globe, we remain connected. A ceilidh in name and spirit.

Help us begin the conversation and the celebration.

How You Can Help Us

  • First and foremost, we were able to pay for all those pesky legal fees to operate in the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania. Yay! Thank you to all of those that made that possible!
  • Secondly, building a sleek, effient, and user-friendly website with actual shopping carts is imperative to our future growth as a company. A functioning online store is the ultimate goal of this particular fundraiser. Your contributions will go directly to help make this goal a success.
  • Additionally, the contributions made will go towards all of the perks, including our Sign and Dine Event.
  • Any further contributions past our goal will go towards the actuation of our dream: a brick and mortar store. The POS system we have been drooling over is not cheap, that is for sure, but it will grow well with us and make life down the line a lot smoother (and dare we say sexier?). Also, any extra money will go towards acquiring new book titles and of course, the actual location.

Long-Term Impacts

  • They will be just as delicious as the short-term impacts. With any bit you contribute, you will bring us one step closer to creating the inviting and inspiring space for which we have been planning. Our eventual book store will be more than just a book store. We will be a place where our community can investigate creative outlets and become better for it.
  • The Ceilidh has agreements with a few local authors (Maria V. Snyder,  Megan Hart, and Nicole Peeler to name a few) to be the exclusive seller of personalized signed copies of their books. Not only will the Ceilidh provide you with a service like this (in only a few clicks, mind you) but we will also be helping these wonderful ladies reach corners of their market that otherwise would be untouched. We'd love for services like this to catch on across the nation. After all, it will only help the publishing industry as a whole.
  • You'll receive awesome items to display your pride in helping a small business and a growing community. You may even experience an event to remember for a lifetime. Once we are ready to launch our website, we will hold a public signing event held locally in Lancaster, Pennsylvania. One of the few possible perks is a ticket to the dining portion our Sign and Dine event. This is where you'll get to schmooze with authors while eating deliciously catered food. Even if you aren't in our area, we have some great personalized signing options. See side panel for more information.

All perks will be delivered as soon as possible at the end of the campaign.

How You Can Help Us In Other Ways

Get the word out! Share this site with anyone you can! Share on your social networking sites, talk about it at the water cooler at lunch with your co-workers, tell your book club! However you want to do it, we appreciate any information you can get out.

story:
Short Summary

Hey, I'm Jas with Afiniti Digital, and thanks for checking us out. Afiniti Digital has been my dream ever since I first started coding, years ago. I like to design web pages and web art, and if I can make a living out of it, so much the better. First though, I need funding so I can actually start to work.
 
There are costs associated with starting a business, as I'm sure many of you know. In order of importance, I'd like to get some business cards and advertising, buy some real computers and tech (An HP Compaq doesn't really cut it, nor does a 12mp point-and-shoot), and eventually have my own office.

I have some help from friends and family, who have been extremely supportive from the start, but I'm going to need a lot more so we can get this off of the ground.

What We Need & What You Get

Our first bit of funding will go towards some real business cards, because we're definitely going to need to get the word out. The next priority is good technology with which we can work on. This doesn't necessarily need to be top of the line (though I still drool at the screen on the new MacBook Pro with Retina Display), but better than the crap we're running with now. A DSLR would be next, to get some stock pictures and to get some pictures of businesses we'll be developing for.
 
Upto that is all I've really put in as a goal, but if it can go further, that'd work just as well. We'd like to eventually have our own local office, and although hardwood floors and glass would be nice, we'll settle for a corner somewhere.
 
I'll be honest, and say that there's no specific way you'll be helping the world by contributing. If we ever become succesful, we'll definitely donate to charities and more projects on sites like these, but for the immediate future all your funding will go to help us build up as a company. You would however, be helping a couple of kids who recently graduated from high school (about a week ago, in fact) with their ultimate dream.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know very well that some people can't contribute monetarily, and thats totally cool.What would be even cooler is if you can get the word out about us. Know someone who needs a website? Refer to us.

story:
Who we are?

I Can I Will, Inc. (ICIW) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit youth organization  founded  to motivate and inspire youth in Chester, PA . ICIW was co-founded by Michael Gray II, Markus Gray, and Michael Gray Sr., in 2007 for youth ages 3 through 16. The purpose of the organization is to teach and reinforce learning about  the arts, agriculture, economics, and basic business concepts at a young age. With that in mind, participating youth are encouraged to develop small business ventures within their neighborhood. Our children are  at the core of our multi-award winning Community Garden Program, where they apply the skills they've learned in agriculture, economics, and teamwork. Fathers, mothers,  and the entire community are encouraged to participate in our youth development programs. We strive to instill our slogan “I can achieve my goals, I will realize my dreams”, in every child that our program touches. To see our work over the years please like us on Facebook.



What are we trying to do?

Through our saturday program we have realized that art has grown to be one of the biggest outlets for our children and to encourage the development of our young artists we are working to build an art center in the city of Chester, Pa. Through this campaign we are looking to raised $100,000 to build a state of the art art center to continue to teach our kids the value of the arts. We plan on hosting art classes and hosting art shows to showcase the city’s talents. Your donation will go along way even if its just $1, you can help build a lifelong impact on the life of our children.


Our Rewards

Our rewards listed below are very special, they were painted by the late “Andrew Turner Sr.”, who was a native of Chester, Pa. He was a close friend and teacher of the founder of ICIW and has had a lasting impact upon him.

Andrew Turner, American (1944 - 2001)

Andrew Turner was born in l944 in Chester, Pennsylvania. He was a graduate of Temple University's Tyler School of Art. Andrew's work has been widely acclaimed, with many solo exhibitions and participation in group exhibitions. He has taught art in grades K-1 2 in the Chester, Pennsylvania Public Schools and in correctional centers.

His appointments include Artist-in-Residence and Curator, Deshong Museum, Chester, PA; Lecturer, Widener University; Lecturer, Institute of Contemporary Art, University of Pennsylvania, Philadelphia, PA; and, he toured and lectured in The People's Republic of China. Collections which hold Andrew's paintings include Woody Allen, Dr. Maya Angelou, ARCO Chemical Company, Bell Telephone Company, Dr. Constance Clayton, Mr. and Mrs. Bill Cosby, Edie Huggins, Eric Lindros, Mr. and Mrs Louis Madonni, Moses Malone, Penn State University, the artist formerly known as Prince, Mr. and Mrs. Harold Sorgenti, Swarthmore College, Mrs. Marilyn Wheaton, and Widener University Deshong Museum, just to name a few. He has been featured in numerous solo exhibitions and group exhibitions in the United States and abroad. His Philadelphia commissions include: WDAS FM (1996); Marco Solo, (published by J. Schwinn and G. Harlow, illustrated by Andrew Turner) Reverse Angle Productions, Inc. (I 995); and Robin Hood Dell, Fairmount Park (1985).


"My paintings combine the drama inherent in seventeenth century Dutch painting with the brush work and the economy of the Impressionists. However, I look to the jazz idiom more so than to other contemporary visual artists for guidance and inspiration. I tend to measure the success of my pieces by how they stand up technically, emotionally and innovatively to a Coltrane solo or whether I've captured the spirit of the occasion, a la Ellington. The subject matter, sometimes nostalgic recollections of my days as a young tough, covers a myriad of common folk activities. The setting usually my native Chester, is a beehive of creative stimulation or a deteriorating ghetto depending on my state of mind. At the very least, hopefully, these vignettes of experience will help to provide insight into some African American lifestyles and serve as an inspiration to my students and others to continue the legacy of African American participation in the arts."

story_txt:
Who we are?I Can I Will, Inc. (ICIW) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit youth organization  founded  to motivate and inspire youth in Chester, PA . ICIW was co-founded by Michael Gray II, Markus Gray, and Michael Gray Sr., in 2007 for youth ages 3 through 16. The purpose of the organization is to teach and reinforce learning about  the arts, agriculture, economics, and basic business concepts at a young age. With that in mind, participating youth are encouraged to develop small business ventures within their neighborhood. Our children are  at the core of our multi-award winning Community Garden Program, where they apply the skills they've learned in agriculture, economics, and teamwork. Fathers, mothers,  and the entire community are encouraged to participate in our youth development programs. We strive to instill our slogan “I can achieve my goals, I will realize my dreams”, in every child that our program touches. To see our work over the years please like us on Facebook.



What are we trying to do?Through our saturday program we have realized that art has grown to be one of the biggest outlets for our children and to encourage the development of our young artists we are working to build an art center in the city of Chester, Pa. Through this campaign we are looking to raised $100,000 to build a state of the art art center to continue to teach our kids the value of the arts. We plan on hosting art classes and hosting art shows to showcase the city’s talents. Your donation will go along way even if its just $1, you can help build a lifelong impact on the life of our children. Our RewardsOur rewards listed below are very special, they were painted by the late “Andrew Turner Sr.”, who was a native of Chester, Pa. He was a close friend and teacher of the founder of ICIW and has had a lasting impact upon him.Andrew Turner, American (1944 - 2001)Andrew Turner was born in l944 in Chester, Pennsylvania. story:
QUI SUIS-JE?

Élise a toujours travaillés sur différents projets, que ce soit sur un plateau de tournage ou un service traiteur, son attention aux détails en font une merveilleuse personne qui cumule plus de 10 ans d'expériences en restauration (serveuse, barmaid, barista, assistante-gérante). Elle a également été coordonnatrice de production sur différents projets télé. Gérer des équipes, des horaires et coordonner les projets n'ont plus de secret pour elle.

Végétaliens depuis plus de 4 ans, elle rêve d'ouvrir un comptoir entièrement végétalien et biologique où l'on pourra s'acheter des jus pressé à froid, des smoothies et le meilleur café du coin. De plus ce comptoir offrira les produits nécessaire pour une alimentation saine et végétale!

MON OBJECTIF

J'ai besoin d'amasser 40 000$ qui sera divisé comme suit: 

1- Acheter l'inventaire en épicerie (plus de 450 produits!). Les institutions financières et les organismes ne financement malheureusement pas l'inventaire (uniquement l'immobilisation) et donc, j'ai besoin de votre soutien financier pour réaliser ce comptoir de FEU!
2-Un quart servira à payer nos deux premiers mois de loyer où mon équipe rénovera durant 2 mois le local que j'ai trouvé.

L'idée est de faire une pré-vente de bons d'achats qui seront échangeable en magasin. Par exemple, si vous achetez pour 50$, vous recevez un bon d'achat de 50$ applicable sur n'importe produit chez Antidote Superalimentation.

Nous communiquerons la date de notre ouverture officielle et notre emplacement dans Hochelaga-Maisonneuve sur notre page Facebook, sur notre site web et par courriel. Vous serez donc informés de tous les détails.

LA DÉMARCHE

Nous voulons ouvrir dans Hochelaga-Maisonneuve (Montréal) cet été afin de développer l'offre végé dans l'est de la ville. Actuellement, il n'y a rien de satisfaisant et donc, Antidote Superalimentation comblera ce manque.  La demande pour ce projet est très forte. Lors de notre étude de marché, nous avons rencontré plus de 100 personnes et la réponse face à ce projet (et à nos questions) est très positive. 

Sur Facebook, notre page a reçue plus de 1500 mentions "j'aime" en moins de deux semaines. L'enthousiasme des gens (qu'ils soient véganes ou pas) nous confirme une fois de plus que ce comptoir est fort attendue.

Nous avons également organisé une soirée de pré-lancement de cette campagne Indiegogo au Pub l'Île Noire le 12 avril dernier. La soirée a été un franc succès: plus d'une centaine de personnes se sont déplacés afin d'en savoir davantage sur Antidote Superalimentation. Durant cette soirée, nous avons amassé plus de 1500$ en pré-vente de bons d'achats. La confiance des gens envers notre projet est indéniable.

De plus, plusieurs partenaires, dont Rawesome, RISE Kombucha, La Station Organique, Holy Crap et Pousses Égales, nous font déjà confiance et nous ont commandités plusieurs produits que nous avons fait tirer lors de cette soirée.


AUTRES MANIÈRES D'AIDER

Aidez nous à faire parler de nous! Partager notre page Indiegogo sur les réseaux sociaux (Facebook et Twitter) et parlez-en à votre entourage afin de faire d'Antidote Superalimenation un succès. Votre support est essentiel à ce projet et nous vous remercions infiniment. MERCI!

story:
A bit about us...

Nadia and Aista are travelling to help and bless others with their time and through their actions, to a group of people who need it the most.

"We love to help and serve others, and are taking our first adventure together, and need YOUR help!

Please help us by donating financially, so we can on your behalf, provide needed basic hygienic, medical and building supplies,  as well as basic nessecities like clothing, to such a deserving community.

Because of where we are travelling to, and the nature of their political situation, we cannot display nor discuss too many details, but upon request, we can email you more Information so you can make an educated decision about your donation.

We are grateful for every dollar donated!

Thank you."

Nadia and Aista

story:
The Last Post Brewery is about more than just beer. It is about remembering the 1000s of young men and women who have done their bit for our nation’s security. In doing so I hope to provide a place where people can come and tell their stories or learn about those who gave so much for us. As a returned veteran of the Iraq war I know how important it is for our servicemen and women to be recognised for their sacrifice and how little the general public really know about their lives.

Located in the Central Goldfields of Victoria, just minutes from major tourist destinations such as Hepburn Springs, Daylesford and only 40 mins from two of Victoria’s most historic goldmining cities, Bendigo and Ballarat, and amongst many of central Victoria’s boutique wineries The Last Post Brewery will provide a quiet place to enjoy the surrounds and sample some of the state’s newest beers, all in an idyllic country setting. 

A new craft beer…traditionally brewed, environmentally conscious and full of complex flavours our beers are 100% brewed on site using the finest spring waters from nearby Mt Franklin and all feature unique blends of Australian Malts and Hops. Welcome to The Last Post Brewery.

Unique and Novel

Craft breweries are becoming more common as discerning Australian beer drinkers are looking for beers with more flavour and character. This is exactly what you will find at The Last Post Brewery. BUT; In order to capitalise on the uniqueness that abounds in central Victoria we have a twist on a theme. Not only will The Last Post Brewery provide you with high quality, original Aussie beers, but we will also come to you. Yes that’s right. We’ll be mobile! As a memorial to the many volunteers who protect our community from our service men and women to our CFA and other emergency volunteer organisations I intend on refurbishing an old fire truck and fitting it out with all the important features such as beer taps, kegs and other packaged products to suit all needs. We will feature quality organic meat products from nearby Angel Organics, a local certified organic beef and lamb producer, with a BBQ on board. The Last Post Brew Truck will travel to your function or event and provide you with an instant Pub on site, complete with BBQ facilities and functioning fire-fighting pump and hoses which we’ll leave their potential uses up to your imagination. 

Around the local area, there are a number of high quality wineries and other historically significant tourist attractions. The entire region will benefit from the increased patronage. The truck will be used to take small group tours of the region incorporating some of the local wineries and historic sites and will also be available for hire as a Novelty Transport vehicle. Formals, Debutante Balls, Weddings, Hens Nights, Bucks Nights, Sporting Clubs functions, you name it. The sky's the limit and with my imagination and your support, anything is possible.

Victorian’s deserve the best and this is what we hope to bring to your door. 

What are you drinking?

At the heart of our product range are quality ingredients. Beer consists of four main ingredients: water, malted grain, hops and yeast. Every beer brewed at The Last Post Brewery will start with a base of water from the Mt Franklin springs (just 15mins away) and will also feature quality Australian produce varying from quality Tasmanian grown hops, to locally sourced grains. Some beers will feature products from overseas in order to capture the unique flavours and memories that we will hopefully become renowned for. Rest assured, each beer will ALWAYS feature intrinsically Australian produce. 

Some of the beer recipes include ingredients such as rolled oats, golden syrup, aniseed, coriander and seasonal fruits. 

The Last Post Brewery’s beers will be unique. There are already a great many craft breweries throughout Victoria and Australia and we aim to be different. Each beer will be brewed based loosely on the style to which it is intended but we want to think outside the bottle (pun intended) somewhat in our production process. By doing so, we hope to create a uniquely Australian and Victorian product not seen anywhere else. It will be different, it will taste different and you will love it, so be warned.

The Last Post Brewery’s intent

Our concept is one of remembrance. People make this country what it is. They have given so much over the years. We want them to be remembered and thanked.

The Last Post Brewery will reference some of the more significant Australian involvement in conflict in its unique beer range. We will provide a beer that not only tastes great but invokes thoughts of Australia’s involvement in various conflicts. We hope to invoke memories and spur discussion, but most importantly, that great Aussie tradition of telling a yarn.

The Last Post Brewery will also give back to our veteran community through support of various veterans’ support organisations such as Legacy, Soldier On and many others. These organisations run campaigns at various times throughout the year and The Last Post Brewery will have specialty seasonal beers brewed to coincide with these campaigns with proceeds going to support those various organisations.

We believe our soldiers, sailors and airmen/women have given up so much for us that the least we can do is give a little back; so every time you have a beer, you’ll be able to say “I helped an Aussie digger today”.

 Good friends, good food, great beer and a good old yarn. That’s the story of Australia. That’s what we represent and that’s what The Last Post Brewery aims to foster.

Behind the dream

Hilton Hazeltine is the founder of The Last Post Brewer and an ex member of the Australian Army. Hilton served for over 12 years in the Army including a tour of Iraq in 2005/06. 


Discharged due to injuries in 2012, Hilton has decided to put his passion for craft beer into overdrive and give others the joy of drinking quality craft beer. Hilton has been brewing craft beer for over 20 years from humble beginnings in the kitchen with a tin of syrup and some sugar to the lofty heights of making beer that everyone can enjoy, it’s now time to share that with Victoria and the rest of Australia. Hilton’s wife never drank beer before he convinced her to try one of his craft beers and she’s been a convert ever since. Many of Hilton’s friends were not beer drinkers. Then one day they tried one of his unique craft beers, and they’ve not looked back. A perfectionist, Hilton is constantly striving for the perfect craft beer, one that stands head and shoulders above the rest. Has he reached that goal? You be the judge. 


Timeline

The Last Post Brewery is still in development stage. It has been Hilton’s dream to turn his passion for making unique beer, into a thriving business running a brewery and now that he’s taken the step, he needs your help. Hilton has many friends, both old and new who have provided support in enthusiastic ways. Many are willing taste testers and others are happy to get in and get their hands dirty. While it is difficult to place a timeline on a project like this in its early stages, especially when there are so many variables such as the right vehicle, licences and insurances, the plan is to open and commence trading before the summer of 2014 rolls around. 

How you can help.

Financial support is required due to a very rapidly diminishing opportunity to purchase a second-hand fire truck and additional brewery equipment, from separate vendors in VIC. Reaching the funding goal and being able to buy this equipment will greatly enhance the likelihood of success for the business and will save thousands. It will also see The Last Post Brewery up and operational sooner than anticipated and in turn will see more benefits going to our veterans’ support organisations to assist our wounded veterans. 

Description RRP QTY TOTAL
Full Stainless D-Type Keg Coupler (CUB) $69.95 5 $349.75
Gas Ball Lock Post $14.95 5 $74.75
Liquid Ball Lock Post $14.95 5 $74.75
Flow Restrictor Brumby Tap $49.95 5 $249.75
Decal Holder (73mm dia) $19.95 5 $99.75
Counter Pressure Bottle Filler Kit $69.95 1 $69.95
Pressurised Beer Line Cleaning Bottles $29.95 2 $59.90
Stainless Steel Conical Fermenter 240L $1,617.00 5 $8,085.00
30 Plate Heat Exchanger $119.95 1 $119.95
0.5 Micron Stainless Steel Diffusor $11.95 10 $119.50
D-Type Keg Opening Tool $119.95 1 $119.95
Spear Compression Tool (Circlip removal) $299.00 1 $299.00
Stainless Steel Keg 50L NEW $105.00 20 $2,100.00
D-Type Spear $22.00 20 $440.00
D-Type Keg Seal $24.95 10 $249.50
Malt Muncher Grain Mill $189.00 1 $189.00
200L Braumeister $19,800.00 1 $19,800.00
Mobile Party Truck $15,000.00 1 $15,000.00
TOTAL SET UP COST $47,500.50

Purchasing the fire truck and brewery expansion equipment will be a significant step forward, however, there is still much that is required in order for The Last Post Brewery to be fully functional. The site has been chosen, and much work is yet to be done to convert it into the masterpiece that it deserves to become. The first $15,000 raised will go toward the purchase of the truck, as this will then allow us to start making money, and developing further interest in the business while we finish the building works. Most of the brewery equipment is already set up, just on a smaller scale and the remainder will be expanded as we reach our funding goal. What's remaining will be funded through finance and investment, with a significant amount of elbow grease. 

You can show your support for The Last Post Brewery by making a pledge through this campaign or a donation direct to The Last Post Brewery and also through sharing this page with your friends and family via the various social media channels. Just use the link buttons on the left hand side of your screen!
Every little bit counts, and we believe that there are more than enough people who care about our veterans and who love craft beer to make this project a reality.

Please spread the word, 'like' The Last Post Brewery on Facebook, follow us on Twitter and pledge what you can afford.

organisations.We believe our soldiers, sailors and airmen/women have given up so much for
us that the least we can do is give a little back; so every time you have a
beer, you’ll be able to say “I helped an Aussie digger today”. Good friends, good food, great beer
and a good old yarn. That’s the story of Australia. That’s what we represent
and that’s what The Last Post Brewery aims to foster.Behind the dreamHilton Hazeltine is the founder of The Last Post Brewer and an ex member of
the Australian Army. Hilton served for over 12 years in the Army including a
tour of Iraq in 2005/06. Discharged due to injuries in 2012, Hilton has decided to put his
passion for craft beer into overdrive and give others the joy of drinking
quality craft beer. Hilton has been brewing craft beer for over 20 years from
humble beginnings in the kitchen with a tin of syrup and some sugar to the
lofty heights of making beer that everyone can enjoy, it’s now time to share
that with Victoria and the rest of Australia. Hilton’s wife never drank beer
before he convinced her to try one of his craft beers and she’s been a convert
ever since. Many of Hilton’s friends were not beer drinkers. Then one day they
tried one of his unique craft beers, and they’ve not looked back. A
perfectionist, Hilton is constantly striving for the perfect craft beer, one
that stands head and shoulders above the rest. Has he reached that goal? You be
the judge. 
TimelineThe Last Post Brewery is still in development stage. It has been
Hilton’s dream to turn his passion for making unique beer, into a thriving
business running a brewery and now that he’s taken the step, he needs your
help. Hilton has many friends, both old and new who have provided support in
enthusiastic ways. Many are willing taste testers and others are happy to get
in and get their hands dirty. While it is difficult to place a timeline on a
project like this in its early stages, especially when there are so many
variables such as the right vehicle, licences and insurances, the plan is to
open and commence trading before the summer of 2014 rolls around. 
How you can help.Financial support is required due to a very rapidly diminishing opportunity
to purchase a second-hand fire truck and additional brewery equipment, from
separate vendors in VIC. Reaching the funding goal and being able to buy this
equipment will greatly enhance the likelihood of success for the business and
will save thousands. It will also see The Last Post Brewery up and operational
sooner than anticipated and in turn will see more benefits going to our
veterans’ support organisations to assist our wounded veterans.

Purchasing the fire truck and brewery expansion equipment will be a
significant step forward, however, there is still much that is required in
order for The Last Post Brewery to be fully functional. The site has been
chosen, and much work is yet to be done to convert it into the masterpiece that
it deserves to become. The first $15,000 raised will go toward the purchase of the truck, as this will then allow us to start making money, and developing further interest in the business while we finish the building works. Most of the brewery equipment is already set up, just on a smaller scale and the
remainder will be expanded as we reach our funding goal. What's remaining will be funded through finance and investment, with a significant
amount of elbow grease. You can show your support for The Last Post Brewery by making a pledge
through this campaign or a donation direct to The Last Post Brewery and also
through sharing this page with your friends and family via the various social
media channels. Just use the link buttons on the left hand side of your screen!
Every little bit counts, and we believe that there are more than enough
people who care about our veterans and who love craft beer to make this project
a reality.Please spread the word, 'like' The Last Post Brewery on Facebook, follow us on Twitter and pledge
what you can afford.

story:
WHAT'S VETIVER FARM?

VETIVER is a new farm in downtown New Orleans, LA.  With your support and the help of our friends and neighbors,  we're developing a working urban farm to grow organically-raised produce and plant starts, while functioning as a hub and a resource center for other growers - physically and virtually.  We've been fortunate to secure a half-acre spot in an excellent location that will also allow us to offer educational opportunities in the form of classes, demonstrations, community-based events. 

Our challenge now is to convert an overgrown, trash-filled lot into a safe and functional growing space; tackling issues that most urban growers face (soil contamination and the like), but exacerbated by New Orleans' specific environmental history. We're seeking funding to cover a portion of our project start-up costs, of which mulch and soil are a huge component. 


WHO ARE WE?

VETIVER is founded by Nicola Krebill and Keenan McDonald.  Keenan and Nico have 12 years combined experience in farming, along with diverse & extensive experience in food production (farming, gardening, baking, butchery, cooking), food distribution, and urban agricultural advocacy.

Nico has spent 8 years as a community organizer in New Orleans, most recently as the City Farms Director at the New Orleans Food & Farm Network.  NOFFN is an organization that aims to localize the food system in the New Orleans region by increasing the number of edible gardens, developing collaborative urban agriculture projects, and supporting food system linkages within the New Orleans foodshed.  Nico also founded and has operated Community Kitchen Collective, a wholly volunteer-run food share in New Orleans that brings together individuals who love to grow, gather, cook, and serve food; thereby reducing food waste and abating hunger, while supporting those most marginalized by capitalism and the industrial food system. Community Kitchen has served weekly free meals for over 2 years.

Keenan has farmed and managed diverse farm operations including produce and variety of livestock for over 7 years, primarily in North Carolina.  Prior to relocating to New Orleans, Keenan managed vegetable production for a large certified organic farm in Central Louisiana.  She set direction for greenhouse production of transplants for field and for retail sales, as well as developed restaurant, wholesale and retail business in NOLA -  with direct sales to roughly 40 of the most creative and highly regarded restaurants in the city.  

VETIVER will leverage deep existing community relationships with food producers, restaurants, wholesalers, and the like to expand on more traditional marketing and advertising efforts.  Both Nico and Keenan have backgrounds in art, photography, technology, and writing in public, private, and fine arts sectors. Prior to farming, Keenan spent a decade in Raleigh/Durham, NC and Chicago, IL engaged in branding and design consulting.  Nico is an acclaimed photographer with over 12 years of experience in technology and website development.  VETIVER will maintain a substantial online presence and also endeavor to function as a digital information resource hub.  


OUR PLAN

VETIVER's main goal is to produce fresh food and facilitate its production for the Greater New Orleans area. What that looks like to us:

TRANSPLANTS/PLANT STARTS

VETIVER will offer a Greenhouse-Driven Custom Transplant Production Program for area farmers; high-quality vegetable and herb plant starts sustainably produced from non-GMO seed. Transplants will also be made available at a discount for local Community Gardens, and for retail sale to Backyard & Restaurant/Kitchen gardeners.

FRESH PRODUCE

It's hard to deny the incredible local demand for exceptionally high-quality, locally produced premium baby greens! We'll grow for direct-marketing primarily to restaurants, but also wholesale (vendors such as Hollygrove Market & Good Eggs), and through Farmers’ Market venues.

  • Premium Baby Greens such as Arugula, Mixed Lettuces, Spinach, Sorrel, Mizuna, and Yukina Savoy. 
  • Extensive Variety of Micro-greens and Shoots 
  • Culinary and Medicinal Herbs

DISTRIBUTION HUB 

Despite the exceptional growth rate of urban farms & gardens in NOLA and beyond – there is a definite dearth of locally accessible, sustainably-produced and sourced gardening supplies such as bulk seed (rare, heirloom and/or cover crop seed), soils, compost, soil amendments, starts such as seed potatoes and other tubers, plugs, and slips. Organic pesticides and non-synthetic fertilizers are often only available from faraway national locations that require expensive shipping in large quantities that can be cost-prohibitive for individual growers or small farmers. Our intention is to be a resource for the sustainable agricultural community in Louisiana and Southern Mississippi.

CONSULTING 

Our plan is to offer consultative services for restaurants, community groups, businesses, and/or individuals seeking to create, revamp, or maintain urban gardens. These services will be integrated with our custom transplant production.

COMMUNITY OUTREACH & WEBSITE

In addition to the production of seedlings & transplants, baby greens, micro-greens & shoots, VETIVER will offer educational opportunities in the form of classes, demonstrations, community-based events. Phase Two of our project involves creating and maintaining a dynamic information rich website that will serve as a resource for farmers, backyard growers, environmentally-conscious consumers, and the food systems community.

COMPOST PICKUP SERVICE

With so many restaurants, catering companies, cafés, food trucks & pop-ups in New Orleans, the amount of biodegradable waste that ends up in the landfill is astounding. More than 1/2 of what’s going into the landfill is paper & food waste. By offering compost collection to businesses, VETIVER will turn local food & paper waste into a nutrient-rich soil amendment through composting. Additionally, we'll track the number of pounds of biodegradable waste each business diverts from the landfill to support urban agriculture. Compost adds organic matter, beneficial bacteria, and nutrients to the soil needed for healthy plant growth and improves the physical properties of soil for good aeration, water retention, and pest and weed control. In the future, we hope to expand to offer residential compost pickup as well.


HOW DO WE GET THERE?

We're asking for help to raise $24,000  - which is about half of what we expect our start-up/expenses to be for the rest of 2014.  Your contribution will enable us to get up and running until we can begin generating income.  

Here's a rough outline of our projected expenses:  

Mulch/Soil (Sourcing/Hauling/Spreading): $12,000

  • Minimum of 18" Base Mulch Layer/Soil
  • Work-up Garden Areas/Bed Building

Infrastructure/Farm Set-up: $3,500

  • Agricultural Water Meter/Irrigation System
  • Electricity Set-up and Wiring
  • Fence Maintenance & Repairs 
  • Retail Shed Construction
  • Post-Harvest Processing Area 

Greenhouse/Hoophouse Development: $4000

  • Structural/Hardware
  • Plastic/Shade Cloth
  • Benches, Fans/Ventilation
  • Sterile Growing Mixture 
  • Growing Trays/Inserts

Shipping Container and Buildout:  $3000

  • Conversion of Shipping Container for dual office/walk-in cooler space

Materials & Tools: $1,500

  • Seeds, Seeders, Hand tools, Small Engine equipment, etc.  


WHY?

VETIVER is commencing in a time of a food paradox: in 2011, New Orleans was labeled America's worst food desert while simultaneously lauded "America's Best City for Foodies" (New Orleans Doubles as Food Desert & Foodie Mecca, 10/25/11, http://www.triplepundit.com/). Among one of the things the city lacks is a sustainable grower of vegetable transplants to serve the city's residential, commercial, community, and restaurant gardens. This is where the idea of VETIVER begins, but where we grow is dependent on the support of folks like you.

The New Orleans Food & Farm Network reports: "The scale of the food crisis in New Orleans is alarming. Of the estimated 369,000 people in urban New Orleans, 27% of adults live in poverty, as do 42% of children, making New Orleans one of the poorest cities in the country. In an area where a bag of chips is often less expensive and more accessible than an apple, affordable, healthy fresh food has long been a challenge for many residents. Prior to Hurricane Katrina, there were just 30 supermarkets in the city. Today, six years later, there are just over 20."

VETIVER aims to catalyze urban agriculture in New Orleans in a way that has not yet been done. Unfortunately, this is a city where most gardeners buy their vegetable seedlings at a giant hardware store. No more. By providing a missing link for farmers & gardeners in and around New Orleans, we hope to support the rising trend of food grown by and for New Orleanians. Less fuel & pollution via shipping. Less toxic chemicals via pesticides, herbicides, and insecticides. Less corporate control of unfair food & labor.

"Urban-farmed food, especially if it is sustainably grown, can add dimension to our city’s reputation for culinary excellence. Cultivating more food locally and encouraging residents to grow food themselves can only have a positive impact on healthy food availability. With our year-round growing season, newly available land and increasing demand from New Orleanians for fresh food, we have almost all the ingredients we need to remake our food system into one that is healthier and more local."  - New Orleans Food & Farm Network


HOW CAN YOU HELP?

We appreciate any help folks offer.  If you can contribute money, THANK YOU!  If you have any items that we can make use of/upcycle/repurpose - that's a huge help as well.  Below is a list of some of those things that we anticipate having to buy, but would be thrilled to have donated:

  • Soil/Hauling
  • 40' Shipping Container
  • Shadecloth
  • Landscape Fabric/Geotextiles
  • Untreated Lumber (Particularly 2x4, 2x6, 2x12 - Finished or Rough Cut)
  • Greenhouse Elements (Fans, Hardware, Doors, Benches, Plastic, etc)
  • Cast-Iron Tub (For Post-Harvest Processing)
  • Washing Machine (For Post-Harvest Processing)
  • Hardware (Nails, Screws, Bolts, etc)

If you can't help out financially or materially, please know that we would love to have help spreading the word and information.  We also plan on looking to some awesome volunteers for help in getting the Farm set up physically - let us know i f you're interested in that.  Help us now by sharing the campaign and creating incremental change in New Orleans! 

You can use the Indiegogo tools to share the campaign, check us out on Facebook or Twitter  - or just get in touch! 


DETAILS ON PERKS

The posters, postcards, and t-shirt designs are all in development by the artists Pippin Frisbee-Calder, Rachel Speck, and Sierra Kozmon, members of the New Orleans Community Printshop.

We were fortunate enough to have the brilliant Pippin Frisbee-Calder make a custom logo for Vetiver, as seen below. This will be included as one of the postcard/poster options.


Rachel & Sierra, new orleans rockstar artists,  are currently working on print designs for Vetiver to be used in the postcard & poster perks. Here are some samples of their artwork:

story:
Our Story

In the past eleven months I have been taken by storm as this Brooklyn boy went from the daily routine of putting on my construction boots, inhaling clouds of dust & hammering away to working with ingredients such as flour, sugar & eggsâ€¦yes, I am talking about BAKING! You see my love for baking came about for one simple reason I LOVE to eat cake! The thought of baking professionally never crossed my mind until -my creative wife aka â€œMaster Wedding Plannerâ€ told me to give the cupcake world a shot! Within weeks of friends & family graciously being my taste testers (hard job) the delicious treats that I began creating started to be noticed & JJs Rockin Cupcakes soon came to life!

In the last year that we have been up and running we have grown in leaps and bounds, aside from taking special orders we have moved directly into the public eye;

Â·         In June 2011 I started selling cupcakes during â€œCupcake Wednesdayâ€™sâ€ in my wifeâ€™s office.

Â·         In November 2011 we outgrew â€œCupcake Wednesdayâ€™sâ€ and I moved down the street to a

 â€œTo-Goâ€ Window (think Drive Through)

Â·         Now we have the â€œTo-Goâ€ window and are even shipping our cupcakes nationwide!

The Impact

By the end of 2011 we were also featured in a variety of media including:

Â·         The Times Harold Record

Â·         The Chronogram

Â·         The Lincoln Eagle

Â·         The Kingston Times

Â·         CY Magazine

Â·         The Style Socialite Blog

Â·         The Poughkeepsie Journal

Â·         2011 "Our wedding Planner" By the Poughkeepsie Journal

In the midst of all of this we have been a part of a variety of events from Mercedes Benz Fashion Week in New York City, to celebrity birthday bashes, TLCâ€™s Four Weddings, book signings, weddings, sweet 16â€™s, a private media retreat at The Bowery House for The Glamazon Diaries (post Fashion Week) and a variety of fundraisers with local schools, ARCS and Relay for life. If this werenâ€™t enough, we were awarded business of the year by Marist College!

Over the years my wife and I have dedicated our time to helping out our community through cupcake donations, monetary donations and just giving our time to many non for profits. We may not have much to give but what we do we are more than willing to share. A few of the places we have donated goods or services are:

Â·         The Ronald McDonald House

Â·         Childrenâ€™s Diabetes Center in Queens Hospital

Â·         Childrenâ€™s Cancer & Blood Foundation

Â·         ARCS â€“ Aids Walk

Â·         Relay for Life

Â·         Saint Josephâ€™s School

Â·         The HUGS Project

Â·         Wish Upon A Wedding

So what exactly is a JJs Rockin Cupcake? Each one of our cupcakes is made with the highest quality ingredients and are sourced locally whenever possible. Preservatives are non-existent in my rockin cupcakes as I freshly prepare each yummy flavor in small individual batches. Madagascar bourbon Vanilla extract, Belgian Chocolate & homemade whipped cream are just a few reasons why your taste buds will dance with happiness! Now here comes the best partâ€¦.the frostin! My delicate frostinâ€™s have become a major role in my cupcake success as they are light, flavorful and never overly sweet. It seems like Iâ€™ve been asked a million times, â€œWill you be bottling your frostin?â€â€¦.only time will tell!

Now JJâ€™s Rockin Cupcakes is on the hunt for an oversized bread truck (16-18 feet) to modify and use for New Yorkâ€™s First EVER Mobile Cupcake Bar!! Straying away from what typical cupcake companies offer is what will set us apart from the pack. This is not just another â€œcupcake truck.â€ This will be New Yorkâ€™s FIRST mobile cupcake bar! Step up to the truck, choose your flavor, frostinâ€™, toppinâ€™ and watch in awe as we create your treat right before your eyes! Our Mobile Cupcake Bar will allow us to bake our delicious treats anywhere whether it is at a local park or a personalized event. 

What we need

We would use contributions to purchase, fix and update the vehicle that will bring our freshly baked, customizable cupcakes straight to you! Our estimated cost for the truck is between $65,000-$70,000 this is what it would include:

Â·         16-18 Foot Truck

Â·         6-8 Shelf Convection Oven

Â·         Gas Burners/Small Stove

Â·         Microwave

Â·         Double Door Refrigerator

Â·         3 sink set up plus 1 wash sink

Â·         6 Foot Stainless Steel table

Â·         8 Foot Stainless Steel table

Â·         2 Propane tanks (50-75lbs each)

Â·         1 Water tank that holds 150 gallons of water

Â·         1 Reservoir tank for used water

Â·         Generator

Â·         2 Service Windows

Â·         Awning

Â·         Exhaust System

Â·         Fire Safety Equipment

We are not asking for the entire amount (but we are keeping our finger crossed that we will reach our set amount because ...WOW does that number looks scary in black & white!!!) But just think of the smiles we will bring to peopleâ€™s faces with all the yummy cupcakes that will be created in this bakery on wheels! Oh & I also forgot to mention that alongside the â€œcupcakesâ€ comes me & my partner (the wifeyâ€™s) awesome personality! She just has a way about her that warms peopleâ€™s heartsâ€¦â€¦.. Together we will be there to provide social interaction in a world that has been losing that personal touch since technology has taken over!

What you get

Your donation is the boost JJâ€™s Rockin Cupcakes needs to get the gears in motion. Your contributions will make you a part of history as you will be involved in the FIRST ever Mobile Cupcake Bar to hit the streets!

Please review our Sweet offerings that we have designed just for you, for without you we wonâ€™t exist!

We canâ€™t wait to drive up to your place, space, city or town & make your day, week or event a Rockin one to remember!

If we do not reach our goal then all contributions will be used to open a Cupcake Bar Shop that has the same concept as the truck, until we gather the full funds for our Dream Mobile Cupcake Truck.

 

Other Ways you Can Donate!

We understand that not everyone is able to donate financially, it is a tough economy after all, but you can still help us by spread the word and helping build a buzz. Follow us on Facebook (JJâ€™s Rockin Cupcakes), Twitter (@JJsRocknCupcake) & our website at www.jjsrockincupcakes.com
story_txt:
Our Story
In the past eleven months I have been taken by storm as this
Brooklyn boy went from the daily routine of putting on my construction boots,
inhaling clouds of dust & hammering away to working with ingredients such
as flour, sugar & eggsâ€¦yes, I am talking about BAKING! You see my love for
baking came about for one simple reason I LOVE to eat cake! The thought of
baking professionally never crossed my mind until -my creative wife aka â€œMaster
Wedding Plannerâ€ told me to give the cupcake world a shot! Within weeks of
friends & family graciously being my taste testers (hard job) the delicious
treats that I began creating started to be noticed & JJs Rockin Cupcakes
soon came to life!
In the last year that we have been up and running we have
grown in leaps and bounds, aside from taking special orders we have moved
directly into the public eye;
Â·        
In June 2011 I started selling cupcakes during
â€œCupcake Wednesdayâ€™sâ€ in my wifeâ€™s office.
Â·        
In November 2011 we outgrew â€œCupcake
Wednesdayâ€™sâ€ and I moved down the street to a
 â€œTo-Goâ€ Window (think Drive Through)
Â·        
Now we have the â€œTo-Goâ€ window and are even
shipping our cupcakes nationwide!
The Impact
By the end of 2011 we were also featured in a variety of
media including:
Â·        
The Times Harold Record
Â·        
The Chronogram
Â·        
The Lincoln Eagle
Â·        
The Kingston Times
Â·        
CY Magazine
Â·        
The Style Socialite Blog
Â·        
The Poughkeepsie Journal
Â·        
2011 "Our wedding Planner" By the
Poughkeepsie Journal
In the midst of all of this we have been a part of a variety
of events from Mercedes Benz Fashion
Week in New York City, to celebrity birthday bashes, TLCâ€™s Four Weddings, book
signings, weddings, sweet 16â€™s, a private media retreat at The Bowery House for
The Glamazon Diaries (post Fashion Week) and a variety of fundraisers with
local schools, ARCS and Relay for life. If this werenâ€™t enough, we were awarded
business of the year by Marist College! 
Over the years my wife and I have dedicated our time to
helping out our community through cupcake donations, monetary donations and
just giving our time to many non for profits. We may not have much to give but
what we do we are more than willing to share. A few of the places we have
donated goods or services are:
Â·        
The Ronald McDonald House
Â·        
Childrenâ€™s Diabetes Center in Queens Hospital
Â·        
Childrenâ€™s Cancer & Blood Foundation
Â·        
ARCS â€“ Aids Walk
Â·        
Relay for Life
Â·        
Saint Josephâ€™s School
Â·        
The HUGS Project
Â·        
Wish Upon A Wedding
So what exactly is a JJs Rockin Cupcake? Each one of our cupcakes
is made with the highest quality ingredients and are sourced locally whenever
possible. Preservatives are non-existent in my rockin cupcakes as I freshly
prepare each yummy flavor in small individual batches. Madagascar bourbon
Vanilla extract, Belgian Chocolate & homemade whipped cream are just a few
reasons why your taste buds will dance with happiness! Now here comes the best
partâ€¦.the frostin! My delicate frostinâ€™s have become a major role in my cupcake
success as they are light, flavorful and never overly sweet. It seems like Iâ€™ve
been asked a million times, â€œWill you be bottling your frostin?â€â€¦.only time
will tell!
Now JJâ€™s Rockin Cupcakes is on the hunt for an oversized
bread truck (16-18 feet) to modify and use for New Yorkâ€™s First EVER Mobile
Cupcake Bar!! Straying away from what typical cupcake companies offer is what
will set us apart from the pack. This is not just another â€œcupcake truck.â€ This
will be New Yorkâ€™s FIRST mobile cupcake bar! Step up to the truck, choose your
flavor, frostinâ€™, toppinâ€™ and watch in awe as we create your treat right before
your eyes! Our Mobile Cupcake Bar will allow us to bake our delicious treats
anywhere whether it is at a local park or a personalized event.  
What we need
We would use contributions to purchase, fix and update the
vehicle that will bring our freshly baked, customizable cupcakes straight to
you! Our estimated cost for the truck is between $65,000-$70,000 this is what it would include:

16-18 Foot Truck

Microwave

3 sink set up plus 1 wash sink

story:
So... What is Rose & Crown?

About Our Business

 The Rose & Crown is not your "downtown" hookah lounge.  It is our hope that the Rose & Crown will fill a much needed niche in our college town.  Our business aims to provide a relaxing and alcohol-free environment for our clientele.  Once open the Rose & Crown will have more of a resemblance to that of your favorite coffee or tea shop.  Providing our customers with an inviting and comfortable atmosphere is our top priority.  

 

About the Owner.

  My name is Robert Christian, and as the owner of the Rose & Crown Hookah Lounge I feel it is my duty to provide you with more information about myself as well as my business.  I moved to Williamsburg, Virginia in 2007 to pursue my dream of becoming a Historic Interpreter in the Colonial Williamsburg Foundation.  To my dismay I found that the Williamsburg area, even with such a diverse population, offered no form of entertainment or social interactions than those revolving around bars.  Having attended a college near Athens, Ohio, I had been exposed to various hookah lounges and the wonderful social interactions within them.  The common theme between these establishments had been their intimate settings, as well as their lack of alcohol.  

  In 2012, I began to pursue my new dream of opening the first true hookah lounge in the Williamsburg area.  The reason I call this business a "true" hookah lounge is that it incorporates hookah traditions that have existed in global history, including America.  A group of colleagues and I began to research the history of hookahs in the New World, and discovered evidence of hookahs being imported, by way of English Trade, into the American Colonies from India to be used not only for personal desire, but for businesses as well.  These American businesses were most often termed as Coffeehouses or Teahouses, which offered much more than their namesake.

Since 2012, I have left the Colonial Williamsburg Foundation and have gained Managerial experience in order to better prepare myself to own and operate the lounge.  Armed with new experience, a thorough knowledge of the services and good required, and a love for the traditions that surrounds the hookah, coffee, and tea that will be served, I am ready to open and devote my time to this dream.  

 

So why should you donate?

  By giving your support and contribution, you will be not only helping the Rose & Crown open its doors, but you will also be aiding other local and national businesses.  The Rose & Crown will be utilizing goods that are produced locally and nationally.  Your contribution will also help ensure that a desired niche is filled in our community.

 

Our Mission:

  Our mission at the Rose & Crown Hookah lounge is to encourage personal growth and development through social interaction.  We will not only serve the public our products, but encourage and aid local artists, musicians, students, and local businesses in anyway that we can.

 

Where Does Your Contribution Go?

We are asking for your help to raise $60,000.00 in order to start this business.  Each donation will bring us a step closer to renting our space, buying our inventory/supplies, and providing a new local "hotspot" in the Williamsburg area.

  We certainly hope you will honor us with your help, and once we open, with your presence.

 

Perks!!

For donating $5.00 we will immediately send you a personalized, hand written thank you note.

For a $10.00 donation you will receive a hand written thank you note that includes a voucher that is good for one free hookah session, for 1 year. any voucher that we send to you can be used for one hookah session, which includes a choice of one drink. You may decline use of the hookah, and use the voucher either for one free drink, or 10% off of merchandise.

Every perk above the $10.00 donation mark includes a handwritten thank you note and one voucher, unless otherwise specified. Any perk that lets you choose a style or color will have pictures and a short description available in the Gallery.

We hope to make the perks that you'll receive as personal as possible, in order to show our gratitude.

 

How Else Can You Help?

Simple!  Spread the word to anyone you'd like, and follow us at www.facebook.com/roseandcrownhookah

We are so grateful that you've taken the time to read our page and shown your support!  We hope to see you soon!

story:
What is this about?

This is an initiative to bring awareness to our local business!

My family recently moved to Elkhart, Indiana (my hometown!) from the San Francisco Bay area. Since we've become part of the Elkhart community we have been greeted by the most amazing people in our new community. These inspiring business owners and managers delight our taste buds with delicious food and bring culture to our town. Two sisters run a little eatery down the street and cook my family authentic mouth watering Filipino food while their mother bounces our baby girl in her arms. We met Paula King, a cheesecake baker, at her booth at a local farmer's market and she always greets us with a big smile and keeps us coming back for her delicious desserts. Nicole Bauman, co-manager of Rise Up Farms, has provided our family with delicious fresh veggies grown from an organic farm in Elkhart. My family has been touched by these women who have big hearts. They have taken the time to get to know my family, and me give us warm hugs when we see them, and made us newcomers feel like part of a great community. They also just happen to own and/or run fantastic businesses. 

As an independent female freelance artist, I believe it is important for women to help one another succeed in personal pursuits, dreams and aspirations. I think it is especially important to help other business women succeed in an area that is saturated with manufacturing businesses owned mostly by men. These businesswomen mentioned here are the inspiration for this project and were some of the first people to make my family feel excited about living in the Michiana area.

Moving to Elkhart from Silicon Valley has made apparent a fact that is not at all apparent to city dwelling, wi-fi using, no phone book having people like myself: not every community has such a strong digital footprint as the Bay Area. All of the aforementioned business owners have very little digital presence. How would you find these local treasures? Probably do an Internet search...but nothing comes up. Next, go out and find a phone book, I suppose. Which would be right next to a pay phone...the pay what?

For many people (myself included), the Internet is the main method of finding local businesses and events. As a professional artist and designer, I want to use my skills to help increase Elkhart county's digital footprint by starting with some of the wonderful women we've met in the Elkhart area.

Your contribution helps build the digital presence of Elkhart County and helps enrich Elkhart's culture. Let's assist these caring business owners and ensure that they stay in business by showing that we care. My hope is that this project will blossom into something larger where we can continue to enhance Elkhart County’s digital presence by including more small businesses in the future.

What We Need & What You Get

This project provides funds to pay for the domain space, design and photography for three local businesses to build or upgrade their digital presence.

  • Shekinah Asian Grocery and Deli, 305 N. Nappanee St., Elkhart, IN
  • Rise Up Farms, 22600 SR 120, Elkhart, IN
  • Maple City Cheesecake, 134 Jefferson, Goshen, IN

I will be designing and updating their websites, creating online branding, adding their businesses to google maps and other mapping sites, create and/or update Facebook pages, add their business on yelp.com, urbanspoon.com, etc. so customers can find these businesses and provide their feedback. I am not trying to get paid for my time but I am trying to give back to our community by increasing awareness of small businesses in our neighborhoods and to do my part to make Elkhart a great place.

My goal is to raise $2,000 to provide these businesses with web hosting for 2-3 years, design work and photography. Your contribution will be helping Elkhart County thrive by showing small business owners that members of their community care and want them to succeed. Each business owner has agreed to provide perks such as discounted or free food to contributors. If the goal is exceeded, that means that this project can expand to more businesses in the area.

You can make a difference!

I have been a professional graphic and web designer for over twelve years and over five years experience in marketing and advertising. I’ve worked for small businesses, large businesses and non-profits. My family has lived all over the United States and abroad and now I'm excited to contribute my skills to the community of Elkhart County.

My family and I are pleased to discover that this community has so much to offer. I am excited to inform others by increasing our online presence so residents, visitors, and business goers can easily find our local family owned eateries, stores, theaters, and entertainment.

With your support, we can make sure that our small businesses stand out among the chain stores and restaurants so they remain an integral part of our community in Elkhart County.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot assist to fund this initiative you can still help! Get the word out about this campaign. Visit these businesses and experience what they have to offer. Bring a friend and tell others to support our local businesses.

Let's help our community grow and spread the word that we do have great things to offer in Elkhart County. Help be part of the local movement by showing that you care.

If you're not from the Michiana area you can still contribute if you care about small businesses and their importance to towns and cities across America.

Thank you!

To Adam Derstine, Ate Edna, Ate Gina and Nanai, Paula King, Nicole Bauman and Nick Simons, Stacey Sotosky, Kristi Bly and Christopher Soriano for all of your help and support!
