story:
ONEBUM - Clothe One Bum In Poverty With Every ONEBUM You Buy

Hello! My name is Jessica. Thank you so much for checking out my project! I'm a soon-to-be first time mom trying to make a difference. With the way the economy has been so stagnant and the cost of diapering a newborn through potty-training, I knew there was something I needed to do to help those moms in need.

Not only have I seen the dramatic need for cloth diapers to be accessible to lower income families, but I've also seen the terrible impact disposable diapers have on our environment and the chemicals they expose to our babies.

I need your help to get ONEBUM going. No matter what, I'm determined to make a this a success and help both the environment and those in need of a better solution for caring for their babies.

ONEBUM will bring hundreds of thousands of babies in poverty, the warmth and hygeine they need.

So will you be a part of it?

 

Two Problems Solved with ONEBUM

THE ENVIRONMENT

Disposable diapers are made for one-time use. In fact, they are the 3rd largest one-time use item filling up our landfills today. 

Also, since there is no other application of the single-use diaper, use of disposable diapers accounts for 100,000 tons of plastic and 800,000 tons of tree pulp waste in the United States alone.

On top of just filling our environment with wasted plastic and paper - we also toxify the environment with collectively ridding our waste in our landfills. It's actually illegal in most states to dump human waste into landfills. The content of used diapers are supposed to be emptied in the toilet before thrown in the trash. Have you ever seen anyone do that? Me either.

Disposable diapers also contain chemicals such as sodium polyacrylate. A chemical banned from tampons for causing toxic shock syndrome. How do you like that seeping into our baby's bums and into our ground water?

And what do we get for all this waste in our public lands? An estimated $350 million dollar bill. This is the rough cost of getting all of America's disposable diapers to the landfills.

Shocking Environmental Statistics

  • Americans are throwing out 5 garbage bags full of diapers every second.
  • Disposable diapers account for 50% of a household's waste.
  • Disposable diapers take an average of 400 years to decompose in landfills.
  • Roughly 90-95% of the 18 billion fece and urine-filled disposable diapers enter the household trash stream and ultimately end up in landfills, creating an immediate public health hazard.

LOW-INCOME ASSISTANCE

There are Over 4 million Single Moms in Poverty in the United States Alone

The bottom-line is this. Cloth diapering is 80% cheaper than diapering with disposables. It's the only realistic, long-term solution to help those in poverty keep their babies clean and healthy.

Considering that babies are changed anywhere from 6-15 times a day, it's shocking that no government program offers assistance in diaper purchases for the poor. Both in the United States and around the world, mothers are struggling to adequately care for their baby's hygiene needs.

So why not just give disposable diapers? Well minus the environmental factors we just discussed, there are many other reasons why giving disposable diapers to babies in need just doesn't cut it.

  1. Disposable diapers are just that. Disposable. They will be used up quickly with families being left in the situation they were in not long before receiving them.
  2. Disposable diapers cause higher chances of diaper rash and exposure to harmful chemicals. Needy families cannot absorb medical costs or the cost of diaper rash ointment if their babies develop these side effects.
  3. In deeply poverty-stricken areas of the world, landfills aren't out of the way. They are in the backyards of the people that live there. By giving them disposable diapers we are compounding their problem and creating a genuine public health hazard.

So what will we do?

Well, while there are many cloth diapering companies out there, none of them have a charitable motivation. With ONEBUM every diaper purchase will be matched with a ONEBUM diaper (or receiving blanket - whichever the area of poverty requires most at the time) donated to a baby in need.

Where Is the Money Going?

ONEBUM is dependant on the generous contributors of IndieGoGo to finish launching. So far you know a little about us and lot about why it's important. Need more convincing?

ONEBUM is started by me and my husband Chase. Our full time jobs are marketers - we know how to get customers. And we WILL make ONEBUM a success. Yes, we do have a mentor team. Yes, we do have a business plan. Yes, we do have networking rescources. Yes, we do have a lawyer and accountant. And yes, we are 100% commited to not stopping until we've done our part to change the world.

Our funding goal of $11,000 has been carefully selected. In case you couldn't tell, we don't believe in waste. Every dollar we're asking for has a purpose. So where will the money be going?

Inventory

$8,000 is needed for our start up inventory. This will include the ONEBUM diapers in upwards of 40 different models. It will also include the inventory of other ONEBUM accessories such as diaper liners and inserts (making cloth diapering easier).

Marketing

While Chase and I can do most of the leg-work here, marketing expenses are part of the nature of e-commerce sales. $3,000 is needed for appropriate SEO and outreach expenses.

More About the Perks

Thank You Card

We really do have a special place in our hearts for all of you that will be contributing to our cause. We will endure nights of hand-cramps and unavoidable Carpal Tunnel Syndrome if that's what it takes to thank you.

ONEBUM Bumpersticker

ONEBUM Give-and-Take

What better way to get started with ONEBUM then to make one of the first contributions? We'll send you one of our ONEBUM diapers for you and your baby to enjoy and set one aside for our first ONEBUM donation shipment.

Sponsorship Superstar

Just like the handprints in Hollywood, we will put your name on showcase for the world to see forever. This sponsorship page won't be hidden somewhere where no one can find you. We want people to see how many other people this movement is important to. That means your name front and center.

"I CLOTHED ONEBUM" T-Shirt

In addition to being added to the sponsorship page, we've designed a t-shirt specifically for IndieGoGo contributors for you to sport around and get some recognition for the cause.

ONEBUM Give-and-Take 4 Pack

Just like before, this perk gets your name listed on our sponsorship page. You'll also get a 4-pack of ONEBUM cloth diapers and get a 4-pack donated to children in need.

Your Name On A Run of ONEBUMS

If you couldn't tell, we're excited to show off our contributors. With this perk you get your name on our sponsorship page and added to our tags for a single run. That means when we place a new order of inventory for ONEBUM diapers, one of our $500 contributors will have their name and a "Thank You" next to our logo sewn onto each diaper that goes out on that run. If you've ever dreamed of having your name stamped on an adorable baby's bottom - now's your chance.

ONEBUM Diaper Named After You

After listing your name on our sponsorship page. We'll offer you a selection of ONEBUM diapers to choose from to name after you. For time and all eternity ONEBUM customers will see your name on your selected diaper model. It was the best way we could think of to thank you sincerely for helping making ONEBUM a success.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some of you may want to help but simply can't do so at the moment. Here's some other ways you can help make ONEBUM a success:

  • Use the IndieGoGo share tools to get our project shared all over the web!
  • Tell your friends and family about ONEBUM
  • Like our Facebook page and Follow us on Twitter
story_txt:
ONEBUM - Clothe One Bum In Poverty With Every ONEBUM You Buy

Hello! My name is Jessica. Thank you so much for checking out my project! I'm a soon-to-be first time mom trying to make a difference. With the way the economy has been so stagnant and the cost of diapering a newborn through potty-training, I knew there was something I needed to do to help those moms in need.
Not only have I seen the dramatic need for cloth diapers to be accessible to lower income families, but I've also seen the terrible impact disposable diapers have on our environment and the chemicals they expose to our babies.
I need your help to get ONEBUM going. No matter what, I'm determined to make a this a success and help both the environment and those in need of a better solution for caring for their babies.
ONEBUM will bring hundreds of thousands of babies in poverty, the warmth and hygeine they need.
So will you be a part of it?
 


Two Problems Solved with ONEBUM
THE ENVIRONMENT
Disposable diapers are made for one-time use. In fact, they are the 3rd largest one-time use item filling up our landfills today. 
Also, since there is no other application of the single-use diaper, use of disposable diapers accounts for 100,000 tons of plastic and 800,000 tons of tree pulp waste in the United States alone.
On top of just filling our environment with wasted plastic and paper - we also toxify the environment with collectively ridding our waste in our landfills. It's actually illegal in most states to dump human waste into landfills. The content of used diapers are supposed to be emptied in the toilet before thrown in the trash. Have you ever seen anyone do that? Me either.
Disposable diapers also contain chemicals such as sodium polyacrylate. A chemical banned from tampons for causing toxic shock syndrome. How do you like that seeping into our baby's bums and into our ground water?
And what do we get for all this waste in our public lands? An estimated $350 million dollar bill. This is the rough cost of getting all of America's disposable diapers to the landfills.
Shocking Environmental Statistics

Americans are throwing out 5 garbage bags full of diapers every second.
Disposable diapers account for 50% of a household's waste.
Disposable diapers take an average of 400 years to decompose in landfills.
Roughly 90-95% of the 18 billion fece and urine-filled disposable diapers enter the household trash stream and ultimately end up in landfills, creating an immediate public health hazard.

LOW-INCOME ASSISTANCE
There are Over 4 million Single Moms in Poverty in the United States Alone

The bottom-line is this. Cloth diapering is 80% cheaper than diapering with disposables. It's the only realistic, long-term solution to help those in poverty keep their babies clean and healthy.
Considering that babies are changed anywhere from 6-15 times a day, it's shocking that no government program offers assistance in diaper purchases for the poor. Both in the United States and around the world, mothers are struggling to adequately care for their baby's hygiene needs.
So why not just give disposable diapers? Well minus the environmental factors we just discussed, there are many other reasons why giving disposable diapers to babies in need just doesn't cut it.

Disposable diapers are just that. Disposable. They will be used up quickly with families being left in the situation they were in not long before receiving them.
Disposable diapers cause higher chances of diaper rash and exposure to harmful chemicals. Needy families cannot absorb medical costs or the cost of diaper rash ointment if their babies develop these side effects.
In deeply poverty-stricken areas of the world, landfills aren't out of the way. They are in the backyards of the people that live there. By giving them disposable diapers we are compounding their problem and creating a genuine public health hazard.

So what will we do?
Well, while there are many cloth diapering companies out there, none of them have a charitable motivation. With ONEBUM every diaper purchase will be matched with a ONEBUM diaper (or receiving blanket - whichever the area of poverty requires most at the time) donated to a baby in need.
Where Is the Money Going?
ONEBUM is dependant on the generous contributors of IndieGoGo to finish launching. So far you know a little about us and lot about why it's important. Need more convincing?
ONEBUM is started by me and my husband Chase. Our full time jobs are marketers - we know how to get customers. And we WILL make ONEBUM a success. Yes, we do have a mentor team. Yes, we do have a business plan. Yes, we do have networking rescources. Yes, we do have a lawyer and accountant. And yes, we are 100% commited to not stopping until we've done our part to change the world.
Our funding goal of $11,000 has been carefully selected. In case you couldn't tell, we don't believe in waste. Every dollar we're asking for has a purpose. So where will the money be going?
Inventory
$8,000 is needed for our start up inventory. This will include the ONEBUM diapers in upwards of 40 different models. It will also include the inventory of other ONEBUM accessories such as diaper liners and inserts (making cloth diapering easier).

Marketing
While Chase and I can do most of the leg-work here, marketing expenses are part of the nature of e-commerce sales. $3,000 is needed for appropriate SEO and outreach expenses.


More About the Perks
Thank You Card
We really do have a special place in our hearts for all of you that will be contributing to our cause. We will endure nights of hand-cramps and unavoidable Carpal Tunnel Syndrome if that's what it takes to thank you.
ONEBUM Bumpersticker

ONEBUM Give-and-Take
What better way to get started with ONEBUM then to make one of the first contributions? We'll send you one of our ONEBUM diapers for you and your baby to enjoy and set one aside for our first ONEBUM donation shipment.
Sponsorship Superstar
Just like the handprints in Hollywood, we will put your name on showcase for the world to see forever. This sponsorship page won't be hidden somewhere where no one can find you. We want people to see how many other people this movement is important to. That means your name front and center.
"I CLOTHED ONEBUM" T-Shirt
In addition to being added to the sponsorship page, we've designed a t-shirt specifically for IndieGoGo contributors for you to sport around and get some recognition for the cause.

ONEBUM Give-and-Take 4 Pack
Just like before, this perk gets your name listed on our sponsorship page. You'll also get a 4-pack of ONEBUM cloth diapers and get a 4-pack donated to children in need.
Your Name On A Run of ONEBUMS
If you couldn't tell, we're excited to show off our contributors. With this perk you get your name on our sponsorship page and added to our tags for a single run. That means when we place a new order of inventory for ONEBUM diapers, one of our $500 contributors will have their name and a "Thank You" next to our logo sewn onto each diaper that goes out on that run. If you've ever dreamed of having your name stamped on an adorable baby's bottom - now's your chance.

ONEBUM Diaper Named After You
After listing your name on our sponsorship page. We'll offer you a selection of ONEBUM diapers to choose from to name after you. For time and all eternity ONEBUM customers will see your name on your selected diaper model. It was the best way we could think of to thank you sincerely for helping making ONEBUM a success.
 


Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that some of you may want to help but simply can't do so at the moment. Here's some other ways you can help make ONEBUM a success:

Use the IndieGoGo share tools to get our project shared all over the web!
Tell your friends and family about ONEBUM

Like our Facebook page and Follow us on Twitter

story:
Build Better. Do Good.

The Architecture/Engineering/Construction (AEC) industry has a responsibility to design and construct buildings that reduce or avoid depletion of critical resources like energy, water, and raw materials to prevent environmental degradation. The world’s best AEC firms achieve these goals while creating built environments that are livable, comfortable, safe and productive. Achieving these goals is a key mission around the globe and is most critical in the third world where resources are often scarce.

WHAT DO YOU GET WHEN YOU COMBINE CREATIVITY, TECHNOLOGY AND THE FREE MARKET?   YOU GET THE AECXCHANGE

Finally, there is a place where you can find creative and artistic design solutions combined with the latest innovations in building technology.

The AECXCHANGE is a clearinghouse for building designs of all shapes and sizes. Our goal is to bring excellent, affordable, sustainable building and structural design to anyone and everyone who needs it around the world.

THERE IS NO PLACE ON THE INTERNET WHERE CAN YOU FIND COMMERCIAL
ARCHITECTURAL DESIGNS FOR IMMEDIATE PURCHASE AND IT’S OUR GOAL TO PROVIDE IT.

 

Help Us Rebuild the Philippines

AECX is committed to doing good by making the world’s best designs available throughout the world. Nowhere is that need greater than in typhoon ravaged Philippines. AECX is committed to helping rebuild the Philippines and with your help we will donate medical, educational, and community care facility designs to qualified charitable organizations. Be a part of the Build Better. Do Good. movement. Donate to AECXCHANGE today and help us Do Good by doing our part to rebuild the Philippines.

AECX has partnered with the American Red Cross to help facilitate the reconstruction efforts, and has made a commitment to donate $100,000 in facility designs.

AECX's Journey

Over the past two years, AECXCHANGE (AECX) has been developing the only source for purchasing commercial buildings and structures plans online. We created an internet based portal for you to search for buildings of all types that will help to reduce the time required for design and construction. This portal provides architects, developers, local governments, contractors, and prospective land owners around the world a place to begin their vision and serve the millions of people who need safe, sustainable structures in which to live and work. AECX’s vision brings you value, convenience, variety, and quality through its Design Prototype System (DPS).



What is the AECX Design Prototype System (DPS)?

AECX has created the Design Prototype System as a process to review, acquire, and bring to market the most creative, functional, innovative and sustainable building designs that exist around the globe.


AECX Features

The AECX website allows you to search via building type, building size, construction cost and a variety of other factors to bring your facility closer to reality on time and on budget. AECX will make quality and safe development possible in places where it was not available before.


Giving Back

The funds garnered from Indiegogo will help us rebuild the Philippines by enabling us to donate medical, educational and community care center design plans to qualified charitable organizations. In addition, your support will facilitate the completion of our Oracle powered e-commerce website allowing us to continue our Do Good mission by helping our customers to Build Better, while providing assistance to those without access to quality facilities designs. 

AECX’s DPS plan database is just the beginning of a series of steps toward revolutionizing the Architecture/Engineering/Construction (AEC) industry. AECX will grow the database through a network of volunteers, design professionals and value added brokers worldwide, trained to locate desirable design content for our growing database.


Who does AECX benefit?

AECX will empower design firms with the opportunity to convert idle, undervalued assets (i.e. building design portfolio) into revenue generating capital assets, introducing a profit center for most architectural firms which have not been realized in the past.

AECX benefits the industry from more than a financial perspective. For the first time, designers on a global level have the opportunity to collaborate and improve projects and design concepts which benefits the architectural community on a world-wide scale.

Most importantly, AECX provides a promising future for the architectural profession and for young architects and recent graduates.


How can you help?

Your contribution today makes a real difference in the lives of the Filipino people. With your help, in collaboration with leading charitable organizations in the United States, we will provide A&E design and construction documents to rebuild desperately needed schools and healthcare clinics in the Philippines. This holiday season we ask you to join us in doing our part. Please consider helping in the following ways:

  • Contribute to this Indiegogo Campaign. Any contribution helps and your support is appreciated.
  • Spread the word to family, friends and colleagues and ask them to match your contribution.
  • Visit AECX Community at and share your thoughts about what we are doing, the AEC industry and send well wishes to the Filipino people. 
  • Share our campaign and mission by distributing this link to your social networks:

  igg.me/at/AECXhelpsthePhilippines


Who should contribute?

Contributors to AECX and this campaign should include the following:

  • Those who are thankful for what you have and want to help those less fortunate
  • Friends and family of the AECX Leadership Team
  • Architecture, Engineering and Design Students seeking a better future
  • Developers and AEC professionals seeking more efficient design solutions
  • Young Architects and Engineers who realize the profession must change
  • Veteran Architects and Engineers who want to capitalize their life's work and secure their financial future


Support & Incentives

Show your support of AECX with a donation of $35 and receive a limited edition AECX Rebuild the Philippines T-shirt featuring, “AECX and I are helping to rebuild the Philippines. Ask me how.”

All supporters will receive free membership to the AECX community that will be launched with the website. With any donation you will also be eligible to receive great discounts toward future purchases from the AECXCHANGE!


FAQs and Company Information

For additional company information visit our website:

http://aec-xchange.com

FAQ


Risks and Challenges

We are working to finalize the AECX e-commerce website while our volunteers and network of brokers are acquiring projects to add to the DPS database. We continue to identify the best building designs that meet the qualifications of our DPS to provide a robust catalog for our customers to support our 2014 e-commerce launch. We will keep you abreast of our progress and informed every step of the way.

Thank you for your continued support!

 

Leadership Team

Karl L. Moody brings to AECX over 20 years of executive level corporate experience. He has served as CEO of Global Technologies Group, Inc. and Assertive Industries, Inc. Mr. Moody is an alumnus of Howard University School of Architecture. 

Kathy D. Dixon, AIA, NOMA, LEED AP is a licensed architect who brings to AECX 20 years of architectural experience in public, private and large corporate sectors of professional practice and is licensed in several states. 

Timothy A. Kephart brings to AECX over 20 years of business experience providing audit and consulting solutions for Fortune 500 companies like Equifax, General Dynamics, KRAFT Foods, Sun Microsystems and many others.  

Vernae Jones-Seals, MBA brings to AECX over 22 years of combined business and financial management leadership collaborating with Entrepreneurs, Boards of Directors, CEOs, Senior Executives on developing business, succession, strategic and tactical plans.


Design, Marketing and Technology Partners

Design, Marketing and Technology Partners

Lillii RNB, Inc. brings to AECX over 12 years of experience working in a variety of digital environments as well as designing and developing an array of e-commerce, POS and mobile web solutions for a broad range the world's leading retailers. 

Hinge Marketing and its experienced team bring 50 plus years to AECX. By specializing in working with professional services firms, Hinge provides A&E specific market research, branding, and corporate positioning which will enable AECX to successfully launch and establish market dominance.

DataPoint brings to AECX expert leadership in systems and network infrastructure design and management services; cloud computing and virtualization; and business broadband solutions.

story:
What's our story?

Hey everyone!  I'm Kathie Missett, the founder of Puppy Love Muffins & Specialty Dog Food.  I bake all natural, complete and balanced, holistic food for dogs.  The concept for Puppy Love Muffins began in early 2012, shortly after adopting our little puppy, Bailey.  Being a rescue, Bailey had some health issues and I wanted to make sure she was getting the best possible diet that she could to help build up her immune system. 

(Click here to read Bailey's story) 

I started researching dog food options and was very disappointed in what I was finding.  I found that even high quality dog food brands are using by-products, artificial preservatives and supplements in their food.  I thought there must be something better.  Like most people, my animals are my family.  I decided my only option to ensure a truly high quality, balanced diet was to make it myself.  With lots of research and lots of baking I developed several recipes that have all of the nutrients dogs require without the need for added supplements.*  Just what I was looking for:  a food high in antioxidants, made with fresh, high quality ingredients that you can actually see.  A holistic dog food with ingredients specifically selected to help my dogs lead a long, healthy, active life.  Who wouldn't want that for their own dog?  That got me thinking, "Why do most people have to settle for what the pet food industry is selling them?  Who says that dog food has to be brown little dry bits with supplements and by-products?"  Dogs deserve quality food too.  That is when my love for my puppy sparked the idea for Puppy Love Muffins & Specialty Dog Food.  I thought there must be other people out there that are looking for a high quality holistic food for their dogs too.  So I've spent the last year working on developing my business and I now need some funding to help bring it to market.  This is where I'm hoping you can help. 

*Source the AAFCO 2008 Nutrient Profile for Dogs

What We Need & What You Get

My goal for this campaign is to raise the $25,000 needed to grow my start up business.  Plain and simple.   I have put as much as I have (heart, soul and money) into Puppy Love Muffins because I truly believe in it.  I know there are other people out there that are looking for better options for their dogs healthy diet.  Now I need help getting my product out on the market.  Here is what I am looking to achieve over the next twelve months and what it is going to take to get there.

~ Business: 

The 'business' side of the business is just as important as the product itself.  All the marketing in the world won't help me to succeed if there isn't a solid business foundation.  These are several of the business expenses that will need funding.  These expenses are estimated to run between $6,000 and $8,000.

  • Trademark

  • Insurance

  • Commercial kitchen rental

  • Inventory

  • Accounting and legal representation

  • APPA Membership (required to attend World Pet Expo)

~ Marketing:

There are several pet industry expos that I think would be important to attend in 2014.  One is local (San Diego) and that is the Amazing Pet Expo. This event is open to the public and would help get Puppy Love Muffins in front of the local consumer.  Other events would be the Global Pet Expo being held in Florida in March 2014 and Super Zoo being held in Las Vegas in July.  These are two of the largest industry only events and would give me the opportunity to get my product in front of the representatives for stores world wide.  These expenses are estimated to run around $8,000.

Another marketing tool is to get Puppy Love Muffins reviewed by industry magazines, television shows, bloggers etc.  This requires manufacturing and shipping samples to numerous people in the pet food industry. 

Finally, I will promote Puppy Love Muffins locally with in-store sampling, sponsoring non-profit animal organizations fundraisers and promotional items.

Whatever funds are left remaining will be spent on these marketing ideas.  I'm hoping this will be in the $5,000 range.

 

  • Attend pet industry expos to promote Puppy Love Muffins and build relationships with retailers and consumers

  • Product samples for review by industry media, bloggers etc.

  • Product sampling in-store and at community events

  • Promotional items (dog t-shirts, bandanas, etc.)

  • Food donations/sponsorships to non-profit animal fundraisers

~Indiegogo, Pay Pal fees and perks:

Running a fund raising campaign does have fees and the cost of the perks offered.  How much of our funding will go to these fees depends upon how much I raise.  If I raise the full amount I'm seeking these fees and expenses are estimated to run around $5,000. 

Now to the good stuff :)

To show how much we appreciate your time and generosity,  I've put together some special gifts you will pawsitively love.  From a 'Save Our Pets' window decal to having a Puppy Love Muffins recipe named for your dog.  Check the list to your right for information on all of the thank you gifts.  All contributors will receive a thank you on our sponsor page on the Puppy Love Muffins website and a shout out on our Facebook page.  I'm also including a link to our menu and some valuable information on our ingredients below.   

The Future of the Pet Food Industry

In 2012 over $20 billion was spent on pet food in the United States.  By 2017 US sales are forecast to reach $26.6 billion while the global pet food market is projected to reach $74.8 billion. 

According to Packaged Facts, a market analysis firm, sales of natural pet food products are predicted to grow by 10 to 15 percent annually from 2014 to 2017.

Pet Business, a publication dedicated to the pet supplies retailing industry reports that natural and holistic pet food sales reached $15 billion in 2008 and has been growing 20% annually since.  IBISWorld projects that this 20% growth rate will continue over the next four years to 2017.

This is the perfect time to launch Puppy Love Muffins & Specialty Dog Food.  Industry trends have shown that there is a market and a need for our product. 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Trust me.  I know sometimes it's impossible to contribute financially but that doesn't mean you can't still help.  Share my campaign on your Facebook page, Twitter, email list .  You never know who you might reach by sharing.  Help me send this around the world!  Spreading the word is a huge part of a successful campaign so it would be greatly appreciated.  The more people sharing my campaign the more likely I will be able to achieve my goal.  I only have a short period of time to get the word out so don't delay :)

"But Kathie, I don't have a dog."  Well you can still make a contribution,  give a perk as a Valentine's Day gift to a dog lover in your life (how cute is that!) or pay it forward by donating your perk to Baja Animal Sanctuary.   Win, win, win situation. 

Thanks so much for getting this far on my site.  Wish me luck!

 

Kathie
story_txt:
What's our story?Hey everyone!  I'm Kathie Missett, the founder of Puppy Love Muffins & Specialty Dog Food.  I bake all natural, complete and balanced, holistic food for dogs.  The concept for Puppy Love Muffins began in early 2012, shortly after adopting our little puppy, Bailey.  Being a rescue, Bailey had some health issues and I wanted to make sure she was getting the best possible diet that she could to help build up her immune system.  

(Click here to read Bailey's story)  
I started researching dog food options and was very disappointed in what I was finding.  I found that even high quality dog food brands are using by-products, artificial preservatives and supplements in their food.  I thought there must be something better.  Like most people, my animals are my family.  I decided my only option to ensure a truly high quality, balanced diet was to make it myself.  With lots of research and lots of baking I developed several recipes that have all of the nutrients dogs require without the need for added supplements.*  Just what I was looking for:  a food high in antioxidants, made with fresh, high quality ingredients that you can actually see.  A holistic dog food with ingredients specifically selected to help my dogs lead a long, healthy, active life.  Who wouldn't want that for their own dog?  That got me thinking, "Why do most people have to settle for what the pet food industry is selling them?  Who says that dog food has to be brown little dry bits with supplements and by-products?"  Dogs deserve quality food too.  That is when my love for my puppy sparked the idea for Puppy Love Muffins & Specialty Dog Food.  I thought there must be other people out there that are looking for a high quality holistic food for their dogs too.  So I've spent the last year working on developing my business and I now need some funding to help bring it to market.  This is where I'm hoping you can help.  
*Source the AAFCO 2008 Nutrient Profile for Dogs


What We Need & What You Get
My goal for this campaign is to raise the $25,000 needed to grow my start up business.  Plain and simple.   I have put as much as I have (heart, soul and money) into Puppy Love Muffins because I truly believe in it.  I know there are other people out there that are looking for better options for their dogs healthy diet.  Now I need help getting my product out on the market.  Here is what I am looking to achieve over the next twelve months and what it is going to take to get there.
~ Business:  
The 'business' side of the business is just as important as the product itself.  All the marketing in the world won't help me to succeed if there isn't a solid business foundation.  These are several of the business expenses that will need funding.  These expenses are estimated to run between $6,000 and $8,000.

Trademark
Insurance
Commercial kitchen rental
Inventory
Accounting and legal representation
APPA Membership (required to attend World Pet Expo)

~ Marketing: 
There are several pet industry expos that I think would be important to attend in 2014.  One is local (San Diego) and that is the Amazing Pet Expo. This event is open to the public and would help get Puppy Love Muffins in front of the local consumer.  Other events would be the Global Pet Expo being held in Florida in March 2014 and Super Zoo being held in Las Vegas in July.  These are two of the largest industry only events and would give me the opportunity to get my product in front of the representatives for stores world wide.  These expenses are estimated to run around $8,000.
Another marketing tool is to get Puppy Love Muffins reviewed by industry magazines, television shows, bloggers etc.  This requires manufacturing and shipping samples to numerous people in the pet food industry.  
Finally, I will promote Puppy Love Muffins locally with in-store sampling, sponsoring non-profit animal organizations fundraisers and promotional items.
Whatever funds are left remaining will be spent on these marketing ideas.  I'm hoping this will be in the $5,000 range.
 

Attend pet industry expos to promote Puppy Love Muffins and build relationships with retailers and consumers
Product samples for review by industry media, bloggers etc.
Product sampling in-store and at community events
Promotional items (dog t-shirts, bandanas, etc.)
Food donations/sponsorships to non-profit animal fundraisers

~Indiegogo, Pay Pal fees and perks:
Running a fund raising campaign does have fees and the cost of the perks offered.  How much of our funding will go to these fees depends upon how much I raise.  If I raise the full amount I'm seeking these fees and expenses are estimated to run around $5,000.  
Now to the good stuff :)
To show how much we appreciate your time and generosity,  I've put together some special gifts you will pawsitively love.  From a 'Save Our Pets' window decal to having a Puppy Love Muffins recipe named for your dog.  Check the list to your right for information on all of the thank you gifts.  All contributors will receive a thank you on our sponsor page on the Puppy Love Muffins website and a shout out on our Facebook page.  I'm also including a link to our menu and some valuable information on our ingredients below.   



The Future of the Pet Food Industry 
In 2012 over $20 billion was spent on pet food in the United States.  By 2017 US sales are forecast to reach $26.6 billion while the global pet food market is projected to reach $74.8 billion.  
According to Packaged Facts, a market analysis firm, sales of natural pet food products are predicted to grow by 10 to 15 percent annually from 2014 to 2017.
Pet Business, a publication dedicated to the pet supplies retailing industry reports that natural and holistic pet food sales reached $15 billion in 2008 and has been growing 20% annually since.  IBISWorld projects that this 20% growth rate will continue over the next four years to 2017.
This is the perfect time to launch Puppy Love Muffins & Specialty Dog Food.  Industry trends have shown that there is a market and a need for our product.  
 


 
Other Ways You Can Help
Trust me.  I know sometimes it's impossible to contribute financially but that doesn't mean you can't still help.  Share my campaign on your Facebook page, Twitter, email list .  You never know who you might reach by sharing.  Help me send this around the world!  Spreading the word is a huge part of a successful campaign so it would be greatly appreciated.  The more people sharing my campaign the more likely I will be able to achieve my goal.  I only have a short period of time to get the word out so don't delay :)
"But Kathie, I don't have a dog."  Well you can still make a contribution,  give a perk as a Valentine's Day gift to a dog lover in your life (how cute is that!) or pay it forward by donating your perk to Baja Animal Sanctuary.   Win, win, win situation.  
Thanks so much for getting this far on my site.  Wish me luck!
 
Kathie

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone and thanks for reading.  My name is Richard and I have been a passionate brewer for many years, stemming from my time as a wine maker in Alsace in France (If you love wine and have never tried Alsace white you most at some point it is so good).  However until earlier this year I was stuck working in IT again which is my original profession, nothing like as fun and rewarding as making beer and wine! That was until I was made redundant. Which leads me to this new and exciting part of my life.

I would like to bring my passion for beer making to the high street in a format that is close to the micropub movement but with the added twist of making some of the beer onsite with the help and input from the drinking public. I would naturally look to sell some of the worlds best craft beer along site and who knows perhaps one day the drinking public could have helped in creating award winning beers as well.   In short I want everyone to see and enjoy the art of craft beer making up close and personal and perhaps even take the leap themselves into making their own beer at home, and even beyond.        

What We Need & What You Get

To bring this to the high street I need your help.  As we all know the banks are all very busy doing other things apart from leading to us, and I feel my idea being unique in what it offers is best suited to the indiegogo platform. 

So I am asking for £10,000 in funding, this is to cover the rental costs of suitable premises I am looking at something around the £16,000 per year mark, 3 months’ rent as deposit coming in at around £4000.  Around £1000 for stock of drinks from other craft brewers and wineries (you didn’t think I would leave the wine out did you?)  Around £1000 of site works to get the space ready and the same again (£1000) of small brewery parts (luckily most of the brewery is in place in my shed).  £1000 would then be ear marked for brewing ingredients.  This would leave £2000 partly as a backup in the first months of opening and also to cover running costs (Gas, water, electric, business rates and insurance to name but a few) I do not intent on taking a salary until the business is running at a good level.  

So interested in buying in?  Want to know about the perks? I thought so.

Well £10 gets your name on our website on the thankyou page and invite to annual private BBQ

£20 all of the above and your name displayed in the bar on a wall of thanks photo included if you like.

Big jump £500 gets you the naming rights to one of 12 planned special series beers for a minimum of 3 year run, (some restrictions will apply i.e. cannot be a name already used and not offence) plus the BBQ invite and special place on the wall of thanks.

£1000 permanent naming rights to a regular beer and beer label design/input plus all the other perks.  Naming restrictions will still apply. (This beer would also be sold to other outlets)

£2000 Help design, make, name your very own permanent beer and label plus all the other perks Naming restrictions will still apply. (This beer would also be sold to other outlets)

If the £10,000 target is not reached the money raised will go towards the brewing side of the business first and then to other costs accordingly. 

The Impact

The real ale market is growing year on year, new breweries are opening all the time and are one of the great success stories overriding the current financial crisis. Brewing will not make you rich but it is an honest skilled trade.  The current trend for pubs in the UK closing their doors is terrible but the real ale trade is in a very small way helping to keep a few going, imagine a high street with no pubs? A micropub is a new type of pub with the heart of a community type pub leaning more towards talking than drinking and getting people involved.  They are generally setup in old vacant shops.      My idea is to take that one step further and to use the making of beer a great opener to everyone and anyone. To have a micropub with attached craft brewery and to make it a fun place to a drink or two with like-minded people.  Please do drop me a line for any other info even if you are not making a donation I am only too happy to talk.  Micropubs can be found on wikipedia http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Micropub and also at www.micropub.co.uk   

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help spread the word any way you can indiegogo have some great tools to make it easy.  In a beer society like camra please spread the word with them as well.  As much help as you can offer would be warmly welcomed with open arms.

story:
For nearly two decades, Club Filipina has existed at Wellesley to promote social, political, and economic awareness of the Philippines. We welcome all those of Filipina descent or those who wish to appreciate our unique culture. This year, the club seeks your generous consideration and support as they try to raise funds for Super Typhoon Haiyan victims.

On the morning of Friday, November 8th, one of the largest storms recorded in the world’s history mercilessly slammed into Visayas, the central region of the Philippines. After ravaging some of the country’s poorest areas, Haiyan, code name Yolanda, has affected 11.3 million of the Philippines’ 96.7 million. Of those affected, 2.5 million are still in dire need of food, and 800,000 people have been displaced from their homes.

Now, over a week since Haiyan hit, relief goods from all over the globe have poured into the Philippines. However, mobilization of these essential goods still remains a key issue. Club Filipina, deeply affected by this typhoon due to our familial and patriotic ties to our home country, wishes to raise money for the reconstruction of homes on Bantayan Island, a small island off the coast of Cebu. Due to its remote location, international help in this area has been scarce. In junction with the Knights of Columbus, a long-standing philanthropic organization, we hope to provide support to the many who lost their homes during Haiyan.

Our club members have family members who are active in the Knights of Columbus in the Philippines. The Knights of Columbus has numerous councils throughout the Philippines and has several ways of ensuring the mobilization of goods. Donations of any amount will be greatly appreciated. With your help, we hope to directly aid those in dire need.

Thank you very much for your time and consideration!

For more information about the typhoon, please visit this page.

story:
Breve reseña

Somos una pareja  emprendedora a la vez que swinger  para quién no conozca el término swinger  a muy groso modo significa liberal…

Frecuentamos locales de intercambio de parejas  y de aquí ha surgido nuestro proyecto "Mon Petit Club"

El uso te hace ver el abuso  y ante esto queremos abrir nuestro propio Club social Swinger


Es Petit, porque se trata de un local acogedor y con todos los detalles cuidados al máximo. Queremos que las personas inscritas se sientan como en casa .

Con precios Low Cost sin descuidar la calidad y la higiene que es una de nuestras máximas...

Es un club  porque en él están personas que tienen los mismos intereses y aficiones : relacionarse socialmente y disfrutar del erotismo y la sensualidad de encuentros ocasionales  en un ambiente acogedor que invite  a mostrarse tal cual sin tabús.

El proyecto que queremos iniciar y para el cuál pedimos la colaboración por crowfunding es la adquisición de un local que esta dividido en dos plantas .

Para comenzar a trabajar vamos a alquilar la planta baja y adecuar las instalaciones  ( mobiliario, servicio de barra, música ambiente... ) si todo funciona, posteriormente uniremos a nuestro local la parte de arriba compuesta de habitaciones que incluyen : jacuzzi, zona de juegos y un ambiente cálido y relajante…

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Al margen de una pequeña reforma para adecuación, buscaremos negociar con fabricantes de mobiliario, para que el Petit Club cuente con la máxima calidad

Instalaremos una cama gigante de aproximadamente 8 Metros y una barra de Pole Dance que posteriormente se utilizará para dar clases gratis a los socios !

Instalaremos TV. y equipos de sonido e iluminación por LED

Se instalarán Ozonificadores, para mantener el ambiente lo más puro posible

Necesitamos también instalar taquillas en la zona de vestuario.

Queremos agradecer tu aportación en nuestro proyecto y para ello tenemos reservados regalitos que estamos seguros te van a encantar


Tenemos pensados estos tipos de aportaciones, con sus respectivas recompensas !

  • APORTACIÓN DE 20€ , Conseguirás una invitación individual a la inauguración del local, que incluye cena y 2 copas por persona.

  • APORTACIÓN DE 50€, Conseguirás una invitación DOBLE VÁLIDA PARA UNA PAREJA, que incluye cena y 3 copas por persona

  • APORTACIÓN DE 90€, Conseguirás un PASE MENSUAL, que incluye entrada libre al local viernes y sábados, 15 copas + la cena el día de la inauguración ! + Descuento del 50% copas extras + derecho a uso particular del local los días que no esté abierto ( por ejemplo celebración de un cumpleaños, organización de un tupper sex, dar masajes, hacer una sesión de fotos en el local, una cena en plan Petit con algunas parejas amigas) Mon Petit Club sera de todos !

  • APORTACIÓN DE 250€, Conseguirás un PASE TRIMESTRAL, que incluye entrada libre al local viernes y sábados, 45 copas + la cena el día de la inauguración ! + Descuento del 50% copas extras + derecho a uso particular del local los días que no esté abierto ( por ejemplo celebración de un cumpleaños, organización de un tupper sex, dar masajes, hacer una sesión de fotos en el local, una cena en plan Petit con algunas parejas amigas) Mon Petit Club sera de todos ! + Un exclusivo colgante bañado en plata de diseño exclusivo de IDF Jewels

El impacto

Queremos desmarcarnos por completo de los típicos locales swingers, donde la gente es un simple numero, donde los dueños pocas veces son liberales.. y donde se lleva haciendo un abuso astronómico y un atropello moral sin razón.

Tu aportacion nos ayudará a sacar adelante este pequeño proyecto, que comienza aquí pero no sabemos donde acaba !  

Daremos inicialmente trabajo a una persona, en nómina y con sus correspondientes seguros sociales. y obviamente tendrán preferencia los "parados" que formen parte del proyecto

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Si has llegado hasta aquí, y no te animas a hacer una aportación en metálico que nos ayude a conseguir el objetivo.

Puedes ayudarnos dando máxima difusión al proyecto, estaremos igual de agradecidos y te esperaremos igualmente cualquier dia para que pases a conocer Mon Petit Club

Tu aportacion nos ayudará a sacar adelante este pequeño proyecto, que comienza aquí pero no sabemos donde acaba !  
Daremos inicialmente trabajo a una persona, en nómina y con sus correspondientes seguros sociales. y obviamente tendrán preferencia los "parados" que formen parte del proyecto 
Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

story:
My Story

  • When I was 13, I was introduced to the concept of social justice by my mentor, Jonathan Chan, who introduced me to an organization called charity: water. Inspired by the spirit to give, I started my first charity: water campaign when I turned 14.
  • For the last four years, I have given up my birthday to raise money for charity: water. Instead of asking for gifts, I asked people to donate to charity: water; in total, I've raised $4,000 over the last four years. 
  • This year, I'm turning 18, and I want to celebrate by raising money again, this time through the charity: concert, where I hope to raise $2,000 for charity: water, 

    a non-profit organization bringing clean and safe drinking water to people in developing nations. 100% of the proceeds given to charity: water will directly fund clean water solutions.

The Goal

  • charity: water strongly enforces the 100% model, which means 100% of the money donated to charity: water will go directly to projects on the field. To make sure 100%  of the money from ticket sales can go directly to charity: water, we need private donors like you to help cover operating costs. 
  • 100% of your donations to this charity: concert page will go to the operating costs of the charity: concert. All proceeds will then go directly to charity: water after operating costs are met.
  • Depending on the amount of your donation, you can receive 1-5 VIP tickets, which will get you seats in the first 5 rows of the concert!

The Impact

  • charity: water will show GPS coordinates, pictures, and other sources of evidence to show exactly where your money went in the field 18 months after the completion of the campaign.

The Concert

  • If you can't donate today, that's okay! You can buy your tickets to the concert in January! The concert is on January 24, 2014 at the Diamond Bar High School Theater from 7:00-9:00 P.M.
story_txt:
My Story
When I was 13, I was introduced to the concept of social justice by my mentor, Jonathan Chan, who introduced me to an organization called charity: water. Inspired by the spirit to give, I started my first charity: water campaign when I turned 14.
For the last four years, I have given up my birthday to raise money for charity: water. Instead of asking for gifts, I asked people to donate to charity: water; in total, I've raised $4,000 over the last four years. 
This year, I'm turning 18, and I want to celebrate by raising money again, this time through the charity: concert, where I hope to raise $2,000 for charity: water, a non-profit organization bringing clean and safe drinking water to people in developing nations. 100% of the proceeds given to charity: water will directly fund clean water solutions.

The Goal
charity: water strongly enforces the 100% model, which means 100% of the money donated to charity: water will go directly to projects on the field. To make sure 100%  of the money from ticket sales can go directly to charity: water, we need private donors like you to help cover operating costs. 
100% of your donations to this charity: concert page will go to the operating costs of the charity: concert. All proceeds will then go directly to charity: water after operating costs are met.
Depending on the amount of your donation, you can receive 1-5 VIP tickets, which will get you seats in the first 5 rows of the concert!
The Impact
charity: water will show GPS coordinates, pictures, and other sources of evidence to show exactly where your money went in the field 18 months after the completion of the campaign.


The Concert
If you can't donate today, that's okay! You can buy your tickets to the concert in January! The concert is on January 24, 2014 at the Diamond Bar High School Theater from 7:00-9:00 P.M.

story:
Version Française:
http://urbangreenhouse.blogspot.com/2011/06/announcing-paris-urban-farming.html



What we want to do is this:

  • Get a bunch of people together; makers, growers and organisers.
  • Locate the unused and empty lots and blocks of land in Paris.
  • Approach the land owners for permission, on the understanding that we'll be gone the day they say to be, and we won't leave a mark.
  • Build several greenhouses and other useful things.
  • Farm Paris.


This isn't for demonstration purposes or raising awareness etc, this is to grow large quantities of good food year round. When we inevitably get moved on from a block, pack everything up and shift to the next in less than a week. The only limiting factors are how much land we'd have access to and how many people are involved. All tech and infrastructure will be open source and hopefully we'll get copied.


Other potential projects to build in:

  • Free permaculture university (PDCs do not need to be that expensive)
  • Open circus/juggling/parkour/graff space (plants like CO2, I like aerialist silks)
  • Energy and water production (might as well testbed some stuff while we're here)


Email: ufcparis at gmail com

Facebook group

Blog (photos, updates, extra information)

Main discussion forum


The amount of money needed is low, but we're wanting to start building straight away, hoping to have the greenhouse constructed and ready to plant by early August.

Breakdown of costs:

180 € / 250 $US    Greenhouse plastic.
30 € / 50 $US        Nails, screws, rope etc.
50 € / 70 $US        Transportation of materials (trailer for the poles, scrap wood, soil, etc)
50 € / 70 $US        Materials for non electrical temperature regulation system and other tech.
40 € / 60 $US        Seeds, plant food, gardening tools, etc.

Total = 350 € / 500 $US

Any extra funds raised will go into the next greenhouse. The aim is to be building and farming a lot of these, and not just in Paris...

Thanks!

story:
Rodney and Me

To say that Rodney was born without a silver spoon in his mouth would be an understatement. My name is Future, and I am Rodney's cousin. I was born in the exact location as Rodney. The same hospital and the same apartment complex where we grew up in our younger days. The apartment complex was a section 8 apartment (low rent government subsidized). We even lived in the same building and the same floor.  Our walls and our bedrooms were just six inches apart. Rodney was just born four months after me.  To this day, he says that he is older than me just so he can feel like he has something over me in a playful way.  I've come to the conclusion, over the past few years, that he is my guardian angel.
 
 

 

The Early Years

First, I have tell you about his hard life, and how he got the name "The Cat with Nine Lives". We were born to single mothers with mostly absentee fathers. When Rodney was about two years old, he fell from his second story window onto the concrete sidewalk.  After surviving the fall, he began to sleepwalk and have seizures. Somewhere between ages seven and eight, Rodney had two more traumatic things happen to him. First, his head was slammed between one of those big industrial dumpster lids.  Next, he was run over by a car in the apartment complex parking lot. When Rodney was about eleven years old, he was accidentally shot in the neck by his step father. His step father had the gun in his three quarter boot.  When he sat down to get the gun out of his boot, Rodney walked toward him. He took the gun out, placed it on the dresser, and the gun went off. It turns out that the bullet just missed his jugular vein. When Rodney turned 17, he was in a bad car wreck in which the car flipped over.  And, the car was left completely mangled and totaled. 
 

Guardian Angel

I thank God that he survived all of these life threatening moments. If he had not survived, I would not have known what a guardian angel he is for me.  I'm sure for others as well. Looking back on our lives together, I realized that he has been there for me every time I've needed him for anything. How many people can you say that someone has never let you down? Well, that's the way I feel about my cousin Rodney.  That is why I consider him my guardian angel.  
 
Now, he is a guardian angel in need of our help. Hebrews 13:2 says Don't forget to show hospitality to strangers, for some who have done this have entertained angels without realizing it. I say, if you believe in God's word, the Holy Bible, then you believe that angels walk among us.  So, it is possible that he is an angel.  This is my belief, and my guardian angel needs your help.

Asking for help

Rodney doesn't ask for much, but we think that he needs some things.  He only wants to take care of his children and make a better life for them.  But, our goal of this IndieGoGo page is to help Rodney.

story:
The Fairy Godmother Project (La Hada Madrina Proyecto)

I initially planned to do this project around Lake Aititlan, Guatemala, back in March, 2012, but a few weeks before leaving I fell down the stairs and long story short, didn't walk for 6 months.  Now, the Universe has dropped into my lap an opportunity to do this again, with many hands and hearts to help. The International Gathering of the Rainbow Family of Living Light will be in Mexico from December first to January first, and it is the perfect place and time to find philanthropic minded, enthusiastic kids who want to make a difference in the world. Everything happens for a reason, and everything happens in its own season... and I now think thats why I had to wait.  

http://www.globalrainbowgatherings.org/

 

I have a lot of exciting plans, one of which is to reintroduce "Chaya", a forgotten staple food of the ancient Maya, which grows for many years, up to 10 feet tall.  It is spinach-like, producing up to 10 lbs of leaves per season with four times the nutrients of spinach. I would like to start community garden projects, utilizing permaculture techniques of 5 layers of growth, with chichen tractors beneath for weeding and fertilization, while also providing offspring and eggs. Tilapia (fast growing fish) ponds could easily and cheaply provide lean protein quickly and prolifically. I originally became interested in the Maya, when the group entity, "Five" began to write first person accounts of Mayan life in the late 1600's and their connection with the legendary Starpeople. You can see the resulting books here~  

  http://www.amazon.com/s/ref=nb_sb_noss?url=search-alias%3Daps&field-keywords=tales+of+the+starpeople 

and from that grew this website

http://www.channelingfive.com

THE MAYA SAY WE ARE USHERING IN THE DAWN OF THE FIFTH SUN, AND THAT IT SIGNALS A PLANETARY AWAKENING AND A MOVE TO A MORE LOVING VIBRATION. FEEDING THE HUNGRY IS ONE OF THE MOST LOVING GESTURES I KNOW. WON'T YOU HELP ME FEED THE NEXT FEW GENERATIONS OF MAYAN CHILDREN BY HELPING US BUY SOME THEM SOME FRUIT TREES?

 

The initial funds will be used to secure a building to collect supplies, to grow seeds, and house the soup kitchen.  The hope is to also invest in a large amount of bulk dried foods (corn, beans, rice) for distribution in 5 lb increments. During this initial distribution phase,  a needs assessment will be done in each village for future assistance program implementation and seeds will be germinated to add to the permaculture garden starter packs during phase 2, at which time we hope to have expanded to community gardens and gardening classes for the young.

We will also concurrently be running a daily soup kitchen, where immediate needs can be addressed, such as first aid, shoe distribution, and other requests as funding allows.

Future dream plans include workshops of cob building techniques for personal home improvement, solar water purification techniques, english classes, and finding personal Fairy Godmothers for orphaned children and the elderly who have no where to turn. There is no shortage of need in the Mayan villages of Mexico.

            It's up to us to help each other.

   If not you, then who?    If not now, when?

10 dollars worth of beans and rice will feed a family of 5 all week. Many families here live on one dollar a day. How long this project can last and how far it can reach is up to you. It starts here. THIS is the most crutial time. If this campaign works, we can start someting that can grow as the Rainbow Family itself has. Some refer to themselves as Rainbow Warriors from Hopi Prophecy, and if that is true, the time is nigh. Lets start a movement that spreads!

One $30 apple tree will provide over 2000 apples a year for 80-100 years.

One $4 chicken will produce over 500 eggs in her 80 weeks of laying.

SPREAD A LITTLE MAGIC-MAKE A BIG DIFFERENCE.

campaign_city: Villages between Palenque Mx and, Guatemala

story:
*All online donations will be going directly to Red Cross!

We are helping to raise funds and goods for our local community, long island communities, and the city boroughs that were greatly affected by Hurricane Sandy. Your help will provide food, warmth, and hope to those that lost so much.

We are starting off our campaign with a “Relay for Relief” on November 4th, 2012 from 10:00am – 12:00pm at Jean Cochran Park in Peconic NY. This community event will allow participants to walk or run the ½ mile track (as much as they like) while helping raise funds for those in need. Suggested donation to participate is $10. We will also be accepting the following items:

  • Industrial strength garbage bags
  • Heavy duty rubber gloves
  • Water
  • Non-perishable food
  • Flashlights and batteries (AA, AAA, D)
  • Generators
  • Hand sanitizer
  • Toilet paper
  • Toiletries (toothbrushes, tooth paste, shampoo, soap, ect)
  • New underwear and socks of all sizes
  • Paper goods (to distribute food)
  • Baby items (diapers, wipes, ect)
  • Toys/activities for kids
  • Gas and gas cans
  • Plastic bins
  • Dog and cat food
  • Manual can openers
  • Clean, dry, new and gently used clothing
  • Blankets, pillows
  • Hats, gloves, jackets
  • Cleaning supplies
  • Any other items that you can think of that can help in the efforts of rebuilding!

We will also be continuing to accept goods at the following business until 11/10/12.

JABS

605 Pike Street

Mattituck NY 11952

Please help us in our efforts to help our communities get back on their feet and our neighborhoods rebuilt!

Thank you.

story:
What's TYNIT?

TYNIT is a platform that helps you create easy itineraries and share those plans so everyone can follow along.  It also provides you with a collection of itineraries created by other people so you don't have to do any planning!

 

Create custom itineraries here that are specific to an area of town to suit different moods such as exploration, vacation, or nightlife.  Yelp! information will help with your choices.

 

Just want to find a sweet itinerary that has already been created for your area or mood? No problem! Check out our collection of itineraries provided by other fun loving people!

 

 

Itineraries can be reviewed and rated so you know which ones are the best.  When you create itineraries, they are posted to your profile so you can show off your planning skills!

 

Why TYNIT?

While having fun in San Diego with friends and family, we wondered how we could share our experiences with everyone.  We searched for options, but there weren’t any apps or websites available that met our needs.

There should be a way for you to share your experiences and easily find fun stuff to do! Life is short-you should spend more time doing what you love!

We're putting all of our efforts and savings into this project to make it a reality, but we need your help to make it the best website possible!

Where will the $$$ Go?

All investments will go toward development, marketing, and launching costs of TYNIT!

The Perks You Receive!

First things first, thank you so much for your time, consideration, and investment!  It's all good if you can't back our campaign financially, but it'd be awesome if you could share it with everyone that you know! Sharing is free!

Check out examples of Chris's art in our gallery.  He will be sure to put extra love and attention in your artwork!

We are flexible with the perks!  So if there's something you want, and it doesn't quite line up with the stated price, let us know and we'll work it out!

THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU!

The TYNIT family & contributors:

Chris - Captain

L

Lea - Navigator

Gainlight Studios Peoria, IL - All things brand 

Creative Nicole San Diego, CA- Development and Consultation

 

 DJ iamslap - Music

Haste Theatre London, England - Theatrics

story:
I am Denise Steffenhagen, who lives half the year in Prineville, OR, and the other half in Todos Santos, BCS, Mexico, where the Hogar Del Nino orphanage is located.

There are many of us volunteers that are helping Pastor Joel Hernandez at HDN with food and donations for the varying number of children living there.

The orphanage uses energy efficient light bulbs but their electric bill is very large due to the fact that there is only one meter to all of the buildings and trailers on the property and the electric company charges a higher rate if the monthly usage is high on a meter.  The electric company will not change their method of billing and so it is imperative that the electric system be sorted out and rewired so that their monthly expenses will be reduced.

The goal of this campaign is to raise $2,000, which would be enough to start the paperwork for the project.  The total amount would be 9,800 to redo the wiring at the HDN property so that there is a meter at each building and trailer.  All the people who live on the HDN property are volunteers and only get room and board for whatever they do to keep this great orphanage running smoothly.

The only perk that I am able to give are heartfelt prayers for your well-being.

Please contribute here or go to http://padrinoproject.com/ for more information. 

You can even become a monthly supporter of this wonderful orphanage at that website.
Whether you contribute or not, please share this campaign with everyone on your email list.

For Spanish website, please go to http://hogardelnino.org.mx/ .

Thank you and bless you always.

story:
(Please see: Updates for detailed project description)

 

My name is Brenna and I am the founder of the Beeyond a Bike 
campaign. In 2012 I rode my bicycle across Canada, to New York City, and then over 10,000 kilometers across the continent of Africa.

In the beginning, I thought I was on a really basic journey -
that my inspiration was a love for cycling coupled with a desire
to support and fundraise for an NGO that empowers women and
communities in Uganda. However, once I began riding in Africa, I
very quickly realized that I was being driven by a passion much
deeper than that. Very soon into my journey I realized that it
was about being a woman - an empowered and independant woman -
pushing limits, overcoming obstacles and challenging stereotypes
while riding my bicycle.

When I reached Egypt, just after I had given my bike away, I had
a dream. I woke up the next morning and knew, with utmost
certainty, that my journey had just begun. I needed to return to
Canada and learn absoultely everything I possibly could about
bicycles. Then, I would return to Africa to share the things I
had learned in order to support women and communities to growing
stronger, more efficient, and more empowered by using bicycles.

And so it was:

BEEYOND A BIKE WAS BORN!

Beginning in May 2013, I will ride my bicycle from Vancouver,
Canada to Phoenix, Arizona, carrying all of the tools I need for
basic bike maintenance and repair - henceforth dubbed: The
Beeyond a Bike Mobile Shop. Along the route I will visit
community bike shops, schools and other facilities and offer
bicycle presentations and workshops to **vulnerable demographic
groups. These include women, queer, youth and low-income
communities and more about vulnerable demographic is explained
below.


Workshops are free or by donation, and the funds I raise as I
travel throgh North America will purchase tools for a high
school bicycle program in South Africa***. More information
about this group is also below! After approximately 3 months of
cycling in the US, I will fly to Cape Town, South Africa and
then take 6-12 months to bike to Nairobi, Kenya. Through Africa,
I will volunteer my skills and knowledge of bike mechanics with
already-operating bicycle organizations and run several
independant Beeyond a Bike workshops in other communities along
the way. Places I will visit and teach include Fisantekraal High
School in South Africa, Zambikes in Zambia and women in the
community of Arusha, Tanzania.

In order to make this all possible, I need your help! Please
donate today - $1, $5, $20 ... everything helps - so that I can
establish the Beeyond a Bike Mobile Shop and be capable of
sharing my skills and knowledge as I travel across the US and
Africa. I thank you in advance for your kindness and generosity.

Beeyond A Bike is about more than just pushing pedals; It's
about empowering people. It's about more than changing gears;
It's about changing the world: One community at a time.


**'Vulnerable demograpics' describes categories of people who:

1) Are under-represented in the bicycle community;
2) Have or feel like they have limited to no access to bicycles
and/or knowledge surrounding bicycle mechanics, and/or;
3) Have the potential to greatly impact their communities and
improve their quality of life when able to access a bicycle and
resources/education related to bicycles.


*** Fisantekraal is the name of a township approximately 40 km
from Cape Town, South Africa. Peace and Love International, in
partnership with Fisanekraal High School, is preparing to launch
a bicycle education program in the school in the coming year.
The group has recently received 15 donated bicycles and is in
the process of developing a program that provides education to
their students in bicycle mechanics and repair. Beeyond a Bike
hopes to generate at least $1000 in donations in order to
purchase the tools they require as well as other costs of
programming that will arise.
story_txt:
(Please see: Updates for detailed project description)
 
My name is Brenna and I am the founder of the Beeyond a Bike campaign. In 2012 I rode my bicycle across Canada, to New York City, and then over 10,000 kilometers across the continent of Africa.
In the beginning, I thought I was on a really basic journey - that my inspiration was a love for cycling coupled with a desire to support and fundraise for an NGO that empowers women and communities in Uganda. However, once I began riding in Africa, I very quickly realized that I was being driven by a passion much deeper than that. Very soon into my journey I realized that it was about being a woman - an empowered and independant woman - pushing limits, overcoming obstacles and challenging stereotypes while riding my bicycle.
When I reached Egypt, just after I had given my bike away, I had a dream. I woke up the next morning and knew, with utmost certainty, that my journey had just begun. I needed to return to Canada and learn absoultely everything I possibly could about bicycles. Then, I would return to Africa to share the things I had learned in order to support women and communities to growing stronger, more efficient, and more empowered by using bicycles.
And so it was:
BEEYOND A BIKE WAS BORN!
Beginning in May 2013, I will ride my bicycle from Vancouver, Canada to Phoenix, Arizona, carrying all of the tools I need for basic bike maintenance and repair - henceforth dubbed: The Beeyond a Bike Mobile Shop. Along the route I will visit community bike shops, schools and other facilities and offer bicycle presentations and workshops to **vulnerable demographic groups. These include women, queer, youth and low-income communities and more about vulnerable demographic is explained below.
Workshops are free or by donation, and the funds I raise as I travel throgh North America will purchase tools for a high school bicycle program in South Africa***. More information about this group is also below! After approximately 3 months of cycling in the US, I will fly to Cape Town, South Africa and then take 6-12 months to bike to Nairobi, Kenya. Through Africa, I will volunteer my skills and knowledge of bike mechanics with already-operating bicycle organizations and run several independant Beeyond a Bike workshops in other communities along the way. Places I will visit and teach include Fisantekraal High School in South Africa, Zambikes in Zambia and women in the community of Arusha, Tanzania.
In order to make this all possible, I need your help! Please donate today - $1, $5, $20 ... everything helps - so that I can establish the Beeyond a Bike Mobile Shop and be capable of sharing my skills and knowledge as I travel across the US and Africa. I thank you in advance for your kindness and generosity.
Beeyond A Bike is about more than just pushing pedals; It's about empowering people. It's about more than changing gears; It's about changing the world: One community at a time.
**'Vulnerable demograpics' describes categories of people who:
1) Are under-represented in the bicycle community;2) Have or feel like they have limited to no access to bicycles and/or knowledge surrounding bicycle mechanics, and/or;3) Have the potential to greatly impact their communities and improve their quality of life when able to access a bicycle and resources/education related to bicycles.
*** Fisantekraal is the name of a township approximately 40 km from Cape Town, South Africa. Peace and Love International, in partnership with Fisanekraal High School, is preparing to launch a bicycle education program in the school in the coming year. The group has recently received 15 donated bicycles and is in the process of developing a program that provides education to their students in bicycle mechanics and repair. Beeyond a Bike hopes to generate at least $1000 in donations in order to purchase the tools they require as well as other costs of programming that will arise.

story:
Hi, my name is Eric Patrick Thomas. I am a business owner, public speaker, volunteer and advocate. I come from Flint, Michigan. Recently I started a company called EZ Awareness By Design. The company specializes in total custom apparel, signage, and graphic design. Additionally, we have a line of designer clothing with an emphasis on awareness for people with barriers. 

I have a particular interest in advocating for people with disabilities because I am also a spinal cord injury survivor. In 1997 I was shot in the third vertebra resulting in paralysis from the neck down. I started speaking to people and advocating in rehab and have since then spoken all over the United States. 

My next speaking event will be at the Abilities Expo in Chicago on June 28th, which brings  me to why I am campaigning. By donating you are helping me cover the cost of my trip for my speaking engagement. 

Instead of me telling you about my campaign I will show you.  This is a summary of what I will be speaking about at the Chicago Abilities Expo. 

2:30pm – 3:30pm
Life After A Serious Injury: Asking the Questions and Finding the Answers
Presented by Eric Patrick Thomas, Owner, EZ Awareness by Design
After suffering a spinal cord injury or other serious injury people experience panic. You look for a book with all the answers but find it just isn't there. I know because I've been there. I once was like you - newly injured from a gunshot wound. That was 15 years ago and I was desperately searching for answers. But I'm not here to tell you just about my life. At this workshop we'll interact to talk about living life after an injury. Learn that you are not alone and discover where you can find support. We will discuss the experiences and emotions that are common for people with new spinal cord and other serious injuries. We'll talk about how to understand your new body and the new you, how it will change your life and the lives of those around you. Please bring your questions for discussion. Attendees will leave this workshop feeling more empowered and educated, with tips and tools for building friendships and learning how to mentor others facing similar situations.

You can also find this on the abilitiesexpo.com website under Chicago workshops. 

$25 donation will get you a See You In Chicago limited edition T-Shirt

$50 donation will get you a See You in Chicago limited edition T-Shirt and See You In Chicago Poster

$100 donation will get you 2 See You in Chicago limited edition T-Shirts and a See You in Chicago Poster.

There is no limit to what you can donate! Every dollar counts and gets me closer to Seeing You in Chicago!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute and I understand, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help. You can help by getting the word out and making some noise about my campaign.
