story:
My Story

In January 2010, I began searching for my father who had abandoned our family. I made many discoveries during that time that compelled me to look at my life with newly awakened eyes. I had healing to do, and I made some difficult changes to bring that healing about.

In May of 2012, I had a vision to help other women heal. That vision included a virtual space where women could connect to bring about the healing I facilitated for myself. That vision is One Woman One Voice Project, a social networking website where women can connect, heal, and thrive in a safe and nurturing environment.

As a writing instructor, I witness how writing opens up students to incredible discoveries when a safe space is created for them.  One Woman One Voice Project is a safe space on the Internet for women to connect, heal and thrive.  We need your generous support to create this space. 

What We Need

$20,000 to support our website:

  Our philosophy is simple:  Connect, Heal, and Thrive

 

  Your support will help us:

  • Erect a social networking website on a supportive platform such as Ning so women can connect on a safe and secure network
  • Provide filters to match women to other women with similar interests and to match mentors and professionals with women who desire support
  • Erect an online educational forum using platforms such as JigsawBox and Canvas to support online learning

Your Impact

Your support will do much more than just add another website onto the already crowded virtual space of the Internet; it will create a comprehensive learning environment rich with resources like:

  • Interviews with thought leaders who share our mission
  • Webinars with professionals sharing their wisdom in the areas of finance, entrepreneurship, child rearing, healthy eating, and much more
  • Our Givers Corner is where the exchange of goods and service can take place among members
  • Writing to Heal prompts
  • Writing Workshops
  • Active Healing Workshops
  • Guided Meditations as Mp3 downloads
  • Leadership Courses and Retreats

Other Ways You Can Help

We are grateful for other types of support.

  • Technical support for our website
  • Join our team of professionals and give informational webinars and filmed talks
  • Talk up our campaign by using Indiegogo's share tools

Thank You !

We are grateful for all of your help and welcome you to the One Women One Voice Project Family.  We have some cool Perks to show our appreciate and profound gratitude.  A giver at any level will have their name on our Angel Founder Gratitude Page and will become an essential part of the foundation of OWOVP.


Founder and Executive Director

Stephanie Payne is a Board Certified Coach dedicated to helping women find their worth by learning to love the self. Stephanie has served on organizational committees and non-profit boards, and holds a Master's Degree in creative writing.  She has studied world religions and spiritual practices and with that knowledge developed a system to guide women toward living a self-empowered, purpose-filled, and abundant life.

story:
Purple Heart Parking is a movement started to help recognize our veterans who were wounded in combat by enemy forces. While we appreciate and support all of the programs dedicated to helping our wounded veterans we here at Purple Heart Parking feel that those men and women who carry the burden of injuries received while participating in direct combat deserve recognition for the extra mile they have had to walk while serving our nation

This movement is currently involved in talks with local governments in hopes that we can establish combat wounded veteran parking. While we one day hope to support these fine men and women with support programs we realize that we must start small and set higher and higher goals as our support and recognition grows.

Founding members of Purple Heart Parking are currently funding advertising through clothing, media outlets , and flyers in our local community with added support and donation we wish to spread this movement far and fast as well as give back to our supporters with free giveaways through our Facebook site.

While your support can be shown easily through liking and sharing our Facebook page we know the opportunity for recognition is multiplied greatly through advertising. Any donations will go directly into spreading the Purple Heart Parking movement as well as given back to our supporters in free giveaways on our page

story:
Members of our restoration crew during their tours of duty

We need your help to complete this project. We have set our goal low so that every contribution is utilized, but we seek to raise round $75,000 to fully fund this initiative.

The Huey became the symbol of U.S. combat forces in Vietnam. In country, more than 12,000 helicopters served alongside our troops. The 7,000 Hueys that served flew 9,713,762 hours. At home, millions watched them fly on nightly news reports. The Huey is an iconic image of the Vietnam Era and a fitting display at the Vietnam Era Museum & Educational Center.

This project has brought generations together, deepening the bonds of veteran brotherhood as well as family connections.

Vietnam Veteran helicopter Pilot Carl Burns and grandson Dylan share the Huey experience

In February 2013, a group of veteran volunteers, many of them Vietnam Era helicopter pilots and maintenance technicians, began the restoration of a 1964 Bell UH-1D Huey helicopter. Every Vietnam Veteran has Huey memories to share.Your support will ensure that the contributions of the Huey and the men and women who flew in them will never be forgotten.

The restoration of this Huey has again brought Vietnam Veterans together. The recognition they are receiving for their work on this project, in a small way, properly welcomes them home and thanks them for their service. 

Our goal is to unveil a restored Huey and museum experience in May 2014, our Huey’s 50th birthday. Here it will be a fitting tribute to all who have served our country as well as a unique and historically important teaching tool for the thousands of students and visitors who experience the Memorial and Museum each year. 

Our Huey Story

Our Huey's Arrival

A Work in Progress

In January 2013, the NJVVMF took possession of a 1964 Bell UH-1D, Iroquois helicopter, also known as the Huey. During the Vietnam Era, Bell Helicopter (A Textron Company) produced 16,000 Hueys, 7,000 of these served in Vietnam.

Our Huey, serial # 64-13732, served two tours in Vietnam.  From October 1966 through September 1967, it served with the 116th Assault Helicopter Company, “The Hornets,” at Cu Chi in support of the 25th Infantry Division. It then served with the 118th Assault helicopter Company, “The Thunderbirds,” from November 1968 through February 1970 at Bien Hoa. During its service in Vietnam, our Huey logged more than 3,000 flight hours, saving countless lives and providing daily support for our troops.

After spending more than two decades outside at the Joint Base McGuire-Dix-Lakehurst, the Huey is currently under restoration by a crew of veterans. Throughout the spring of 2013, the crew has been hard at work preparing this Huey for display out front of the Vietnam Era Museum & Educational Center.  Our restoration crew has logged more than 1,500 hours so far.

See a slideshow of our progress here

A Labor of Love: Meet our Restoration Crew

The original tail cone panel signed by the crew, will be reinstalled on the completed Huey

This project is a labor of love. Our crew of veterans couldn’t be more qualified. Their dedication and passion reflect the significance of this project. Many flew and maintained Hueys during their tours of duty. Every crew member has a Huey story to share.

There is a common bond among veterans, especially Vietnam veterans. This project has once again brought them together, working towards an important goal, the restoration of a Huey that served in Vietnam.  They understand that their work will preserve their legacies and leave a lasting impression on all who experience our Huey.

Follow Our Blog for Project Updates

The Plan

Our goal is to unveil a restored Huey and museum experience in May 2014, our Huey’s 50th birthday. Here it will be a fitting tribute to all who have served our country as well as a unique and historically important teaching tool for the thousands of students and visitors who experience the Memorial and Museum each year.

Final Landing at the Vietnam Era Museum & Educational Center

Thanks to the generosity of our crew, members of our local military community and friends of the Foundation we have accomplished a great deal. However, there is still a lot of work to be done. After restoration work is complete, the Huey needs to be relocated to the Foundation’s grounds and installed as a permanent display.

This project is unique in that our Huey is being restored by a crew of veterans for display at the only museum in the country dedicated to gaining an understanding of the Vietnam Era, the War in Southeast Asia and its lasting impact on American culture. 

We have already accomplished a great deal:

  • A complete inventory of the Huey and an assessment of project goals, needs and challenges
  • Acquisition of replacement parts from other Vietnam Era Hueys
  • A complete cleaning of the Huey
  • Draining of all fluids
  • Stripping of exterior and interior parts in preparation for painting
  • Sanding of the entire Huey in preparation for painting
  • The construction of a painting enclosure and the donation of paint
  • The Huey Plaza has been designed and engineering documents created

Your support will enable us to:

  • Construct the Huey’s plaza and display foundation outside of the Vietnam Era Museum & Educational Center in fall of 2013
  • Relocate the Huey to the Museum grounds and install it as a permanent display
  • Create an interactive museum experience and field trip activities that will complement our displayed Huey

About the New Jersey Vietnam Veterans' Memorial Foundation

The Foundation operates the New Jersey Vietnam Veterans’ Memorial (http://www.njvvmf.org/information.html)and the Vietnam Era Museum & Educational Center, the only Museum of its kind in the country (http://www.njvvmf.org/overview.html). We are a self-sustaining non-profit dedicated to offering a meaningful and engaging experience that recognizes the sacrifices, courage and valor of Vietnam Veterans and that encourages and fosters a thorough understanding of the Vietnam Era including the political, historical, social, cultural and military aspects which affected the United States, and especially New Jersey. 

Project Rewards

Project T-Shirt

Vietnam Era Flight Survival Vest, Signed by the Restoration Crew

Paperweight made from our Huey's Original Planetary Gears

 Flight Pump Panel from our Huey

Push Pull Tube from our Huey

Project Risks and Challenges

There are very few risks involved with this project. Thanks to the generosity of our Restoration Crew, members of our local military community and friends of the Foundation, we have already accomplished a great deal. Our Restoration team is already hard at work independent of our fundraising campaign.

The challenge we face is raising the funds to construct the display foundation and plaza by the end of 2013. We are also relying on your support to raise funds to develop and install an interactive museum experience so that all visitors can experience the inside of a Huey.

We already have commitments from the people and organizations needed to complete these parts of the project, so once funds are raised, we can continue to move ahead. Please support our unique and important project!

Ways You Can Help

Please Make a Contribution Today! 

Share this project link with everyone you know- spread the word about this campaign on Facebook,Twitter and other social media. Ask them to tell everybody they know! POST our Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and even your own website. Send out an email, call your family, friends and colleagues!

Slip a note under your boss's door - maybe the company you work for would like to sponsor us as a charitable tax write-off? Ask friends to donate!

Share this project link with everyone you know- spread the word about this campaign on Facebook,Twitter and other social media. Ask them to tell everybody they know! POST our Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and even your own website. Send out an email, call your family, friends and colleagues!
Slip a note under your boss's door - maybe the company you work for would like to sponsor us as a charitable tax write-off? Ask friends to donate!

story:
Here's the story:
Over 25 years ago, two married couples began health careers in their local communities. Equally passionate about healing, each couple experienced a variety of environments and partnerships in their search for the highest quality care for their clientele. Fast forward to 2013. After a series of unusual events, the couples met and found a resonance between them. The idea of creating an integrative health center together was born. They came together with the common purpose of providing whole person health care that empowers the individual to achieve optimal health. Plans were put in place to form a partnership and the perfect name was chosen: Health Etc. - Health Care for the Whole Person.

Here's the situation now:

We are currently moving into a new building in order to house our practices in one convenient, attractive location for Winters residents and the surrounding communities. Dr. Davis's previous location (which was very old and rundown) provided much of the furnishings that are used in a medical office. As a result, we find ourselves needing to pay out-of-pocket for furniture and equipment at the new place/address/space.

We also have numerous expenses related togetting this new business venture off the ground, including IT support, staff salaries (receptionist, physician's assistant, bookkeeper, office manager) and marketing costs (website design, networking, display materials, etc.) The list continues to grow yet our budget remains limited.

Ultimately, we want to create a center that promotes health and wellness -- an office environment that is comfortable and welcoming –– and we’d like to avoid breaking the bank to do it. Think simple vs. swanky . . . calm vs. chaotic.


Who We Are:

William B. Davis MD is a nationally recognized family physician who has practiced medicine in Winters, California for more than 25 years. Dr. Davis is known for the individualized, thorough care he gives the patients with whom he works. He stresses the importance of keeping patients out of the Emergency Room and hospital by working in partnership with patients to improve and maintain health. He is known for being accessible to his patients when they need him. Dr. Davis is well-loved by the local community.

Wendy Walker Davis Ph.D. is a licensed clinical psychologist who has worked in human services for the past 35 years. She holds a Bachelor’s Degree in Psychology, a Masters Degree in Public Administration, a Masters Degree in Psychology and a Ph.D. in Clinical Psychology. Wendy’s emphasis is a “whole person”, mind-body-heart approach that actually results in working with people in a down-to-earth and practical manner. It starts with listening, and appreciating the unique person who is sitting with her and quickly progresses to actively searching with the patient and provider for something that will help today.

Ofer Erez, Movement Specialist believes that anyone, regardless of age can become more fit and healthy if they learn to replace effort with skill and take the time to learn those skills. For more than 25 years, Ofer has taught his students how to gain strength and balance and increase flexibility and mobility without resorting to pain and discomfort.He has developed SugiTouch, Sugi Yoga and Sugi Fitness Training Programs. Ofer is also a certified massage therapist, Reiki Master and Feldenkrais® practitioner. Co-owner of Sugi Health and Fitness in Pleasant Hill, CA.

Amy Erez B.A., Reiki Master has been providing health care and wellness education since 1984. Her B.A. is in Psychology/Oriental Studies. She holds certification in Acupressure, Flower Essence Therapy, SugiTouch and Sugi Yoga. She has been teaching Tai Chi Gong for over 20 years. Sessions with Amy are a combination of hands-on healing, self-awareness counseling, and recommendations for creating a healthy lifestyle. She has worked extensively with people coping with a large variety of health issues, beginning at an outpatient mental health clinic in 1980. Co-owner of Sugi Health and Fitness in Pleasant Hill, CA.

Our plan is to include other health professionals (think chiropractor, acupuncturist, homeopath, herbalist...) as soon as possible.

Here's what we need:

$15,000 for -

  • $5,000 for cabinetry to make a lab room for the Dr.
  • $5,000 medical machinery
  • $1,000 - $1,500 for a reception desk
  • $1,000 for lockable filing cabinets
  • $1,000 for startup promotions and materials
  • $500 for cabinets and shelves in treatment rooms
  • $400 - $500 for website design and hosting
  • $400 for area rugs for some of the treatment rooms and reception area
  • $300 for storage units 
  • $300 for signage
  • $300 draperies for privacy in the rooms
  • $200 for literature display and magazine racks
  • $180 for FBN and business licenses
  • $150 for a mini-frig for our break room

This doesn't include staff salaries, rent and deposit, phone, legal fees or IT expenses.

All money that we receive will be used to pay for as many of the expenses listed above as possible.

Gratitude List
We would like to thank you for helping us by adding your name to the Gratitude List on our website. If you prefer not to be named, please let us know.

We are exceptionally grateful for any support that you can give. Sometimes, just getting the word out is the best possible gift. So, please spread the word. Thank you!

story:
Want to see Barbecue in Otsego?

My name is Rob Turner, and I've got big plans for bringing barbecue to the North West suburbs of Minneapolis, Minnesota:

  1. I want to rebrand an existing small barbecue restaurant currently name Scott Ja-Mama’s to JaMama’s Barbecue To Go.
  2. Then I'll Move JaMama’s Barbecue from South Minneapolis to one of these four Minnesota cities - Big Lake, Elk River, Monticello, and Otsego – upgrading the equipment in the process.
  3. Start a chain of these restaurants in the cities listed above.

Do I need your help? Absolutely!

I have started four campaigns, one for each city that I have identified as good starting choices to move JaMama’s Barbecue into.  If you want to see JaMama’s start up a restaurant in Otsego, please offer your support through donations and the purchase of gift cards. 

The city with the most funds by the end of the campaign will be the city where JaMama’s will set up shop first.  Every three months after the first shop is established, I will add another JaMama’s Barbecue by order of the city that has their campaign funded the most - first, until each of the four cities has its own barbecue restaurant.

Did I mention Scott?

Scott Woosley (a.k.a. Scott Ja-Mama) is the owner of Scott Ja-Mama’s and my partner in the drive to move Barbecue to the suburbs.   He’s been in business for 19 years and has lots of experience making delicious barbecue dishes like Roasted Chicken, Ribs, and Pulled Pork.  In fact, here’s his menu –

MENU

  • Full Rack* - $18.00
  • Half Rack* - $11.25
  • Quarter Rack* - $6.50
  • Half Chicken* - $9.25
  • Combo (Half Rack & Quarter Chicken)* - $15.00

*The above come with a Twice-Baked Potato or fries, Slaw, and a dinner role.

  • Pork Sandwich** - $5.45
  • Steak Sandwich** - $6.50
  • Grilled Chicken Sandwich** - $6.50

**Comes with Chips or Fries and a Slaw

  • Extra Potato - $1.25
  • Extra Slaw - $.80
  • Extra Dinner Role - $.25
  • Beans (When Available) - $1.00
  • Fries - $1.25
  • Fountain Drink - $1.25
I'd like to point out that Scott currently doesn't have fries or fountain drinks (soda) on his menu, they are things that he has been thinking about adding, and will be added after the move.

Where does the money go?

Each store will cost about $80,000 to install.  The breakdown of expenses roughly looks like this -

  • Lease the property - $1,000 - $4,000
  • Modify property for restaurant - $30,000
  • Equipment (Grills, Smoker, Cash Register etc.) - $30,000
  • Outside signs - $2,000
  • Supplies - $1,000
  • Insurance - $1,000
  • Legal and accounting - $1,000
  • Opening Advertisement - $2,000
  • Misc. Expenses - $5,000
  • Pay Indiegogo $5,000 - 10,000 (Hey, crowd funding is a great idea and the architects deserve financial recognition)

Will there be more expenses like initial labor costs, or equipment transportation costs?  Absolutely, but we have the capacity to absorb them.

The big question...

So what if, despite this amazing campaign, revolutionary really, we don't raise the capitol to move Scott?  Well, I actually think this move is going to happen; it's just a matter of where first.  If for some reason we don't raise the funds, we can turn to several potential investors... but they're not you, the people who want to see this happen, the people who care.

BUT if a decision has to be made to not build a restaurant in any of the cities by 18 months after the close of the campaign, we will refund the money to the donors of that city minus the expenses from Indiegogo. 

On the flip side, what if this campaign is fully funded – and beyond? We will move to open in all four locations as quickly as possible.  More details when it happens.

Links to other campaigns

Click on the links below to visit the other campaigns:

Click here to go to the Big Lake Campaign

Click here to go to the Elk River Campaign

Click here to go to the Monticello Campaign


Talk to me!

Suggestions, advice, or maybe we need to move JaMama's Barbecue to your city(?)  I'd love to hear from you.  You can reach me at rob@jamamas.net.

story:
Hello!

Beer for Life at Black Sands

Black Sands is a brewery, bar, and home brew supply store opening in San Francisco in Summer 2014.  

We're running a campaign to garner support for our new Lower Haight Brewery and to give out the deal of the life time: Free Beer for Life! - Literally free pints for the rest of your life at our brewery!

For Beer Lovers by Beer Lovers

Black Sands is a place for beer lovers and beer makers. We use the supplies we sell in our store to brew the beer we serve at the bar. We also offer a selection of local beers, wines, and meads, as well as California-inspired dishes and freshly brewed Front Coffee for the morning commute.

For those venturing into the world of homebrewing, we’re here to help. Our goal is to provide brewers of all experience levels with an easy, open environment where they can find the ingredients, equipment, and knowledge they need to brew great beer. 

Our head brewer, Cole, has more than a decade of experience in professional and homebrewing setups. He's passionate about making small scale crafted beverages for a wide palette. A brewery is also about community, and we're proud to be part of the Bay Area brewing community and the Lower Haight Neighborhood. We're the same team behind the popular restaurant Ken Ken Ramen, and retail stores Revolver and Voyager in San Francisco and we're working with the community on this project!

We’re planning to open our doors in Summer 2014, and as part of our crowd funding effort, we’re offering you the deal of a lifetime—literally. 

The Black Sands Beer for Life program rewards anyone who invests $100 or more with one free pint of beer at Black Sands every month for life. That simple. 

Choose between Lagers, Ales, IPAs, Porters, Stouts and other types of beer all made on site. You can check into our location (701 Haight St.) via a mobile application that allows you to redeem your monthly pint. All funds raised in this effort will go directly into our operation, into new equipment and new build outs for our project. 

Thanks for your support. Come see us this summer. Beer’s on us!

How it will work!

Black Sands supporters will be able to redeem their free monthly beer with our mobile application. If the campaign closes successfully we'll send you a download code and link. You'll login and come to Black Sands and redeem your beer in person at our location! That simple! No tricks, no gimmicks. You can choose from one of our many beers including IPAs, Stouts, Porters, and more. There will also be reminders and little specials for early supporters through the app. 

Why IndieGoGo?

Our beers are available in small batches at Black Sands Brewery and Bar. We are located at 701 Haight Street, San Francisco and will be open in Summer 2014.  We want to offer an opportunity to enable people to support local small scale manufacturing in the United States but at more accessible price points. Quality is expensive but if we can garner your support for upfront production and equipment costs, it will enable us to meet and batch production to lower pricing.  Everyone wins! We also hope you'll stay around and support us by having dinner and more!

Risks and Challenges?

San Francisco is one of the greatest cities in the world to conduct business in and be part of-- however, building codes, permits, and the inspection process can be a bit of a Byzantine labyrinth. 

Luckily we have an amazing team with experienced architects, permit expediators, furniture builders and brewers all working together. We're working with the best in opening this bar.

Luckily we also have experience from our other restaurants and retail stores and have used that experience in this project.

This project has been designed within the guidelines and regulations of the City and the County of San Francisco. We are fully confident in our team of professionals to navigate through all necessary measures.

Current Status: Construction - Test Brewing!

We've about half way through to build out. Our brewers permits and constructions permits are literally about to be issued. Our beer equipment is here and is being test batched. Furniture and construction is on going. Our new glass windows and exterior are going to be installed shortly and our kitchen equipment is here sitting in our warehouse ready to be installed following sound proofing and dry wall repair. We're already test brewing on equipment and have been giving out samples and brew lessons at BlackSandsbeer.com. We're exited about where we are and will be posting updates of progress here and on our social media accounts! 

As for the mobile app: we have a prototype running and are testing out the final bugs! Everything is set for a summer 2014 launch! 

Questions?

Learn more about our operation, see pictures and updates at BlackSandsbeer.com

On Twitter @BlackSandsBeer

To stay up-to-date with our campaign, please follow us! 

Please also tell all your friends and have them tell all their friends! And if you are press or have a blog feel free to link to this page or use anything from our site! You can also call us with questions or email us!

FAQ

- Why only 1 perk?

We think the Beer for Life program is an awesome deal! With most beers selling for 5 to 8 dollars, this is literally the deal of a lifetime! No one needs more t-shirts, and stickers will be free on site!

- What is your capacity like?

We have an American Made 9 Barrel Brew Capacity System. This enables us to ferment 9 barrels of beer at a time. We'll usually have 3 to 4 beers of our creation on tap plus more in bottles. We have our wholesale accounts for quick delivery of our grains, yeast and hops, and many are local! If things get busy we can run our brew system up to 3 times a week and keg. We also have plenty of brewing supplies and ingredients for sale in our retail shop for you to brew your own beer!

- Does the Beer For Life program expire?

Nope. If you are a supporter - its forever. Unless we close as a business. We're going to support you and you'll be able to redeem beers on location forever.

- Do beers need to be consumed on site?

Yes, pints will be served on site and must be consumed on site - this is the law in California.

- You guys will have a full bar right? Can I upgrade to other types of drinks?

The beer for life program only supports beer made by Black Sands. While we will serve other beers and spirits you cannot use the program for anything but our house made beer! 

- What about Food?

We invite you to enjoy our restaurant with local food options made with fresh ingredients. Small pub food.

- Do we brew any non-alcoholic Beers?

Currently all our beers have alcohol. If this changes we'll invite you to participate in our non alcoholic beers too!

- What about Tips?

Tips are not included in the beer for life program. We invite you to support bar tenders and waiters with the customary American tip for drinks. Usually a $1 or $2 per beer is more than enough.  The tip goes directly to the bar tender and not to Black Sands.

- Can I share my Beer For Life Program with Friends?

We love that you want to bring friends to Black Sands, but supporters can only claim the free monthly pint for themselves. Supporter logins are tied to their individual name but please do invite your friends to also participate! 

- I missed a month? Do I get to drink 2 beers the next?

Our beer program does not bank. You'll have plenty of time to drink our beers and the application will send you reminders when your free beer is available.

- Do I have to live in San Francisco to enjoy this program? 

Nope - we invite supporters from around the world. Try our beers during visits or know that your support is enabling high quality beers to be enjoyed by many!

- What about the iPhone App? Is Android and Windows Phone supported too? 

Yes - we support all major mobile platforms. There is a native iOS client for iPhones and mobile web version for non iOS supporters. Depending on demand we will port the app to other platforms.

- What other entitlements does the program entail?

We love our supporters - Black Sands Beer for Life members will also be invited to special events, early tastings, classes, discount programs and other rewards! 

Drink Responsibly!

See Black Sands Terms and Conditions @ http://www.blacksandsbeer.com/terms

More information @ http://www.blacksandsbeer.com

With most beers selling for 5 to 8 dollars, this is literally the deal of a lifetime! No one needs more t-shirts, and stickers will be free on site!- What is your capacity like?We have an American Made 9 Barrel Brew Capacity System. This enables us to ferment 9 barrels of beer at a time. We'll usually have 3 to 4 beers of our creation on tap plus more in bottles. We have our wholesale accounts for quick delivery of our grains, yeast and hops, and many are local! If things get busy we can run our brew system up to 3 times a week and keg. We also have plenty of brewing supplies and ingredients for sale in our retail shop for you to brew your own beer!- Does the Beer For Life program expire?Nope. If you are a supporter - its forever. Unless we close as a business. We're going to support you and you'll be able to redeem beers on location forever.- Do beers need to be consumed on site?Yes, pints will be served on site and must be consumed on site - this is the law in California.- You guys will have a full bar right? Can I upgrade to other types of drinks?The beer for life program only supports beer made by Black Sands. While we will serve other beers and spirits you cannot use the program for anything but our house made beer! - What about Food?We invite you to enjoy our restaurant with local food options made with fresh ingredients. Small pub food.- Do we brew any non-alcoholic Beers?Currently all our beers have alcohol. If this changes we'll invite you to participate in our non alcoholic beers too!- What about Tips?Tips are not included in the beer for life program. We invite you to support bar tenders and waiters with the customary American tip for drinks. Usually a $1 or $2 per beer is more than enough.  The tip goes directly to the bar tender and not to Black Sands.- Can I share my Beer For Life Program with Friends?We love that you want to bring friends to Black Sands, but supporters can only claim the free monthly pint for themselves. Supporter logins are tied to their individual name but please do invite your friends to also participate! - I missed a month? Do I get to drink 2 beers the next?Our beer program does not bank. You'll have plenty of time to drink our beers and the application will send you reminders when your free beer is available.- Do I have to live in San Francisco to enjoy this program? Nope - we invite supporters from around the world. Try our beers during visits or know that your support is enabling high quality beers to be enjoyed by many!- What about the iPhone App? Is Android and Windows Phone supported too? Yes - we support all major mobile platforms. There is a native iOS client for iPhones and mobile web version for non iOS supporters. Depending on demand we will port the app to other platforms.- What other entitlements does the program entail?We love our supporters - Black Sands Beer for Life members will also be invited to special events, early tastings, classes, discount programs and other rewards! Drink Responsibly!See Black Sands Terms and Conditions @ http://www.blacksandsbeer.com/termsMore information @ http://www.blacksandsbeer.com

story: Hi, my name is Julianne and I am trying to help my family. My brother passed away suddenly and unexpectedly on July 24, 2010. He was 33 years old. He was in the process of divorcing his wife, had started to file the paperwork. His wife is unfit to raise their children, but once he passed away the kids went with her. Their home life with their mother has been horrible and they absolutely cannot go back to live with her. They've been living with my mother, their grandmother, for the past year. The mother has not tried to see them even once in that period of time, has spoken to them about 4 times.  My mother is living on a small income and can barely afford to take care of the children, she doesn't have the money to take my sister in law to court. My mom has sought counsel from a lawyer who has reduced his fee to help her. It will cost $1,200 total to pay the lawyer and court costs. By getting those much needed funds and filing for temporary custody you will enable us to keep the kids in a safe environment, in a school they love, around family and friends who care for them. They were living in a scary trailer park with no food for days because their mother doesn't work. The place had bugs and a transient even came in through the window one night! She was receiving my brother's death benefits through social security to take care of the children and was spending the money on cigarettes and drugs. My sister in law refuses to work and is now homeless last we heard. She also had taken the kids out of school and they had no interaction with others for 8 months. Please help keep my niece and nephew with us. Thank you.

story:
You’ve seen our mobile gourmet coffee truck, Mojo Express, around town now we need your contributions to turn it into a cafe in Maywood!

My name is Renee Long and I’m here on Indiegogo to move Mojo Express into a permanent spot and grow our product line to keep bringing you the highest quality coffee and baked goods in Maywood, IL.

I don’t know if you’re aware but Maywood is undergoing  major redevelopment.  At this time, there  are no cafés or  other high end coffee shops in Maywood.  I’m trying to bring a cafe where business owners or groups etc.. can come have meetings and enjoy a variety of unique blends of coffee.  Where patrons can come get work done through the free WiFi or watch TV while waiting for their car either being repaired or wash in nearby shops.  And lastly, where kids can come and hang out for a while.   

Also, opening this café will give employment opportunities in the community not only in the café but for the mobile vehicle as well.  I’ve spoken with officials at Village Hall along with the Chief of Police, postal workers and a host of other officials who are excited.


But we can't make it happen without your contributions!

 

Why Mojo Express?

 

We’re coffee with a conscience. 

 

If you care about strengthening local communities, you’re in the right spot.

If you love coffee, you’re in the right spot. 

If you care about environmental sustainability, you’re in the right spot.

I’ve been serving up coffee for the past few years.  Customers love it. 



Now I’m here to grow, we will be serving  delicious homemade pies along with our best coffee and other baked goods which will hit the spot. 

We’re also adding gourmet pancakes by Baby Cakes.

 (yes, they're as delicious and fluffy as they look)

If you’re in the Oak Park and Maywood area, you might have seen us driving around.  Our gourmet coffee truck delivers delicious organic and fair trade coffees to tons of happy customers.   Now, we’re looking to grow into a comfortable space for all to enjoy, so why don’t you join us by being a part of this fantastic addition to Maywood, IL!

 

That’s not all.  Mojo Express will be a café you can feel good about.

Feel Good About Our Products:

We source our coffee from Crop to Cup, and serve only the best fair-trade coffee from Buginyanya, Uganda.   Our coffee comes from small farms and small-scale processors grown by family farms near the Kenya-Uganda border.

 

That means your money doesn’t go to corporate profits and shareholders.  It goes to helping local business in your neighborhood and small farmers across the world.  Clearly, a win/win.

 

Feel Good About Our Staff:

 

Mojo Express is about more than just tasty coffee and treats.  It’s about making our community stronger. 


In 2006, I was diagnosed with Lupus, a long-term auto-immune disease.  Naturally, I freaked out.  So I started looking for support groups.  I found that the westside of Chicago did not have any support groups.  So I took matters into my own hands, did my own research with the help of my doctor. With the Lupus Foundation, I became a support group leader on the westside.

Through my work with the Lupus community, I learned that many people with Lupus have a hard time keeping jobs because of Lupus flare-ups and constant doctor’s visits. 

I want to give back to this community that has given me so much support by hiring those battling Lupus. 

 

Our Goals:

$35,000 will make sure the awesome space has all the equipment it needs to succeed.  Coffee makers and grinders to brew you the best.  Espresso machines so we can share our tasty java creations.  A juicer to make sure you’re looking and feeling fresh.



 

What’s In It for You?

On top of getting an awesome café in your neighborhood, there are some other perks:

Since we’re already a fully functioning gourmet coffee truck, you don’t have to wait to get the benefits.  You can start getting most of the perks right away.

$5 gets you a heart-felt thank you and one cup of coffee.

$10 gets you a heart-felt thank you and one cup of coffee for you and a pal.

$25 gets you 10 cups of delicious coffee.

$50 gets you 20 cups of coffee.

$100 gets you 30 drinks of your choosing from our menu.

$150 gets you a Limited Edition Mojo Express Travel Mug with unlimited free refills at any Mojo Express location (trucks or permanent location) through 2015.  That means if you go just 4 times per week you're getting your coffee for less than $1 per cup! That's over $400 in savings this year!   Even more savings if you get more refills!

And here's a preview of that Limited Edition Mojo Express Travel Mug:

$350 gets you a Limited Edition Mojo Express Travel Mug with unlimited free refills at any Mojo Express location (trucks or permanent location) through 2016. That means even if you go just 4 times per week you're getting your coffee for less than $1 per cup! Nearly $1000 in savings by the end of 2016!

$450 gets you a Limited Edition Mojo Express Travel Mug with unlimited free refills through 2016 at any Mojo Express location (trucks or permanent location) AND 1  Pie of your choice per month. On top of awesome savings on coffee (see above), you're also getting a great deal on pies.  That's an extra $50 of savings!  Think of the thinks you could do with the extra $1050 you saved!

$500 gets you a catered party for you and 10 of your friends!  You’ll get a sampling of coffee drinks and delicious baked treats.

$1,000 Catered party for up to 50 people. 

$5,000 We'll deliver coffee for you and your office/work/home daily for a year! Up to 15 people. Valid only in the Chicago Metro Area.

 

BONUS: If we reach our ultimate goal of $45,000, all supporters will be invited to our exclusive grand opening!

 

Sometimes you just need a cup of coffee, and I want to make sure you get the best one out there.  Sometimes you need a treat.  Mojo Express is the place to get both. 

 

Mojo Express the cafe is good for you, your neighbor (near and far) and honestly just tastes so darn good.  We can't do it without you. Let's make it happen!

 

Don’t lose your mojo! Give a few bucks to get some great coffee then share this Indiegogo campaign with a friend!

 

Thanks!

story:
A little bit about us

CampusBookStar.com launched in the summer of 2012 and is already on track to being the #1 resource for everything college. Our textbook classifieds allow students to buy and sell their college textbooks to/from each other in order to save money as buyers, and get more as sellers - a perfect circle and a complete win-win for both parties.

But why stop there though? Soon after launching our textbook classifieds we realized there was so much more we could do! That's when we decided to launch a whole new addition to the website -- a full blown "general classifieds" that allows students to find housing (on or off campus), dorm/apartment furniture and furnishings, carpools, scholarships, even jobs and internships (pre and post graduation), and SO much more!

The website started as a school project idea, but once the idea was presented we immediately knew that this could be turned into something MUCH bigger! 

We decided to make the website FREE of charge in order to make it a greater benefit to its users... college students who already are strapped for cash. As college students ourselves, coming up with the original money to create the website was tough. We scraped our own savings accounts and had the site created... what an adventure it's been so far! 

  

Why do we need help and what can you do

Well, we are college students trying to build a website that will save millions of college students time and money, help them find jobs and scholarships that can change their lives forever, etc. With that comes a price, and unfortunately we can't do it by ourselves anymore! We hate to have it come down to this, but we need help! 

Where the funding will be going:

  • Recuperating loss from the original and add-on addition to the website
  • Web hosting fees (you can't imagine the cost of maintaining a website as large as ours)
  • New servers to help keep the website quick and nimble!
  • Advertising, marketing, and promotional efforts that have been lacking due to current insufficient funds
  • Add an "eTextbook" purchasing section on the website (for students who prefer digital copies of books)
  • A scholarship of our own that will be awarded to exceptional students who go above and beyond their academic responsibilities

To be honest, our current goal of just $40,000 would put us just about financially even. We chose this number because it's honestly what's needed to really get this website off and running. Any more than our goal would allow us to rent an actual office (instead of working out of bedrooms), expand the brand to overseas (so that all students around the world could use our site), and maybe just maybe finally pay off some of our employees :) 

 

Perks?

You betcha! Take a look at the right hand side of the screen for a list of all of our perks (they are REALLLLLLY cool!!!!). More importantly though, this campaign is about the students who our website helps. Therefore, keep in mind that as you are selecting a perk, that the absoulte most import thing you are gaining from your donation is knowing that you are truly helping college students by helping our cause!

------

We took a huge risk using money out of our pockets to create this site, but we know how great of a resource it already is and can continue to be as it grows. We just need a little bit of help from everyone here!

Your donation helps the users of our website save money on textbooks, find housing, get jobs & internships, find scholarships and SOOOO much more.

We sincerely thank you for your donation and we're sure the other 18.2 million college students who can use our site do as well! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can't financially contribute to our cause, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • We'd really appreciate it if you could let your friends and family know about us. The more people/students who know about and use CampusBookStar.com, the better the chance we all have at being successful! 
  • "Like" us on Facebook - www.facebook.com/CampusBookStar and follow us on twitter - @CampusBookStar -- We would really appreciate it. Tell everyone you know to do so as well! 

--------

In all seriousness though, we want our website to become successful simply so that we can touch the lives and help millions of college students every year... But we can't do so without a little help from you first.

Thank you so very much for looking and for donating - it truly means the world to us!

story:
Short Summary

Missy Kennett took a leap of faith in opening Cafe M after running an order-based treat business, Treats By Missy, for almost a year with much success.  In March 2013, in order to accommodate her growing business, she opened the doors to a quaint Cafe in the heart of Norfolk.  Here she showcases her pastries and passion through breakfast, lunch, and outside orders. 

Putting 80+ hours a week in, often times working solo on 15-18 hour shifts, Missy needs YOUR help to keep the momentum going and provide a better experience for those who support her, and her growing customer base.

What We Need & What You Get

Deciding to be modest in the amount being asked, Missy is looking to provide the basics to better her Cafe.
 
You've asked for it - help us get it! 
Espresso Machine (one that doesn't leak and break daily) $2000
(We are opting for a smaller, less-expensive model that will do the job - but hoping to get a super deluxe edition that does everything!)  Fall is coming - and you need your lattes!
 
Furniture/misc. kitchen items - $3500
If you're tired of looking at our faded black table cloths and sitting on hard wood chairs, help us grab a few comfy chairs and even some pans to do the baked vegan/healthy donuts you've been asking us for!  We also want to give you a better pastry view - help us grab up a new pastry case to accommodate more delights!
 
 
Working Capital - $2000
Yes this sounds low, but Missy put every penny she had into being able to get the shop up and running and now she needs help running it!  She's currently in talks with a local culinary institute to give paid training/experience to an eager-to-learn student, so that she can fill that pastry case with all of the delights she can't do while making eggs (and bacon, and sandwiches, and coffee, and...well...you get the point.)
 

The Impact

Many of you may be unaware but our Cafe is located smack dab in the middle of an awesome non-profit organization building.  Eggleston Services provides training, support, education and employment opportunities to persons with disabilities.  Eggleston is helping to change the lifestyle of those who may not have opportunities otherwise, by encouraging them to be independent as much as possible, and give them satisfaction of being able to grow as individuals financially and socially.  Our monthly rent goes directly to this organization and we interact with these individuals on a daily basis by providing them with low-cost snacks and beverages that they enjoy.  We pride ourselves in offering these individuals products that we do not profit off of, and also offering a discount to the hard-working staff that keep these individuals educated and happy on a daily basis.
 
 
We are also very eager to be able to hire a determined, excited culinary student - and hope to become a good partner for the institute.  Starting a small business is hard - especially when you wear all the hats.  We want to share this experience and help train the future chefs/small business owners of the world!  
 
Cafe M is proud to support local vendors - whether it be bottled Kombuchick teas, or produce from farms in VA - and we want to help their businesses thrive along with ours.  Your contribution will not only help our little cafe grow with success, you will also directly be contributing to the growth of other small businesses and non-profit organizations in the community.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that all of you may not be able to financially contribute - but maybe you know someone that can!  Spreading the word via social media - or even snail mail - we appreciate all word of mouth!  Bring a friend for lunch or pick up a 2 pack of donuts (for just $2) and share with someone who has never been to our Cafe.  It all counts - and matters more than you can ever know!

Yes this sounds low, but Missy put every penny she had into being able to get the shop up and running and now she needs help running it!  She's currently in talks with a local culinary institute to give paid training/experience to an eager-to-learn student, so that she can fill that pastry case with all of the delights she can't do while making eggs (and bacon, and sandwiches, and coffee, and...well...you get the point.)
 

The Impact

Many of you may be unaware but our Cafe is located smack dab in the middle of an awesome non-profit organization building.  Eggleston Services provides training, support, education and employment opportunities to persons with disabilities.  Eggleston is helping to change the lifestyle of those who may not have opportunities otherwise, by encouraging them to be independent as much as possible, and give them satisfaction of being able to grow as individuals financially and socially.  Our monthly rent goes directly to this organization and we interact with these individuals on a daily basis by providing them with low-cost snacks and beverages that they enjoy.  We pride ourselves in offering these individuals products that we do not profit off of, and also offering a discount to the hard-working staff that keep these individuals educated and happy on a daily basis.
 
 
We are also very eager to be able to hire a determined, excited culinary student - and hope to become a good partner for the institute.  Starting a small business is hard - especially when you wear all the hats.  We want to share this experience and help train the future chefs/small business owners of the world!  
 
Cafe M is proud to support local vendors - whether it be bottled Kombuchick teas, or produce from farms in VA - and we want to help their businesses thrive along with ours.  Your contribution will not only help our little cafe grow with success, you will also directly be contributing to the growth of other small businesses and non-profit organizations in the community.

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that all of you may not be able to financially contribute - but maybe you know someone that can!  Spreading the word via social media - or even snail mail - we appreciate all word of mouth!  Bring a friend for lunch or pick up a 2 pack of donuts (for just $2) and share with someone who has never been to our Cafe.  It all counts - and matters more than you can ever know!

story:
MESSAGE FROM KIM

I’m going home! I’m going home to my beloved Two-Pines farmhouse in Grey County.

Your amazing outpouring of generosity, support, and love is going to Bring Me Home!

Thanks to all of you! I am so grateful and amazed and honoured.

I want to thank so many people. I don’t know where to start. So here goes:

My incredible team for all their support:
Erin Moure who masterminded this whole campaign and gave so much time, encouragement, money and perks – she is brilliance, love, energy, poetry
Clive Holden who made the wonderful video
Robin Rich, Alissa York, Lisa Kiss, Vid Ingelevics, Maureen Feeney, Vera Frenkel for donating perks, money and time
Anne Egger, Kelly McCray, Kathleen Pirrie Adams for donating time and money

Cory Silverberg who gave us the benefit of his crowdfunding experience and advice

All those artists, writers and friends who donated perks:
Shary Boyle, Natalee Caple, Louise Dupré, Jordan MacLachlan, Shawna Dempsey & Lorri Millan, Lorna Mills, Cathy Ostlere, Vida Simon, Liz Phillips, Phil Hall, Oana Avasilichioaei, JonArno Lawson, Nicole Brossard, Sonja Greckol, Freda Guttman, Jowita Bydlowska, Hamish Buchanan, Contact Photography Festival, Prefix Magazine, C Magazine, Images Festival, Trinity Square Video, BookThug, One Little Goat/Tarragon Theatre, Rafael Goldchain, Bonnie Rubenstein & ROM, Sophie Hacket & AGO, Anthony Burnham & MACM, Windsong Ranch, Akimbo

MESSAGE FROM THE TEAM

Wow. Where to start? Where to find the words?

Bring Kim Home has been an incredible journey. Not just a campaign, not just crowdfunding.

Quite simply: we rallied to help Kim Fullerton. We ALL rallied! 398 donors onsite and another 8 offsite, 38 perksters, and 12 of us on the team. Kim will be able to roll into her own home again soon, thanks to you. And, incredibly, thanks to everyone, we exceeded our modest goal and collected a major chunk of funds to go toward the specialized vehicle that will put Kim back in the driver’s seat, restoring a big chunk of her independence.

And you. You’ve donated, returned to donate, claimed perks, donated perks, made comments, sent envelopes, letters, shared on Facebook, talked about Bring Kim Home to your friends, and everywhere the call was broadcast, it was heard: people responded, from Toronto, from all across Canada, from the USA, Spain, France.

We love you. Your response has made our hearts bigger, our spirits higher. We thank you and we will never forget what you have done.

At Bring Kim Home, none of us are the same people as we were on May 12, 2013 when we pressed the launch button. One of us, Clive Holden, created a marvellous video under time and equipment constraints that would have defeated many; the rest of us hashed out printed text to talk about our beloved Kim and her accident and recovery that led us to ask for your help. One idea obsessed us: That this immensely creative woman, this great colleague, friend, curator, writer, editor and outdoors enthusiast who has dedicated her life to supporting the visual arts, artists, and art and curatorial students, in Toronto and in Canada, and whose innovations are central to our world —Akimbo broadcasts, Akimbo.ca, Akimblog— could, with the skills she worked hard to gain and your generosity, actually return to her home, and get around, independently, in her wheelchair.

Thank you all! We did it! And in style! We hit the front page of Indiegogo and were nominated Campaign of the Day. Now, though BringKimHome the campaign is over, we’ll keep bringing you ability and art news and photos, and Kim news, at http://www.facebook.com/BringKimHome. Please do keep encouraging Kim, and sharing and learning more about this new perspective on the world! It’s not just Kim’s perspective, it’s ours.

Thank you again.

story:
Who Are We?

Comleak.com is a Social networking website, providing the best online experience.. But how do we differ from the rest?

Imagine an educational Social Networking system - that alleviated some of the bad and negatives that Facebook, twitter, instagram and others.. Have not, and cannot.
Comleak.com’s aim is to ensure that Online Networking shares purpose and interest to all, targeting all ages and types of people. 

Not only are we doing all that, but we want too make everything easier and give confidence to those who need it as a bonus.. How are doing this? Well we're helping people like so;
- Students/Workers lacking social confidence.
- Students/Workers going away and in need of contact, updates or notes.
- Students/Workers that don’t have the ability to be socially active.

 

What are we doing?

Comleak.com gives users the opportunity to have their own small website/blog + store within the website its self. Customizing their page and having future opportunity to earn money from this.

The Blog style profile is to enable easier viewing and searching of a user’s profile. To many times things get lost and hidden, making it near impossible to find things. 
The Blog style profile is also to have as a website function for the user themselves. They are given their own url based on their blog page name (Customization).. To share and link through school, work and even too friends. 
We wanted to ensure that the page could be used for more than just 1 purpose. We had brain stormed and found this the best possible way to be able to incorporate many styles of networking and education into a website.

Here are a few examples: 
Enables Philosophers to merely talk about and educate others on philosophy.
Allows a Fashion designer to show the world their label, and advertise.
A Teacher can get their students writing homework up online for say – History class, maths class, English class.

One of the things Comleak.com will provide, is granting Company’s, Businesses and Schools an online avenue for education and resource management by;
- Implementing a Group system. A group can be named whatever is deemed necessary by the creator and adding and removing people can also be done by an administrator in the group, or it can be an open invite environment. Only leaving the Admin to remove un-wanted people. 
- Implementing a system called "Chalkboard". Chalkboard is something that allows Company’s, Businesses and Schools to post important and relevant dates, times, meetings, class notes or class files to the Top of the page in a large heading format. This can be erased when irrelevant and edited at any time, much like a regular chalkboard! 
- Allowing Students to be able to upload work that they've done in hopes for advice or even work that is ready for submitting.
- Allowing Work colleagues to post about upcoming shifts, to swap shifts around easily, to post about workplace changes or information regarding shifts on offer over a certain busy period.
- Allowing ANYONE to be able to upload content regarding group projects or funny photos from work that week.


Comleak.com users also have the option of creating an online store. Selling an array of items. (In the near future)
Prices will vary depending on how many pages the user would like for their shop. 

There is much more in need of discussion, but that's a lecture best left for the development and going LIVE!!


The Impact We Intend On Having!

At Comleak.com we wanted to make education/social networking and owning your own store more fun!! - and show every individual that not only are their beliefs and work being viewed and acknowledged.. They enjoy posting about passions, enjoy asking questions, and enjoy gathering information as well as communicating on a simple social basis through comments, likes, groups and messages.

At Comleak.com we also intend on implementing user-run stores, for a cheap price per fortnight/month. The price will vary on how many pages the user needs for their online shop.


How Can You Help Us?

As we are independent, it’s very hard to lift up off the ground. So seeking assistance was our best option and everything and anything received is taken with great gratitude. 
Here is an outline of the costs we’re facing before becoming official.

$1080 - Programming and design edits.
$520 - Advertisements & Admin work.
Anything over and we'll give 50% to our donation cause below!
The other 50% for speeding up the time on becoming live, and adding to the finer details and extras that we can provide with the extra assistance.

We Believe In Giving Back!

http://www.amaze.org.au
http://www.autismawareness.com.au/


We're firm believers in giving back to the world.

Autism is a complex neurobiological disorder that typically lasts throughout a person's lifetime. People with ASD have problems with social and communication skills. Many people with ASD also have unusual ways of learning, paying attention, or reacting to sensations.

http://www.amaze.org.au

So a piece from you is a piece we're giving to them. Helping research and awareness on the matter. :)

Don’t you worry, Photos and Information will be given on our Facebook page in regards to this!


Other Ways You Can Help!

At Comleak.com, we know how hard funding or finding the means of payment can be. But you can still help!

We would love for you to share our page around at facebook.com/comleak
as well as sharing this page around to help us get assistance from others.

Your help is much appreciated, if you can appropriately message the Facebook page with the names of people you have had like the page for us. We'll shout you out, and will do it more than once if you're a repeat offender!

 

EVERY $1 OVER THE TARGET = $0.50 GOING TO AUTISM AWARENESS!!

 

Thank-you! Without your help and efforts, we wouldn't be able to pursue this campaign, and assist the lives of many unfortunate!

 

 @2013 - Comleak.com All rights reserved.

story:
About This Campaign

I am so excited to tell you about the changes at ReNew Organic Skin Care.  After  years of being in Hampden, where I have been providing skin care services and my own line of organic and vegan skin care products , I am moving and expanding my business.  This campaign will help to fund the expansion, which will include a retail store where I will provide a variety of natural and organic personal care items, as well as workspace to make my products.  I am currently making products in my home, which has been a challenge.

A Community Effort

I am very fortunate to have been chosen by the Hamilton-Lauraville Main Street Association as the first business in the incubator project they have created as part of a community redevelopment effort.  I will finally have a retail store and workspace in addition to a treatment room for skin care services… all under one roof.  To go along with the changes, I have changed the name of the business to ReNew Botanicals and redesigned my logo.

More About Me

For those of you not familiar with me, or ReNew, I am a master esthetician and aromatherapist.  I have been practicing skin care for over 21 years.  I have always been interested in helping the planet and helping others to realize that they can make a difference too. 

Why Eco-Friendly, Organic Products?

Over the years I became aware of how many skin care products contain toxic ingredients, that is why I decided to develop my own skin care line. 

Also, I know firsthand about chemical sensitivities and illnesses related to the environment, because I live with these every day.

My concept is to provide the community with safe, affordable, chemical and toxin- free, quality products and skin care services in one beautiful space.   In addition to my own organic and vegan skin care line and baby care line, I will be offering therapeutic and aromatherapy products. There will be also be handcrafted soaps, body butters, hair care and much more from regional artisans, all keeping a low carbon footprint and supporting the local economy. I eventually plan to host classes and lectures here for the community.

How Can You Help?

Between equipment and supply purchases, licensing, graphic design and other fees, I need roughly $7,500 to open this new space.  Your contributions will help in purchasing:

  •  $2,000 new logo design, label design and sign
  • $2,500 products and supplies
  • $2,500 to build a counter and displays
  • $500 permits, licenses, etc.

Any amount you give will help, and please take a look at the gifts you will receive for each donation level.

However, even if you cannot donate at this time, you can still help us by passing along this Indiegogo campaign to others who might be interested in my story or this project. Please tell everyone you know!  Please share… Post it to your Facebook wall, Tweet my link, Email your friends. 

 

Thank you so much,

Shelley

story:
------    Visit www.boxtakers.com!    ------

 

Are you ready for a web service with some community spirit and the idea that your every trip is a possibility to earn some extra money?

What is it?

One night couple of years ago I started to think a friend of mine who was at that time commuting about 120 miles every single day and spending lots and lots of money on that. And that actually we all have more or less regular routes we take either by cars, buses or trains. So basically we all form a huge but unutilized network of couriers which spreads to all communities, cities and countries all over the world.

Then I started to think about all the stuff that we are sending to each other - for example bikes, clothes and computers. We need to send goods to our friends, relatives, customers etc. who might live 10 or 100 miles away. We buy goods from online auction sites and we often need to arrange a delivery for those goods and many times it is hard and expensive to find a reliable and fast transportation method.

So, we have couriers and we have shippers. The only problem has been that they are not aware of each other. But now there is a solution, BoxTakers.com, a free to use web page where both individual people and companies are allowed to advertise their upcoming routes and shipments. Other users can then get advertiser's contact information and either ask or offer a delivery for the goods. The couriers are able to cover their traveling costs and the shippers have an easy and fast way to send goods and save the environment. No extra trips, no extra worries, just extraordinary service and some community spirit.

By using BoxTakers.com you have a possibility to start utilizing the courier network we all form and do good for yourself, your community and the environment.

 

Current situation and Your help?

The web page is already available at www.boxtakers.com and now we need to start active marketing to raise awareness of this site and attract more users. Our job is now to advertise BoxTakers.com to make sure that your ads in BoxTakers.com would get as much viewers as possible and you would be able to cover your traveling costs or arrange a delivery to your shipment as often as possible. Since the more users this service has the better it works.

Your contribution will be used for advertising BoxTakers.com. The contribution you give us will come straight back to you as the more users we have the more you have goods to deliver and deliveries to your shipments. This is your possibility to join building the future network which allows you to benefit from your own and other users' trips.

The aim is to arrange a targeted online advertising campaign with planned length of 3 months. Advertising will be focused on a few areas with a lot of active users at the time of the advertising start-up. This is to assure that the networks in active areas work on the best possible way and will start to expand when experiences of BoxTakers.com spread. So sign up on BoxTakers.com yourself and invite your friends too, since the more users your community has the more likely it is that your contribution will be used to raise awareness of BoxTakers.com in the area where you live in.

So together we will start to create BoxTakers-networks at a community level with the vision that someday these smaller networks reach each other and we have a global courier network in use.

The campaign can be executed as planned if the funding goal of $15,000 will be reached. If the goal is exceeded we can arrange a longer campaign with more areas included.

 

Perks?

It's all about the perks, isn't it? Since you already are able to use BoxTakers.com for free it would be hard to create site related discounts beating that. Thus we created few other perks and also thought to take concrete actions for the environment on behalf of you (see Perk 3).

Perk 1: We will create a Supporters-list into BoxTakers.com and every contributor will get his/her name to that list either on the Platinum, Gold, Silver or Bronze category as explained on the list of perks.

Perk 2: A thank you letter to express our gratitude.

Perk 3: Since one idea of BoxTakers.com is to save the environment we thought to add an environmentally friendly offer as this project's main perk. So, for the contributions of $25 and above a specified amount of carbon dioxide will be absorbed from the atmosphere by planting trees via web-based planting community. The trees will be planted to areas where deforestation is a problem so your contribution will prevent the general erosion at the same time.

Perk 4: For contributions of $100 and more you can do a selection; would you rather have some promotional material of BoxTakers.com or a Skype discussion with the founder of BoxTakers.com. If you choose the discussion, the topic is your call (as long as it's within the limits of good taste).

The specifications of each reward will be described better in the list of perks.

If you have any questions or comments, don't hesitate to contact us.

Willing to help in other ways?

Since our target is to get more users to our service there are also countless other ways to participate in this project. Some of those are listed below:

  • The most obvious one - sign up and invite your friends also. Be the first ones in your community to use and promote this site.
  • Like us on Facebook  
  • Share this project
  • Feeling creative and willing to show it? You can always create a short video explaining the idea of BoxTakers.com and send it to us. We can then post Your video to our YouTube channel (and don't forget to take credit of the video to yourself)...
  • Blog post or a short article about BoxTakers.com is always a good way to spread the word.
  • If our site is not having your country listed, please contact us and we'll add it there as soon as possible.

Above are listed only a few ways to participate in this project but when attracting new users basically anything promoting BoxTakers.com is a great help. At the end of the day it's still so that the word of mouth with good experiences is the fastest and most effective way to attract new users. So feel free to do anything promoting us.

Join to bring BoxTakers.com to life!
