And that actually we all have more or less regular routes we take either by cars, buses or trains. So basically we all form a huge but unutilized network of couriers which spreads to all communities, cities and countries all over the world.
Then I started to think about all the stuff that we are sending to each other - for example bikes, clothes and computers. We need to send goods to our friends, relatives, customers etc. who might live 10 or 100 miles away. We buy goods from online auction sites and we often need to arrange a delivery for those goods and many times it is hard and expensive to find a reliable and fast transportation method.
So, we have couriers and we have shippers. The only problem has been that they are not aware of each other. But now there is a solution, BoxTakers.com, a free to use web page where both individual people and companies are allowed to advertise their upcoming routes and shipments. Other users can then get advertiser's contact information and either ask or offer a delivery for the goods. The couriers are able to cover their traveling costs and the shippers have an easy and fast way to send goods and save the environment. No extra trips, no extra worries, just extraordinary service and some community spirit.
By using BoxTakers.com you have a possibility to start utilizing the courier network we all form and do good for yourself, your community and the environment.

 
Current situation and Your help?
The web page is already available at www.boxtakers.com and now we need to start active marketing to raise awareness of this site and attract more users. Our job is now to advertise BoxTakers.com to make sure that your ads in BoxTakers.com would get as much viewers as possible and you would be able to cover your traveling costs or arrange a delivery to your shipment as often as possible. Since the more users this service has the better it works.
Your contribution will be used for advertising BoxTakers.com. The contribution you give us will come straight back to you as the more users we have the more you have goods to deliver and deliveries to your shipments. This is your possibility to join building the future network which allows you to benefit from your own and other users' trips.
The aim is to arrange a targeted online advertising campaign with planned length of 3 months. Advertising will be focused on a few areas with a lot of active users at the time of the advertising start-up. This is to assure that the networks in active areas work on the best possible way and will start to expand when experiences of BoxTakers.com spread. So sign up on BoxTakers.com yourself and invite your friends too, since the more users your community has the more likely it is that your contribution will be used to raise awareness of BoxTakers.com in the area where you live in.
So together we will start to create BoxTakers-networks at a community level with the vision that someday these smaller networks reach each other and we have a global courier network in use.
The campaign can be executed as planned if the funding goal of $15,000 will be reached. If the goal is exceeded we can arrange a longer campaign with more areas included.
 
Perks?
It's all about the perks, isn't it? Since you already are able to use BoxTakers.com for free it would be hard to create site related discounts beating that. Thus we created few other perks and also thought to take concrete actions for the environment on behalf of you (see Perk 3).
Perk 1: We will create a Supporters-list into BoxTakers.com and every contributor will get his/her name to that list either on the Platinum, Gold, Silver or Bronze category as explained on the list of perks.
Perk 2: A thank you letter to express our gratitude.
 Perk 3: Since one idea of BoxTakers.com is to save the environment we thought to add an environmentally friendly offer as this project's main perk. So, for the contributions of $25 and above a specified amount of carbon dioxide will be absorbed from the atmosphere by planting trees via web-based planting community. The trees will be planted to areas where deforestation is a problem so your contribution will prevent the general erosion at the same time.
Perk 4: For contributions of $100 and more you can do a selection; would you rather have some promotional material of BoxTakers.com or a Skype discussion with the founder of BoxTakers.com. If you choose the discussion, the topic is your call (as long as it's within the limits of good taste).
The specifications of each reward will be described better in the list of perks.
If you have any questions or comments, don't hesitate to contact us.
Willing to help in other ways?
Since our target is to get more users to our service there are also countless other ways to participate in this project. Some of those are listed below:

The most obvious one - sign up and invite your friends also. Be the first ones in your community to use and promote this site.
Like us on Facebook    

Share this project
Feeling creative and willing to show it? You can always create a short video explaining the idea of BoxTakers.com and send it to us. We can then post Your video to our YouTube channel (and don't forget to take credit of the video to yourself)...
Blog post or a short article about BoxTakers.com is always a good way to spread the word.
If our site is not having your country listed, please contact us and we'll add it there as soon as possible.

Above are listed only a few ways to participate in this project but when attracting new users basically anything promoting BoxTakers.com is a great help. At the end of the day it's still so that the word of mouth with good experiences is the fastest and most effective way to attract new users. So feel free to do anything promoting us.
Join to bring BoxTakers.com to life!

story:
About Me

As a friend I have watched the Danlers go through terrible trials over the past month. This is my attempt to make the mountains they still have to climb a bit easier.

A Little Background

In 2004 Kirsten was diagnosed with a benign pituitary tumor, which was removed surgically through her nose. What remained grew and was removed. It grew again and was removed via craniotomy surgery, followed by radiation therapy in 2010.

A few weeks ago Kirsten started dropping weight, becoming weak, and experienced reduced cognitive function and became occasionally confused. A month or so ago she was at work and became disoriented and was sent to the emergency room. She had dangerously low potassium. After a while she was released. Then she slipped on a stool and cut her shin. When the wound wouldn’t heal, she visited her primary care physician, who was alarmed. After consults and tests she was diagnosed with Type I Diabetes. This has been disruptive.

Kirsten spends all her time trying to count carbs and prepare meals according to her dietitian’s recommendations. She continues to drop weight: a few pounds between each doctor visit. Then, on Friday, she missed an appointment with her endocrinologist who specializes in diabetes, which is very out of character. When I talked to her she told me she became scared while driving due to overwhelming confusion regarding her surroundings. She spoke with her doctor on the phone, who called an ambulance.

Kirsten is the mother of three girls, 9, 11, and 13. She was recently earned her BS in Nursing and was studying for the boards to become an RN when she was diagnosed with Cushing's and diabetes. She is a nursing unit secretary at Maine Medical Center.

The Current Situation

Kirsten was admitted to the hospital on August 17 due to symptoms related to Cushing's Syndrome, diabetes, confusion and low weight. While admitted she fell and crushed her C5 vertebrae resulting in paralysis of part of her right arm and emergency surgery. Once she was stablized and doctor's could concentrate on her original set of symptoms they decided to remove her adrenal glands. As a result of this surgery, Kirsten had uncontrollable internal bleeding, which was yet another moment that death was too close for this sweet family. Kirsten is now stable and in a rehabilitation hospital.

On the same day that Kirsten was admitted, her husband, Brent, was cleaning out his office and preparing to start a new job on Monday. He had to delay starting this new job for weeks while he was necessarily involved in Kirsten's rapidly changing situation as an advocate, father, and husband. 

Of course, everyday life has been happening too--end of summer camps for the girls, the start of school, etc. 

What's Next

After a neck fracture, post-surgery intubation, bilateral adrenalectomy, and embolization to stop post-surgery internal bleeding, Kirsten is finally on a very positive trajectory toward recovery. There are still many difficult challenges ahead, and the road to full strength will be long, but progress is quick and Kirsten becomes more independent each day.

The Danlers aren't sure what medical costs will be for Kirsten's current treatment nor what she will need ongoing. It's pretty certain that Kirsten will not be working like she was previously and so overall household income will decrease while financial obligations increase. We're setting $5,000 as a modest goal to relieve a little bit of pressure. we hope that much more can be raised.

We're not offerring any perks because this isn't a start-up, it's people's lives in a very serious time. You can know that there is tremendous gratitude from the Danlers for your generosity, and that your support makes a huge financial, emotional, and psychological impact. 

Funding will be used at the Danler's discretion towards medical bills, rent, groceries, etc. 

The Impact

Relieving a portion of the burden on the Danler's means that there can be a few more smiles during difficult times. Your contribution, however much, means a lot.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you can contribute or not, please spread the word. 

FYI-Payments are directed through Brent Danley's (Kirsten's husband) paypal account. If you have any questions please let me know. -Adam

story:
300 million girls and women are under monthly house arrest because of menstruation. In most of the world as we know it, menstruation has become a non-issue. We believe it should be that way for women in rural India as well.

At present, these 300 million have no access to female hygiene products such as pads and tampons. While these products are readily available in urban areas, they rarely make their way to villages due to the lack of distribution channels. In the rare cases that they do, most of the demographic in rural India cannot afford them.

Back in February 2011, Ameet and Dhiren found that menstruation was keeping girls out of school. It isn’t uncommon for “becoming a woman,” or the onset of menstruation, to be synonymous with dropping out of school. Meanwhile, women are unable to go to work when they are on their periods. Resourcefulness leads them to fashion homemade alternatives. But compared to what we find in drugstores, these are ineffective and unhygienic.

We have designed 100% biodegradable pads that can be sold 40% cheaper than existing solutions, and a machine that will produce them. But we need your help to improve this prototype machine so that we can turn our business plan into reality. More efficient machines will enable us to produce at a scale that can make a real impact. When our machine is completed, we will start working with rural communities in India to distribute the machines and begin production.

Our vision is a world where women and girls can have greater freedom to pursue life’s opportunities. Making menstruation a non-issue is one of the stepping stones. With your support, girls can stop missing school and women will be able to support themselves and their families regardless of the time of the month. Be part of the solution.

 

All the funds we raise will go towards research and development for our machine or to other immediate needs to operationalize our business, such as building out our distribution network [of female entrepreneurs]. Raising our goal of $65,000 through this campaign will keep us on track with our timeline for operations in 2013.

We will keep you updated as to how we allocate our funds as we operationalize our business.

 

We have received backing of $50,000 and are currently one of the companies selected to be part of Chicago’s first social impact driven incubator, The Impact Engine. This project is supported by a full set of experienced mentors.


Our team is committed to solving this problem. With full teams in Chicago and India, we have been working day and night to solve this problem. The solution is within sight and we want you to be a part of it. Azadi means freedom and independence - fundamental rights that we should all share.

If you are unable to back us financially, there are other ways you can help us create awareness of this issue:
  • Back us with a tweet or share our Indiegogo video.
  • Follow us on Twitter or Like us on Facebook.
  • Send us an email (hello@azadipads.com) if you are interested in helping in any other way.

Thank you for your support!
स्वतंत्रता

azadipads.com

story:
Welcome Home..where's my kids?

I am starting this campaign for a dear friend. She needs a lawyer. Actually she needs two. I have known Angel for about 6 years and I know she is a great mother and has always taken great care of her children and what is being done to her is a total outrage.

Angel returned home from a year long deployment to Afghanistan as a soldier in the Army to find out that she was being served custody papers from her children's fathers because she was gone for a year!

There is a law that protects soldiers from being served custody papers from the other party while they are deployed but THERE IS NO LAW protecting them once they hit the ground in the U.S. She had a care plan set up for the fathers to take the children while she was deployed and then custody was to be returned once she returned home. They didn't give the kids back.  Not only did they not give the kids back but they didn't even bring the kids to welcome her home when she returned..

Anyone that knows her knows that this whole thing is outrageous however the fathers have a good chance of winning because the children have been living with their fathers for a year BECAUSE SHE WAS DEPLOYED!! She just wants her kids back and her life back the way it was before she deployed... but now needs a good lawyer to help her fight! She fought for us while deployed, now lets fight for her! She needs a good lawyer to fight the insanity of all of this. Can you imagine being deployed to another country as a service member and being welcomed home this way??

 

 Welcome Home?

If no one stands up to say this is wrong, this could happen to ANY soldier deployed overseas....your brother, your sister, your son, your daughter, your aunt, your uncle, your friend....or maybe even to you...

 

This is her story in her words:

 When I found out I was being deployed, I arranged for my children to stay with their fathers until I returned. I have two girls (9 and 7) with my ex-husband in NY where I'm from and a son (4) with my ex-boyfriend in NJ. At the time I had a very civil relationship with my ex-husband, and an excellent relationship with my son's father. Although he lived in NJ, he visited my son as often as he could, making a 5 hour drive up about every other weekend. He stayed at my house, ate my food and spent time with my girls and I. When I found out that I was deploying to Afghanistan, I made the arrangements for the children to stay with their dads and left with confidence that I would get them when I returned. Due to my divorce, I had full custody of my girls with shared legal. I had a military family care plan done to ensure that they would be taken care of while I was away. With my son, it was a little more complicated. Due to the fact that we were never married I never had legal paperwork done. He just always lived with me. When I was 5 months pregnant, his father left me and decided he didn't want to have anything to do with him. After he was born I contacted him to tell him if he didn't want to be in his life than to sign his rights away to me. So he sent me a signed paper stating he didn't want to be in his life and didn't want any responsibility, financial or otherwise, of my son. So I filed a petition in court, but after giving it more thought, I was upset and sad that my son wouldn't have a father. So I contacted him again, asking him to reconsider and to just meet him, knowing he would change his mind. So he did, and he did. From that point on, we once again became close and he was always a wonderful father. While I was deployed I web-cammed with the kids as much as they would allow and I was able to. When I returned to the states I received an email from both of them stating that they were filing for custody and I wasn't allowed to pick them up. There was never any indication that they were planning this together, and to this day, I don't know why. I was completely blind-sided by the whole thing. I received many offers to help, but nobody has followed through. I went to both initial court hearings alone, without a lawyer, and lost temporary custody of them all due to the fact that "they had a year long routine already". I can't afford a lawyer because the money I saved was to set a house back up when I returned. I have spent a good bit of it driving back and forth to NJ from Upstate NY, and I'm mentally, emotionally physically and financially exhausted. I can't believe in my country, the country I love and serve, this can happen. I've lost faith in people, and don't know where to turn. I have spent days on end trying to find someone who will help me. I still have no help. It comes down to money an how much I can offer. I just don't have it. I missed my children for that year I was away more than you'll ever know, and am missing them terribly more so now that they are within reach, and I still can't hold them. They are, and always have been, everything to me.

They are, and always have been, everything to me.

story:
Short Summary

Chantra helped bring Startup Weekend to Cambodia with the intention to bring the opportunity of Entrepreneurism to all Cambodians. Startup Weekend organizes a yearly Global Summit to allow all organizers around the world to meet and share ideas. Startup Weekend are covering the expenses at the event but not the ticket. Please help us to raise money so that Chantra can go to this years summit.

  • Chantra is involved with the local community here. He has organized Startup Weekend, Barcamp and other events.

  • Enabling Chantra to visit the Global Summit in Rio will allow him to get a global perspecive and share ideas with his peers.

  • This will allow Chantra to run even better Startup Weekend events here in Cambodia - reaching out to more Cambodias and helping kick start a tech startup scene.

Chantra will also attend the Global Entrepreneurship Conference immediately after the SOSummit: http://gec2013.com/en

What We Need & What You Get

Startup Weekend are kindly organizing this event in Rio for all organizers around the world.

  • Startup Weekend are providing 4 days and nights expenses (including Hotel).

  • What we need is the air fare and some additional expenses to cover the cost of the trip.

  • The air fare from Cambodia to Rio is approx. $2500

  • Chantra will need an additonal $1000 for an extra few days accomodation and expenses to ensure that he is safe and comfortable during the trip.

Pictures from tha last SOSummit in 2012

Chantra has never been to an SOSummit. However, here are pictures and some details from last years event in Austin, TX:

http://startupweekend.org/2012/03/14/sosummit-2012/

story:
Hello All!

The Universe is in a constant state of expansion and it doesn't cost a dime.  Open Door Yoga is expanding and, well, it's costing a bit more.  An organically growing and prosperous business doesn't sound like much of a problem to most people, right?  Well, here's the thing:  Our need to expand into a larger space has simply grown faster than our capital has to be able to fund the next phase of our development.  Here's our story...

About ODY
Open Door Yoga, located in Raleigh, NC, is a hot Hatha yoga studio dedicated to providing a comfortable, judgement-free space for people of all backgrounds, body types, personalities and lifestyles to feel welcomed and supported while practicing yoga.  In addition to the many newcomers and first-timers we get regularly, we have also attracted a diverse crowd of regular practitioners who enjoy the improved quality of life and general well-being they receive from the physical, mental and medical benefits of a regular yoga practice. 

My name is Monica Shannon.  I am the founder of Open Door Yoga.  I began teaching yoga over 10 years ago.  It has been my fulltime life's passion and by now, I am pretty darn good at it!  When I opened Open Door, one of my main goals was to make sure ANYONE who wanted to practice yoga, could do so.  When I was new to yoga, I had to clean the studio I practiced at in order to afford taking classes.  I really wanted to create a studio that was accessible in more than one way.  Within two years of opening, I was able to switch to a completely donation based system.  We simply leave a jar on our front desk and folks pay what they can. 

Many folks are skeptical of the donation system.  But over the years I have seen that even though some folks pay only a few bucks for a class and some pay as much as $15, it all balances out.  The average donation is consistently around $10 per class.  I receive emails weekly from folks who are very appreciative...the donation system is the only reason they are able to afford a daily practice.  And, many of them feel their practice is what keeps their lives moving forward.  

In the last few years we have continued to grow faster than I could have ever imagined!   As we were turning folks away from full class rooms, I could see the writing on the wall:  Grow or die! 


But our current space only allows for a limited amount of people...and so our income potential is also limited.  Raising capital has been slow.  

By the spring of 2012 I had managed to save around $20,000.  I had a small credit line, some credit cards and promises from my family to help if needed.  I felt prepared.  Ha!

I began the actual expansion project when the space next door became available.  Demolition and design began almost immediately.  Everything seemed very do-able.  By all accounts it seemed like a simple project.  But, then my HVAC contractor called me up one day and informed me that the ventilation requirements based on the number of people we could fit in the new room were different than he and the engineer had anticipated.  I was now going to have to purchase a $63,000 piece of machinery that is basically a fancy Energy Recovery Unit (ERV).  Paired with the radiant heat panels...this is our heating system.  The heat is the core of our business...it's one of the reasons why people come to us.  I was already in ankle deep and the waters of change were quickly rising. 

So, I acquired some money from my super supportive family members and have been able to keep it going.  So far, I have used my savings in addition to the contribution from my family to pay for the demolition, insulation, new sub floor, the extra bathroom, mirrors, yoga floor and the hole in the wall that will connect the new space to the old space.  But, soon, I will need more help to get it finished.  I still have quite a bit of electrical work to do in addition to paying for the giant "ERV. " 

As a contributor to this project you will be supporting the continuation of community-based yoga studio that has been a stepping stone for SO MUCH positive change in peoples lives.  Open Door is the type of place where people come to literally change their lives:  To get their health in control, to grieve losses, to figure out that next step or to simply learn to love themselves.  It is the type of place where grandmothers come with their grandchildren and where I sometimes see opposing local politicians  practicing in the same class.  We are a community where people do things everyday that they never knew they could do.  


If you believe in empowering your community by helping people learn to care for themselves; if you believe in family owned and operated small business, then Open Door is the type of place you can feel happy to support.  

Below you will see an explanation of how the money will be used.  And below that you will see the description of our incentives.

No amount of money is too little or too big.  Please help by contributing any amount you can and/or passing this on to your family and friends. 

The industrious "sharer" who leads to the highest level of contributions will win One Year of FREE YOGA!  So share on! Share with your friends and family, co-workers and neighbors.  Just please make sure you are looged in to Indiegogo before you share...it's the only way to have your shares and resulting contributions tracked!

Thank you so much for reading this.  I, we, Open Door appreciates every effort to help us to continue to grow and serve our community.
story_txt:

The Universe is in a constant state of expansion and it doesn't cost a dime.  Open Door Yoga is expanding and, well, it's costing a bit more.  An organically growing and prosperous business doesn't sound like much of a problem to most people, right?  Well, here's the thing:  Our need to expand into a larger space has simply grown faster than our capital has to be able to fund the next phase of our development.  Here's our story...

story:
KidWideWeb - Revolutionizing the way Children Experience the Web

 

Statistics Don't Lie

Studies show that kids start surfing pornography as young as five years old and by the time they are teenagers four out of five have regularly spent time on inappropriate sites.

The average age of first exposure to Internet pornography is 9, some as early as 5—onenewsnow.com

Teens spend in excess of 87 hours a year looking at porn online—The Daily Mail  

One in five children online is approached by a sexual predator—Dateline NBC 

The results of parents inability to deal with this issue can be tragic: Her teen committed suicide over ‘sexting’: Cynthia Logan’s daughter was taunted about photo she sent to boyfriend—MSNBC.com  

 

What Options Do Parents Have?

Parents should talk openly and often to their kids about their internet use, about both the benefits and its pitfalls.  Parents should personally monitor their children's internet use and history at least once a week, if not more.  And parents should attempt to control their children's internet use by installing some kind of internet security software or parental controls.  The problem is that despite parents' best efforts, their diligence is often thwarted by the use of substandard internet security products and parental controls that use ineffective and often outdated filtering technologies.

 

MORE ABOUT THE PROBLEM

Since the internet does not have a ratings system for its sites, like with motion pictures, the question becomes: from predators to porn to cyber-bullying, as parents and responsible adults, how do we deal with our children’s unfettered access to the internet?  So far, no internet security technology has adequately addressed these very serious problems. There is no internet program that differentiates the age of the internet user and that does not make sense because a 6yr old sees the world very differently than a 9yr old, and a 9yr old sees it much different than a 12yr old, so they shouldn't have the same internet access.  And that is why we have developed the KidWideWeb.

 

OUR MISSION

Our mission is to give our children the opportunity to experience all of the benefits and wonderment of the internet, in an age-appropriate environment, while shielding our children from dangerous, inappropriate content and communications.

 

THE KIDWIDEWEB

The KidWideWeb, several years in the making, is an application that provides safe, age appropriate Internet access to children while shielding them from all malicious content and communications.  To achieve this goal, KWW is backed by a team of educators, technology experts, and concerned parents who have spent countless hours working to make this vision a reality.  KWW is now working with IDEAS of Orlando, a former division of Disney Studios and also the University of Central Florida(UCF) as part of their award-winning Business Development Program.  

 

With powerful allies such as these, ongoing support from our existing base, and with your help in pushing us over the edge, we will surely make this vision a reality.  

 

OUR TECHNOLOGY

To achieve this goal, KWW employs a multi-prong strategy featuring a security component, on-line policy control and safe social networking.  The security component is achieved through our proprietary Wizard Lock Security, which restricts access by throwing a protective bubble around your child while on the internet, making it virtually impossible for your child to land in an inappropriate site.  

This security feature is also different from other filtering products in that it does not try to interpret ever-changing content coming from a dynamic Internet to determine whether the content is safe or not. Instead, the application will restrict access to trusted content that has been reviewed and approved by trained analysts and an active artificial intelligence model that automates the approval system. The approval system is divided by age and the software is separately designed for age groups of 4 to 6, 7 to 8, 9 to 10, 11 to 12, and 13 to 14.  The content for KWW is a blend of Internet technologies including HTML, Flash and streaming media (some features being redesigned and added near term).  The approved content is categorized and matched to the child so that the child receives age-appropriate content and sites that include games, education, sports, secure email, secure chat, secure text, and secure social media.  While the access includes millions of web pages and sites, the key phrase here again is “age appropriate”. 

By simply entering a code, parents have the ability to override the controls in KWW and may turn off security to allow open, unfettered access to the Internet. And this can be done remotely.  In addition, parents can override the content restrictions within KWW to allow a child to view specific content not on KWW’s age-appropriate content listing, or parents can further restrict access.  

For a more detailed description and sample of our award-winning, patent pending technology, please click on the Gallery link above for our corporate/parent video

 

OUR THOUGHTS

As a company, we believe so strongly that parents and our children need the KidWideWeb, our officers and directors, family and friends, have contributed over $1 million to help us develop our secure internet platform. We need only $200,000 more to upgrade our software and redesign our interface in order to complete what we started several years ago. 

The updates and redesign will be accomplished by a group of highly talented and skilled technology experts, aided by our strategic partnership with IDEAS of Orlando, a former division of Walt Disney Inc., and through our participation in the University of Central Florida’s award-winning Business Incubator Program.  IDEAS gives us the creative expertise that only a Disney experienced group can provide, and UCF's Incubation Program gives us access to the university's extensive resources, including its programming talent pool, its cutting edge equipment and technology, as well as its numerous business affiliations and partnerships. Together, with your help and contributions, we can make the internet safer, for all of our children.  The KidWideWeb- "Taking Control of the Internet, One Child at a Time!!"

 

FAQ's

How do I get the product and can I use it on a cell phone?

  • The software will be available to download off our site and it will be available on all media platforms including desktop, laptop, tablet, mobile phones, and gaming systems

Do I need to get more than one subscription if I have 2 or more kids?

NO, one subscription should be all you need per household.  It can be downloaded to 3 separate devices and used for up to 6 logins per device...that is a desktop can handle 6 different users, with 6 separate logins and accesses.  More than one person can share the same login, but they will then have the same internet access. A single subscription is designed to accommodate most every family size.

As a parent, do I need a secure login and what access will I have?

  • Yes, any person sharing the same internet device, will need his own login as he/she tries to access the internet.  Once the internet is requested, a login screen will appear.  For a parent or adult, logging in will automatically turn off all security features and the full internet will be at your disposal.

Is the system subject to being hacked?

  • Our system is a completely closed system in that the only sites available are there because we put them there.  Since the system has been built from the ground up and we are not using filters, which by their very nature can be circumvented (just google "how to hack and insert the name of any filtering technology "), our system is virtually impossible to hack.  If an attempt is made to circumvent the security software, the internet "breaks" figuratively, and will not work at all until an administrator, or a parent, resets the system.  The parent then immediately gets a notification as to what sites were trying to be accessed and what areas were attempted to be compromised.

What about viruses and malware?

  • Since our system contains only the sites that we have approved, and those sites get checked for virus and malware before they are added to our content pool, it is unlikely that any of our sites will contain any viruses or malware.

Can we guarantee the security of the sites?

  • With the ever-changing world of the internet where the good guys are always trying to keep up with the bad guys, it is impossible to guarantee.  However, since our model is differentiated from all others in that we do not filter sites, but rather add them from a clean slate, we feel confident that our system gives the user the best and most consistent access to only those sites that are requested and nothing else. 

How quickly can changes and access be made and access granted, if needed?

  • Changes can be made and access granted remotely, in seconds, from any internet enabled device.

 

How much will it cost?

  • Our preliminary pricing is set at $9.99 per month, per household.  Each household can use this subscription for a maximum of 3 devices depending on the plan.  For example, use on a laptop, tablet, and cell phone...all for the one price.

story:
About us

My friend and I see the need for a better format of software design. Small and start up companies can't afford to do all the work to make software or to run their website, so we want to be the third party to make that process easy. Kind of like a go to group for anything related to designing and making software or websites.

 

Services offered:

Software design
Website design
Logo design
Software production
Website production
 

What We Need & What You Get!

We are hoping for at least $1000 to help us get started.
This goes to:

- A business license
- Website & email hosting
- Sign on bonus for additional programmers
- Marketing funds Our perks for donating include:

Between $1 and $25 - A personal email thanking you for your support
Between $25 and $50 - A personal letter thanking you for your support
Between $50 and $100 - A mention on our site for contributing and thank you letter
Over $100 - A more prominent mention on our site, and a personal thank you letter
Over $500 - A very prominent mention on our site, personal letter, and a project of your choice. Maybe a personalized application?

If we don't reach our goal, the funds we do get go to:

- A business license
- As much web/email hosting as possible
- As much marketing funding as possible
 

The impact we plan to make

Our company would allow small businesses and individuals to create their own software, plug-in, operating system or website without doing all the messy coding.
All at an affordable price.
Our goal is to limit the necessity of trying to find someone experienced in the work you need to help you with your project, with the possibility of not being exactly what you're looking for.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help us directly, please tell friends who might be willing to donate.

If you are a group looking into our services, please consider funding our start up so we can help you with your project as soon as possible!
